description:
One of the EXTREMELY RARE places in the city that I've seen Banh Cuon on the menu, and it is pretty amazing.

All of the noodle soups (that I've had) here are pretty good and a tad above standard. Perfect comfort food in the neighborhood and they have been around for many years.

My go-to:
Pho Dac Biet
The broth is PERFECT and they are pretty generous with the meat. The noodles are always deliciously chewy and they never skimp on portions.

Thai Iced Tea
Flavorful and sweet, just right.


On rotation:
Banh Cuon Cha Lua
Well-seasoned ground pork and fungi rolled into a fresh and chewy rice noodle sheet. This dish is a rare find in SF and it definitely hits the spot.

Bun Bo Hue
The bbh broth here leans a tad more clear than most places and while it's not as flavorful as one would like it to be, it's a surprisingly refreshing alternative to the better known version.

For the most part, I like everything that I've tried from here, which is actually quite a lot considering I've been in this neighborhood for most of my life. The only things that I'm truly not a fan of are their Banh Mi. I can't pinpoint exactly what I don't like but generally it's the bread they use and the flavor overall.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
Such slow service. And the food wasnt that amazing... 
At least kevins pho is fast and speedy. Yummy yummy is delicious and FAST with service. Our water came at the 3/4 of our meal. This place wasnt even crowded and every single waiter / waitress we asked was busy, but when we asked for the check they came back in a snap.

Chicken pho was meh, not much flavor. 
Pork chops over rice were standard. Their fish sauce was good. 
We also ordered pho tai, soup was meh, i woulda have just went somewhere else if i knew it tasted like that. 
We also ordered 2 viet sandwiches, pork combo, it was good.
author: Amiee C.

description:
I love Pho Ha Tien (and their prices) so much that every time I go on a trip I stop by Pho Ha Tien to bring a Banh Mi or two to go. I get the tofu banh mi and it's my favorite in San Francisco (and a $4 dinner doesn't hurt).

I even brought it up to Tahoe with me. A real winner ;)
author: Sydney G.

description: Great find and well priced. We were over at the mall and wanted pho. It was our first time here. Large portions and delicious broth. My fiancé had a price of tendon is his soup that wasn't fully cooked but otherwise so good. We would have forgot our leftover imperial rolls if the server didn't run outside.... that was super nice of him. Parking sucks but if you're looking for good pho at an amazing price you can't beat this place. Apparently they have fresh crab and garlic noodles here. Want to try that next.
author: Angela T.

description: This is my go to place for a quick meal or take out.  The pho is average but hits the spot when I'm craving pho. It's in the neighborhood so it's convenient.
author: Kenji M.

description: I really like to eat this noodles. Every time I come here, I will order this noodle. It is sour and sour, so special. The coffee is also rich and delicious, and it is more delicious than the coffee outside!
author: Lan T.

description:
SATE BEEF, YES PLEASE.

If you like coconut milk, please try the sate beef. It's pho like no other. The noodle includes beef slices, cucumber, chopped peanuts, and a creamy broth which is coconut milk based. I never had anything like this anywhere else! It's seriously SO good.
author: Melody W.

description:
Pho here was average and the service was below par. Ordered the rare steak beef pho and asked the server if they had any cilantro? She responded saying she couldn't speak English and didn't proceed to find any servers that could. Ended up just letting it go.

If you just need a quick fix of pho this place will do, but you can definitely find higher quality if you go elsewhere.
author: Lauren P.

description:
I may be biased because this is the closest/walkable pho from my place and also the only thing that cures my hangover but I love this place. 

It's a very close knit family owned restaurant and the service is just like any ordinary small Asian service. You order, eat and pay- if you need anything just flag them down (don't think it's rude because it's not, they're just busy but don't forget to be sweet to them because they will always take care of you when you come again)! 

I used to get the pho (brisket and tendon) but they recently got rid of the tendon so just loads of brisket now!! My friend swears by the combo ban mi and the vermicelli bowls. I always want to opt out to try the dry bowls but I just loveeeee my pho. Maybe one day, maybe never ;)

PS. Their watermelon juice is fresh af, which is another secret of mine after a night of drinking, or just refreshing after a hot day -your pick
author: Frances K.

description:
I'm pretty close by, but have avoided coming here like the plague because of their lackluster pho and rude service. This used to be the not so great and "more expensive" pho place, at least compared to Irving Street, but now all of the pho prices are kind of the same.

Still, don't come here for pho. The broth is bland and entirely dependent on hoisin sauce.

DO COME here for banh cuon- it's not as easy to find in SF as it is in San Jose or Westminster/626, and is actually done really well here. If you don't know what it is, they are these thin, almost translucent rice rolls (not rice paper though) wrapped around meat or another filling. You eat it with greens, pork meatloaf, fish sauce; it's a light but filling and tasty meal for sure.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Not the best pho place in sf but the closest one you'll find in this area


If you're hungry and in this area and want pho this is the spot to go
author: Chiu H.

description:
One of the better pho places in the area in my opinion. Some days the pho broth is super flavorful, other days it's kind of oily. Today was one of their better days for sure!

The bad thing? They totally skimped on the Vietnamese Iced Coffee.
author: Susan H.

description:
I use to come here a lot but I have gave this place numerous attempts to produce the right dishes. I always order the grilled pork and egg rolls over rice.
And each time the grilled pork is not even warm. This kills my meal because it's not freshly grilled pork , they must have microwaved the pork and put that on my dish and that tastes nasty because I didn't come to eat microwaved grilled pork, this shows the pork was made before hand and refrigerated and they serve that to a costumer! This place can improve on their health scores , it's not very clean. The pho is bland here. No thanks!
author: Russell T.

description: Love this local spot for the pho! Total family owned business, which I love in SF. The ambience is a hole in the wall spot which could use a little work but the food is really good! I only order a couple things that I like: the sate beef, veggie pho or chicken potato curry. Had a friend try the chicken pho once and thought it wasn't special. Noodle bowls are good too, and I just haven't tried there banh mi yet. The service is relaxed but I don't mind it because I'm not going in to have pho in a rush. Lots of times I'll order something over the phone and pick it up and they are quick.
author: Stacy j.

description: Nice Vietnam noodles！ I tried number1 today. Its soup is great！It contains different kinds of beef，which can give you different taste. One number 1 is really enough for a meal. Enjoy！
author: Ying C.

description:
As a Vietnamese American growing up in East Side San Jose, probably biggest concentration of Vietnamese in the Bay Area, I know a thing or two about pho. 

I got a Pho Tai and it was decent nothing worse than what I would have in East Side San Jose imo. Surprisingly it's also a lot cheaper than San Jose. The big con about this place is the service, pretty much nonexistent after they bring you your food.

Pros
- Cheap
- Decent Pho

Cons
- Service
author: Michael D.

description:
It is decent food. 

I came here first after the gym because it was close by. I ordered the pho and thought that it was good. The soup base is decent and the noodles were good too. 
Then I came here again due to a request from a friend. We ordered the banh xeo and the banh coun. I think that the banh xeo was good. It was a lot of bean sprouts, but the batter was good. The crispiness was on point. The banh coun was good. It was really soft and it was served with the boiled ham, bean sprouts, and vegetables. It was good. I would probably order this again.
Our server was also nice. He stayed on top of the orders. 

I would come again, but not on my own accord. The food is good but nothing amazing. It's a good sub when I want something cheap and don't want to cook.
author: Tina Y.

description:
I came here with some of my friends after taking the SAT, it was really  busy when we got there. Luckily, we didn't have to wait for seats like some other parties. 

Our table felt sticky, but that didn't bother me too much. I got a beef rice plate. When my order came, it was extremely underwhelming. My plate consisted of four slices of marinated beef, a mountain of rice, fish sauce, and couple of sad looking vegetables. The rice was not very hot, it was a little hard, as if they left the rice out for a while. The beef was flavorful, although a bit chewy. 

Overall, if you come here, I wouldn't recommend getting a rice plate.
author: Donald C.

description: This is our local go to place in Ocean Ave. you get a  good hardy meal. Love there 5 spice chicken, and curry plates, Enjoy there Pho on those chilly days, we find our selfs there at least twice a month. Often will stop to get a banh mi sandwich for our dinner to take home. Just come with a attitude that there might be line and have to wait 10 to 15 min. During lunch, Sunday's, some evenings, but will worth it
author: Greg L.

description:
My family and I had a late dinner here after a long day of exploring San Francisco. I was honestly excited because I was craving Pho all day, but when we turned into the location, I had mixed feelings about it.

It's a small little restaurant right off the a busy street so you have to find street parking. When we entered, no one greeted us and it was not busy at the time. We asked if we could just take their biggest table because there was 10 of us. They cleaned off two big tables to fit my whole family. 

Once seated, it took a while for one of the servers to ask us for drinks so when they finally came by to ask for drinks, we also ordered our food all at once. 

We ordered egg rolls and individual Pho. The egg rolls were not good at all. It tasted like someone had fried it in oil that had been used for the past few days. It did not look appetizing either. I just ordered Pho with rare steak and it literally tasted like boiled water with noodles and pieces of meat. The soup was very bland. 

Overall, the service and the atmosphere of the place was not appetizing. Maybe it was just a bad night for everyone working there, but I don't think I would come back to this Pho restaurant again.
author: Ada C.

description: A lot of people have always hated on this place since I can remember. Been a loyal customer due to being raised in the Ingleside district of San Francisco and this was the only pho place for a long time back in the day before they got rid of kragen auto parts and put up those silly looking studio apartments. Now there's 4 or 5 places to get pho in that neighborhood but none of them compare nor should be compared to this local gem. Hope this place is around as long as I am, and I'm here at least two times in a month. None the less a number 2 is my fav. Sometimes I'll get the #1 when I know I can scarf it all down. Rice plates are really good here too as well as their buhn mis sandwiches. Also if you like a good pho place in the sunset check out lous on Irving street this is the only one place I would substitute for Pho Ha Tien and still be satisfied!!
author: Tofu S.

description:
Okay. I'm gonna be 100% honest and say there are better pho or bun places than this in San Francisco. HOWEVER, I must say the Bánh cun and the rare beef appetizer are bomb. 

I'm gonna put a disclaimer even though it shouldn't matter --- I'm Vietnamese (shock, I joke), it's really pointless for me to even review another pho place after growing up going back and forth from Westminister (SoCal) and San Jose (NorCal). No place really makes better pho than these two places. But I've had better pho and bun around San Francisco. 

Since this place is focused on the noodles. I say meh, pass most definitely. Take Muni to Irving Street. 

Service: Great!
Noodles (pho/bun): Meh
Other dishes: Give it a try!!!
author: Ann N.

description: I love going here for the Catfish soup. It's my favorite dish, especially when it's cold. I also order rice on the side. It's an amazing combo action. The flavors are enriching. It's also healthy since I'm eating fish. I go to the gym next door, then afterwards I hop over here to fatten up
author: James N.

description:
The Banh Cuon at this place is delicious (#60)! You must come and try it! I was craving it and didn't know where to go and I found this gem on yelp and decided to come try it. It definitely did not disappoint.

I came here around 5 and there wasn't a wait and we parked in the neighborhood around the corner (got lucky and found a spot). I would come here again and try something new or get #60 again.
author: Sherry L.

description: the noodle was kinda cold to me... the meat was ok... maybe i arrived at the time they almost closed... but it doesn't right when they served their customer with cold noodle.... the egg rolls is good...
author: Michael P.

description:
Not the best Vietnamese place, but definitely the best around the area. Price is really reasonable. Five spiced chicken is the bomb. The imperial rolls too. But they're kinda a hit and miss. Sometimes, the chicken and imperial rolls are not that great. Other times, the chickens are so juicy, and the rolls are really crispy. But they're still good regardless.

For the price, this place serves good food. Come here 3 to 4 times a week.
author: Ardo K.

description: This is my go to spot for pho now. It gets crowded, but I'm used to the wait now. I've tried pretty much half the menu and love the rice dishes especially pork chop. The garlic noodles with five spice chicken is a must try! We probably pick up food to go at least once a week now.
author: Jinnie L.

description:
This place sucks rude ass customer service 
Have fake ass Bun bo hue that taste like a tomato soup or  beef soup yon can't tell from those two and they don't have the right noddle for it, and also my friend found a dead fly on her food.... I suggest not coming here to any one
author: Saige A.

description: I have lived in this city for the past fifteen years, and I have vet to find a better Pho place.
author: Mia C.

description:
Hadn't been here in a while, and I wanted pho for lunch. Service was fast and came over with complimentary hot tea that tasted like bad tap water. Ordered a small rare beef pho that came out quickly. Great! But when I tasted it, it tasted like chicken broth and the noodles were clumped together and diced up. I was so disappointed, I was looking forward to the pho experience I am so used to. 

I will not be back, this place used to be so good. What happened ?!
author: Teal M.

description:
This place is legit. Live in San Francisco. Would drive here just yo get Vietnamese food. Why? Because it is that good. The price is right, relatively good customer service and more parking than sf.


Wwww I am starting to modify my review.. my last couple of visits recently has. Even sub par.. did you chance the chiefs? It seems as though, the food become bland.. this is my 3rd times it happened.. starting to question my own review.
author: IHeartMambo S.

description: BE AWARE this place is DISGUSTING , I came here often before but every single time I get sandwich here to go, if you watch how they make your sandwich, you will realize They NEVER WEAR GLOVES!!!! And guess what I caught  them many times making my sandwich without washing hands after they collected money! If you tell them to wash hand why will rinse their hands literally like 2sec then wipe their hand with a DIRTY NASTY RAG hanging right next to the sink. Waiters here wipe tables+bring your food +collect money +make your food!!!!!!!!!!Many of my friends live on Ingleside stopped going their BC foods quality is getting worse and DISGUSTING
author: ZZ Z.

description: I found a plastic straw packaging inside the bean sprout side dish. The owner told me it's from the bean sprout packaging, it doesn't make any logic sense at all. No further comment, be your own judge.
author: Jeannie Y.

description:
Decent pho place near my house that serves Bun Bo Hue. The broth is your usual, though they seem to give less meat. Price is under $10 per bowl so that's a pretty nice price tag in San Francisco. 

Service is decent. Your average pho restaurant; quick in-and-out. 

Parking is difficult in the area. Only street parking available, but you'll most likely need to wander to the residential areas for parking. All in all, not a bad place to stop by when you're in the area.
author: Kristi T.

description:
Solid Neighborhood Joint.  I finally figured out what I like there #10... Don't ask me what it is just order it.  Tasty Stuff - Nice & Spicy with Coconut Milk.  The Beers need to be colder and the imperial rolls aren't as good as the last few times we have gone.  but good food for a good price.
Enjoy and get the "sweats"!
author: Cameron C.

description: I ordered a bbq pork banh mi for lunch and a meatball sandwich to-go. The sandwich was tasty, but this place skimps out on their meat and vegetables. I love myself a hearty sandwich. This place doesn't cut it.
author: Cindy T.

description:
Worked out at the gym next door and was so hungry afterwards that I came here! Super convenient. Seems like lots of people do that as I saw most of the people at the tables were dressed in gym clothes. 

Ordered a number 10 which is their satay beef. Their broth is made with coconut milk and curry so it's not your traditional beef broth. It definitely hit the spot. The broth was delicious with a little bit of heat due to the chili flakes. Pho noodles seemed to be overcooked as they were super soft. The broth came out lukewarm and wasn't able to fully cook the beef all the way through. Some people prefer it that way but I like it to be well done in my pho. Service was attentive and friendly. Wouldn't make the drive out here as parking can be difficult, especially during mid-day.
author: Cynthia T.

description: The prices overall are cheap, the food is fairly plain. Be careful you know exactly what you are ordering is what you want because they will not exchange anything, even if your a vegetarian and cannot eat their meat items.MAKE SURE TO ASK IF IT CONTAINS MEAT ETC. BEFORE YOU ORDER!!! Would not recommend. Bad service not worth the quality of the food
author: Miriam P.

description: I only come to this place if Im in the area and need a quick bite. Personally I am not a fan of their pho because the last time I had it, it had alot of lemongrass in it which threw me off because thats something Im not used to. So now I only come here for their bahn mi because its super cheap and a its a pretty big sandwich! I also really like their imperial rolls. Service always seems to be slow and always hard to flag someone down.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
This Vietnamese place was once my go to for Pho when I was in middle school. Haven't been here in over a year due to the declining quality of the food and service overall.

Came here today with my boyfriend and his father because they were hungry. We ordered a small combination pho, bun rein and an XL combination pho with apparently extra "PROTEIN" (aka; two dead flies floating back up in the broth).

It was found in my boyfriends XL combination pho after he had basically finished the entire thing which was super funny/disgusting considering that he had finished it not knowing there was some nasty ass flies in his food but also it was definitely a health concern. Assuming that the flies were found in the broth, it must have been dead for awhile in the pot of broth that's still being used for making other noodle soups. Just thinking about that again is making me sick. When we reported to the Owner (bald headed guy) he didn't look like he gave a crap. All he said was " do you want a new one?" Me: no it's fine really ( I mean like why would I want another bowl knowing that there might be more bugs or what not inside of it). He responds with a rude attitude and without even fully acknowledging that there was anything wrong with flies in his food with " fine, we'll take that pho off the bill" and just left. Like come on! This is a REAL HEALTH CONCERN!

I mean I understand that a lot of restaurants are not up to health standards and it shouldn't be a surprise that there might be bugs or stuff occasionally that lands in the food but TWO FLIES in one bowl??? There is something seriously wrong with the cleanliness of this restaurant.

Personally, the overall quality and service of this place has really gone down hill. I know that we aren't the first customers who found some shit in there food so please try to address this issue before y'all have to close down. That would definitely be ashamed. Will not come back again.
author: Shirley G.

description:
I personally didn't find Pho Ha Tien to be anything special, but that may be because I didn't order the right thing. I came with a group of 6, and we were all happily surprised they had round tables -- so much easier to talk to everyone! We were given menus and tea pretty much as soon as we were seated, which is always nice.

I ordered the bun bo hue and it was passable. It's not as flavorful as I'd like, and the pieces of meat were roughly cut. It's also not as spicy as other BBHs I've had, but I guess that's what hot sauce is for. The one plus is that it's a HUGE bowl (mainly noodles though), and you could definitely share between two people if you wanted. I also shared an order of beef carpaccio with the bf, and it was good. The meat was nice and thin, but a little warmer than I'd like. When I eat warm carpaccio, it just doesn't sit right with me. I think they could've put a bit more of the toppings as well, but that may be personal preference. HUGE PLUS is that the carpaccio is so cheap compared to most pho places! I believe it was $9.

Two of my friends ordered the beef stew soup with egg noodles, which they loved and is their regular order. One of my friends has the seafood noodle soup, and it was such a sad bowl of noodles. It barely came with any toppings and really just looked like a bowl of noodles...

As mentioned, nothing too special about this place and I'd rather go to Kevin's or PPQ to get my pho/Viet noodle soup fix. I will say that the food is cheaper here though.
author: Doris K.

description:
After weeks of having cravings for Vietnamese Crepes (Banh Xeo) we found ourselves here. There is street parking along Ocean Avenue. As with every place in SF, you have to drive around for a bit searching for parking or if you get lucky someone will be pulling out of a spot as you are searching. It is a busy street but there was a crosswalk that leads directly to the restaurant (if you happen to find a parking space on the other side of the street). We felt safe crossing the street with our kids.

We were seated immediately once we walked in the door to this quaint little restaurant. There were about 15 tables and they had the TV on (basketball game). After looking at the menu our orders were taken in a timely manner. Tea and water were served shortly after. Our table had not been restocked with chopsticks or soup spoons but we simply asked for them along with forks and spoons. 

As a person who has had experience with Vietnamese food, I can say that the Banh Xeo did not disappoint. Plenty of fresh veggies (romain lettuce, cucumbers, mint leaves) and the fish sauce wasn't too overbearing. We also ordered the Fried Emperor Rolls which were amazing (the kids literally fought over them.) We also ordered the Pho and it was okay, not the best but will do just fine on a cold SF day. Plenty of fresh veggies provided for the Pho as well. I also ordered the Banh Cuon which was also amazing. I would highly recommend the Banh Xeo and Banh Cuon if you are craving these Vietnamese food items as they are hard to perfect at home if you don't have experience. 

Overall experience here was great. I would defiantly recommend this restaurant and if you are feeling adventurous, give their Banh Xeo and Banh Cuon a try!
author: Just Meeh B.

description: Very authentic and delicious. Service was great. Kinda hard to find parking but the walk is wasn't too bad and you get stuffed so the walk feels good. The Pho has lots of flavor.
author: Gaby D.

description: Excellent Pho excellent five spice chicken, great service and value. We have been going here quite a few years. Always consistent. I think the Pho here is the best.
author: jacques l.

description:
This restaurant was "A-OKAY" a solid place to eat with good portions, and the quality and quantity of food for the price was good.

Parking in the area is easy if you know what you're doing and how to park in SF.

It feels like a reliable place that is good for students whether you go to Aptos or City College near-by.

There's no signature dish that I know of here that makes it rise above in that unique way, but it feels consistent and average (where average is a positive, complimentary and good term).

I'm not sure if it's a place I'd ever jonze for or crave, but at the same time everyone has their own tasty flavors that they desire.  However...I'd come here (again), as well as recommend others try it.
author: Rick S.

description: I hate this place. Literally the worst pho place I've ever had. Broth tasted like the water they boiled the noodles in and onion. Also they didn't speak Vietnamese, we somehow ended up ordering in Chinese. Also we sent an order back because we didn't order it and they literally brought the same bowl back like we didn't notice.
author: TriDan N.

description: One of the worst pho Ive ever had... the pho broth tastes like nothing. It took more than 20 minutes
author: Grace K.

description:
I always get the #13 which is pho noodles in plain plain broth with a dish of BBQ roasted chicken marinaded in five spice powder.

Their banh mi doesn't disappoint either if you want something on the go.

It has never disappointed me in over a decade that I've been coming here. However, lately since 2015, the portions have been getting smaller and smaller. You used to get a large dish of the BBQ chicken, for example. Now the noodle and meat portions have shrunk to kid sized items.
author: Anna F.

description:
Honestly, this was some of the best pho I've ever had.  I wouldn't say I'm a pho expert, but if you like a flavorful soup, then I really don't see how you can go wrong here.

My boyfriend had the traditional combo beef pho (in the extra large size....wasn't necessary to get this big of a serving...) while I had a small size of both the pho ga (i.e. chicken noodle soup) and the sate beef pho.  

I was completely obsessed with everything we had but ESPECIALLY the sate beef pho.  The combo beef pho had tons of flavor and was on par with any other traditional pho I've had previously.  The pho ga was awesome and much more flavorful than my previous favorite pho ga at Joy Hing Bar-B-Que Noodle (which, in turn, is meant to be better than Turtle Tower - but I haven't had Turtle Tower to say for sure).  The sate beef is just "wow."  The broth is a little spicy and a little sweet, with a heavy dose of coconut milk, and then with the rare beef and crushed peanuts mixed in - it's just heaven.

We also had the BBQ pork rolls (not fried; served cold in rice paper), and with the addition of the spicy chili garlic sauce on the table, I really enjoyed these.

Sodas are self-serve (fun!) and hot tea is free.  I really liked the low-key, hole-in-the-wall vibe and appreciated that they accept credit cards.

Now that the rainy season is upon us (woo hoo!), I'll be coming back here a lot...
author: Tay H.

description: Only giving 2 stars because the food actually didn't take long at all to get to our table, and it was kind of decent for the cheap price that it is (avg $7 for a small bowl of pho and avg $8 for a large bowl). One thing that bothered me was that the noodles were sooo clumped together, I felt almost as if I was eating the $1 ramen noodles.. Minus 3 stars for the RUDE ASS PEOPLE that work there... ohhh my gosh I can't think of another time I've been to another pho place that was as worse as they were. When my friend and I walked in, we were not greeted with a smile or anything. Right away was just "how many, 2? To go??" Like they don't want us to sit down and eat. The lady just pointed at a random table for us to sit in. Another lady literally just threw the menus on the table.. um okay? Everything else went well until it was time to pay. We asked for the check and they forgot about us, mind you it wasn't even busy at all. They just kept washing random dishes and played with their kids at the front tables. When we finally had our bill, the lady kept asking "are you ready, are you ready?!" Bitch does it look like we are ready? My friend had her card on the table and when I was still trying to pull out my cash the lady tried taking away the bill and I HAD TO rudely tell her, WE ARE NOT READY. I definitely feel welcomed here now. She took a long time again to get to us so another guy that was just sitting there with the kids grabbed the bill (finally). No tip for you guys at all. Learn how to respect and welcome people otherwise you will get really shitty tips.
author: Kanella G.

description:
There are a lot of other places in the city to get Vietnamese food. If I wasn't in the neighborhood running an errand I would have probably gone elsewhere for a bowl of noodle soup! Small restaurant but they've managed to fit a good number of tables in. There was a line on that Saturday afternoon and we were seated in less than 10 minutes of waiting. Wasn't a fan of their green and black trash bins lining the doorway. They weren't empty...

The food: tapioca slush was the best of our meal. Chewy boba and refreshing fruit juice. Didn't make up for the bun rieu though. Small and lacking a lot of substance. Zero shrimp and just all noodles. They only had an option to add raw beef slices to any bowl which just didn't feel right with bun rieu, though I may have been spoiled by other restaurants filling the soup with tofu, tomato and all that good stuff.

I'd pass and drive into the sunset or Daly City for Vietnamese food next time.
author: Samantha L.

description: #3 pho with rare beef and service was a complete disappointment. I requested the beef on the side and it had already browned, discolored, and had a rainbow film. This is a sign that the beef is not fresh is going bad. I mentioned this to the server and asked for a knife to cut off the bad parts. A good restaurant would have replaced a poor quality food with a fresh replacement. No such service was provided.
author: Daniel W.

description: I ordered a noodle bowl and my noodles was a bit hard because they didn't leave the noodles in water long enough to get firm. I like their raw beef dish though. Prices are decent, service is mediocre but most Asian places are anyways. A waitress wore a hair net, but her coworker didn't so that was odd.
author: Gerry P.

description: Tofu Banh Mi was cheap but bland. I'm used to the tofu being marinated but their tofu was fried plain. I would not order this again. Expect mediocre service, save a little money and tip accordingly (so you're not disappointed or angry).
author: Marie L.

description: You'd think a slice of green and a few shreds of carrot on top would cost pennies but make the presentation better. Tastes good though.
author: Jayce T.

description: My favorite pho in the south part of the city. The crab noodles are super yummy too. Price is cheap and open late. I tried the veggie pho this time and it was good too. Hot tea is included if you dine in. I highly recommend it.
author: Rae R.

description:
Food: It's a decent place that serves the basics.  Usually I get the Pho Bo Vien and it's not bad.  I think if I had a choice I'd give them 3.5 stars.

Service:  The people are nice and quick to order.

Ambiance:  Well it's more a little mom and pop hole in the wall.  

Overall:  I will typically come here when I need something quick and it's right next to Ocean 24 Hour Fitness.  It's convenient for me so that's why I go.  Haven't had a bad meal here but it's pretty no frills.
author: Spencer Q.

description: I love this spot. The pho is awesome. The garlic noodles are addicting. I love getting the beef dish you cook in hot water vinegar & you create your own spring rolls. Would highly recommend.
author: Ryan G.

description: Ordered a pork Vietnamese sandwich for $5.00 The pork was nicely flavored, but the bun was too hard and bland- it ripped up my gums and hurt my jaw.
author: Scooter C.

description: I was walking by yesterday, deciding to pop in, and while some tables were filled with people eating and talking, I stepped up to their to-go counter and got a tofu banh mi to go for about $5 and it was fresh with hot tofu, cold veggies, just enough jalapeno spice and cilantro without being overpowering (I declined the mayo to veganize it), and all on a tasty warm roll, nicely wrapped with a coupe napkins. I continued on my walk and very much enjoyed my scrumptious banh mi as I went along.
author: Veg V.

description: Great taste, big portion, good price, super fast service... This is the ideal neighborhood Vietnamese joint that gives you a quick "hangry" fix! I personally like the satay beef pho and the Banh Cuon. My hubby enjoyed the Bun Bo Hue. At the end we ordered a Banh Mi ($4.75) to go! Will def come back for other dishes.
author: Shaz L.

description: The best pho you can get anywhere on Ocean avenue, in the Ingleside and Excelsior area.  In fact I would warn you away from other Vietnamese places in the area because they are quite nasty and horrible.  The prices are unbeatable ($16 for large pho and spring rolls).  The service is fast and friendly (many staff is Vietnamese speaking only but great smiles).  I wish the bathrooms were cleaner but the dining area is clean classic over-lit Asian diner style.
author: Kim L.

description: Trust me u dont wanna eat their "Bánh canh giò heo" (vietnamese udon noodle soup) 4 small shrimp& 2 pork nuckle( which are very dry& hard to chew...) I ate the shrimp&the soup,and that's it! The noodle is kinda weird taste,so I ate just a few...It's my wrong choice& ruin my Friday night mood Also,their "fresh coconut juice" is served in a glass in which they actually put some sugar/syrup in it!! what does the word "Fresh" mean?! Come on!!
author: Ha D.

description: Pho placed own by Chinese Vietnamese.....so you know it ain't San Jose quality, mediocre at best. Broth here is weak and MSG laden, skimpy bean sprout portions, and meat quality is lackluster. Even the Ca phe sua da (viet iced coffee) kinda sucks, the coffee they use is probably just the cheapest brand they can find. So sad because this place has the perfect location, right by 24 hour fitness and on the busy Ocean ave trek. It's got so much potential to make better food and do better business if the quality was there. Unfortunately, they are not willing to take the gamble to raise the prices a bit more to pay for higher quality ingredients and to serve better tea and coffee like in San Jose. They want to keep it the way it is to cater to the students and nearby lunch crowd, which is fine, but if they revamped the quality, this place could be so much busier.
author: Haymen D.

description: I'm a sucker for good pho that's price friendly. The imperial rolls are off the charts too! A definite go-to place that combines just the right about of flavor, meal size and grime to feel authentic and provide a great dining experience.
author: Joshua F.

description: This place has some amazing soups and sandwiches. They're always consistent in quality and promptness. My personal favorites are the state beef soup (yummy coconut spicy broth) and the bbq pork bahn mi. I always ask then to remove the cucumbers from the sandwiches as I feel they resemble something fishy. Highly recommend this spot if you want a good deal and to eat without all the bells and whistles. Good food, great prices and friendly staff
author: Michael L.

description:
Love the vibes of this place!

Only 4 stars because of all the minor details (no parking lot, bathroom is sketchy, etc).

They have this coconut soup base pho that is so creamy and delish. I have never heard of it so it is pretty special. I ordered a small and it is so rich, I would split it next time. The noodles were cooked PERFECTLY.

I would totally come again if I were in the area.
author: Megan L.

description:
Great service. I pretty much always get # 17 small. It's just enough but you'll get hungry soon again.

Bun Reiu + Spring Rolls = $17.10 

My go to Pho place. Always consistent.
author: Emily L.

description: I keep forgetting to update this review. But I totally love this place, hands down my favorite pho place close to home....
author: Shirlene M.

description:
Great Soups! I haven't been feeling well for days and I took a walk today and got some chicken Pho, so glad it was yummy. 
The noodles were perfect the chicken looked and tasted freshly cooked. I liked the lime with it too.
They have garlic noodles there which I would love to try next time.
Oh they also have tapioca pearls drinks yays!
author: Tere C.

description:
Only in a pinch should you come here.

1. Service poor (but I expect that from Asian places)
2. Frozen tendon in pho. Still frozen together in the soup.
3. Limp basil.
4. Banh mi....just okay but only $4

It's quick which like but if there was another phonplace closer, go to that one.
author: PJ T.

description:
For a hearty meal and good-hearted staff, check out this local treasure. My boyfriend and I came in and ordered a few items to-go. While waiting by the cash register, we witnessed a man who had forgotten his wallet and was unable to pay for his dinner. Although he repeatedly offered to go back to his car to grab cash, the manager (I assume) refused and said, "don't worry about it. You can pay me next time." It was sweet and not something you come by often.

Let's talk food! Here are a few items I've tried from Pho Ha Tien:

Cha Gio (Deep Fried Imperial Rolls; $5.95) -- Tasty! It comes with 4. Great and quick snack if you're looking for something savory. They always come hot and fresh.

Goi Cuon (Cold Shrimp Rolls; $5.95) -- You get two nicely wrapped rolls with peanut sauce. They are cut in half giving you 4 pieces. Add a little chili sauce and you're good to go. Thumbs up!

Banh Cuon Cha Lua ($8) -- DELICIOUS! You get 6 of these steamed rice rolls wrapped with ground pork. I am a huge fan of banh cuon and it's a struggle to find a decent place in the city. If you're a fan too, you've got to get your fix here.

Pho Bo Vien (small for $6.50, large for $7.50) --Yummy. Nothing particularly special, but it's good. The broth is flavorful and the portions are great for what you pay for. 

Bun Thit Nuong ($7.45) -- Dry vermicelli with BBQ pork on a bed of chopped veggies, topped off with a sweet fish sauce. This is always a reliable order and I'm never disappointed with any of the vermicelli combinations. Heads up... huge portions!
author: Michelle H.

description: Solid, very well priced, and very good sized Banh Mi sandwiches.  The bread is always soft, veggies fresh, meat hot, and service quick.  They also have a pretty good amount of seating when compared to your typical Vietnamese spot, so if you're looking for a place to meet with someone or have a little lunch date this could be a great option.  I'm not a huge fan of pho, but the couple of times I have tried it here it has hit the spot, although friends of mine who are more pho-smart than I am have told me there are many better places in the city for a big bowl of broth.
author: Sean S.

description:
I am, by no means, considered a picky eater.  Also, I've had pho all around the bay area, and have never come across a bad bowl of pho.  

Until I came here.  

Their pho simply had no flavor - it was like eating rice noodles in hot water.  I was hungry, but could not get myself to finish my bowl.  

Secondly, I ordered their fresh spring rolls, which consisted mainly of rice noodles.  There was no cilantro, bean sprouts, or pork inside the spring rolls.  This restaurant's idea of fresh spring rolls was a fistful of rice noodles, a wilted piece of lettuce, and a piece of shrimp.  You got 4 pieces of this for $6.75, which is a little less than $2 a piece.  Not worth it.  

I brought this up to the attention of the store owner, and he basically told me that there was nothing he could do about the lack of ingredients in the spring rolls.  I asked him why it cost nearly $7, but he did not bother to justify the pricing, other than to say that's how it's always been.
author: Dana C.

description:
We frequently come to get our Pho to this restaurant and the food and service is usually good.
Most of the staff is rather quiet but pleasant with the exception of the server today he was a bit rude, he seemed very forgetful of the water we always for, unhappy that we reminded when we asked to bring for the vegetables for the soup and although we had already paid for our food and he himself had taken the payment and tip he returned within 5 minutes to check if were going to pay for our food. What the heck??‍
author: Leticia Z.

description: This place is one of the best place for pho idk why so low stars. But I can most definitely give 5 and recommend this place.
author: Oscar T.

description:
I live close to this place. Was craving pho do decided to try. I ordered all meat pho and two sandwiches.
The service was fast as I ordered for to go. The place itself was pretty full, the staff was okay.

Total cost for all 3 meals, 18.00 bucks.

The soup which I had was tasty, but not enough meat, only tons of noodles!!! Not enough onion, or lemon but it tasted good enough.

The sandwiches which my husband had were dry, I think he ordered roast beef or chicken? Anyhow, it didnt have clianto or carrots just the meat, one or two strands of a carrot, mayo and bread was kinda hard.

I wouldnt recomend the sandwiches but if ur craving pho not the best but will do to statisfy the craving.
author: Vanessa T.

description: Got #2 and asked for tripe on the side. Didn't happen. Tripe was in pho. Mediocre food that's cheap. Not too bad but you get what you pay for. Wife had #27 and it was decent as well. Set expectations mid to low and it will deliver.
author: brian p.

description:
Didn't they open a pho stand at SFSU?? I swear they are owned by the same people. Anyway today I got their bun Rieu large $7.50 and they give a lot of noodles and crab.

Their small noodle soup costs $6 so this place is pretty cheap compare to other pho charging almost $10 for a bowl.

Will definitely come back again!
author: Debbie D.

description:
4 stars....but not for the pho! 

Banh xeo. Come here and eat it. What a surprise!! You wouldn't think of getting this at a pho place. Like the time I ordered a salad at Barney's, or pasta at Red Robin. This though was legit! $8.75 for a huge crepe. It was fried crispy on the outside and loaded with bean sprouts, mung bean, pork and shrimp on the inside. Side of lettuce, mint, and cucumbers to wrap it in---they were all beautiful, green, and fresh. My roommate doubted that i would be able to finish and I proved them wrong. It compares to banh xeo you can get in San Jose, the bay area mecca of vietnamese food. 

Tip: The menu is huge! They have pho and many, many other traditional vietnamese dishes. Interestingly, I wouldn't go here to eat pho. It was ok, not bad, but just ok.
author: Jen P.

description: Good food for a good price! We ordered chicken pho, crab bun rieu, rice plate number 37 with the charbroiled pork and shrimp cake and the combination banh mi. All came out fast and very yummy! Servers and the owners are very nice, polite and friendly too! Thank you! ^_^
author: Nikki V.

description:
Came here late at night so after a long nap because I was hungry and craving for pho. Ordered the "#1 Pho XL" and it looked like a normal large with just a bigger bowl to fool you service by a waiter with a whatever attitude. The broth was good but nothing spectacular. Beef balls tasted low quality and the mints weren't even fresh. They had black spots on them. Mind as well do themselves a favor and not serve the herbs at all if they are that old. I tried to pay by card and they wouldn't accept my money because they have a $15 minimum charge and I didn't have cash on me late at night for safety reasons. The dude keeps telling me to go to target to get cash. Why do I go to target to get cash for is he dumb? I told him that the bank i use is actually near by and if they would give me a few minutes i would be back. The older gentlemen said I would need to leave my ID before I leave. They both at that point treated me like a criminal or a suspect under interrogation. Keep in mind that their cost of goods sold is only about $3-4. To dodge taxes they would rather take cash to avoid the 2.9% transaction fee. No matter what the minimum charge on debit cards are, the fee is still 2.9%. Now the bill was about 10 dollars so that would make their fee like 29 cents. They basically treaty their customers like criminals and caused a fuss over 29 pennies. Well... ain't that pity.... Most restaurants would just accept your payment with card but this place took things to another level of scandalous. 

So guys remember to bring cash and be prepared for mediocre food served with an attitude when you come here. And don't expect the food you order to look like the pictures on the menus because that was just done for dramatizations as order bait. You might be missing some vegi or the must come out totally different
author: A A.

description:
Great Hoa-style Vietnamese pho joint!

You know the type.. with variety of noodle options, lots of beef stew, boiled bean sprouts, and the staff speaking both Chinese and Vietnamese. 

Everyone can make broth and noodles, and Ha Tien's beef broth is nice and rich the way you'd expect your Asian grandma to make it. The boiling of 10 lbs of beef in a pressure cooker for such a long time that the tendons fall off the bone. So rich you can't see through it, and have to make a conscious effort to fish out the last pieces of noodles that seem to appear and disappear whether you're using chopsticks or spoons. No, you don't want to drink all the broth just to make it to the last piece of noodle.. you just want the noodle.

If you feel like eating something other than thin slices of rare steak, then try one of their other popular dishes, available both in rice and noodle form:

-Beef Stew 
-Bun Thang (meats and egg cut into thin strips - try it if you like bibimbap)
- Ca Ri Ga (curry chicken in medium spice - just spoon out the floating chili oil if you can't hang)
- Five Spice Chicken
- Bun Rieu (crab paste and tomato - pretty sure this one is just for noodles though)
author: Jade T.

description: This has become my go-to spot, especially in the mornings when I am craving pho or a decent banh mi. I tend to go here more for the banh mi because it's actually pretty good. There's always plenty of filling & meat inside the banh mi, and the bread is the perfect crunch. Although it isn't the best Vietnamese food out there, their service and food are always consistent, which I really like. Whether it's ordering for takeout or dining in, I still get the same  consistency with my orders AND THEIR BANH MI IS GOOD!
author: Jane N.

description:
Lunch was a bit lacking in the wild, so I decided to wander into this place after a long day of classes at CCSF. I knew that this was a pretty hot place to a lot of the students around the area, so I had expectations of this being a very "quick and simple" bite to eat. We would see! 

Walking in, I noted that this place was very busy, and it didn't seem to look very clean: some flies around, tables were not fully cleared. Understandable for hosting thousands of college students everyday. Service here is a bit slow, was simply waved to a seat and seemed rushed to place my order. 

Portions here are LARGE! I opted for the small bowl of pho with different meats, and was surprised that the small was really big. The large was as you can imagine, VERY large. 

The meat was quite flavorful and was well cooked. The broth wasn't that strong but it wasn't watered down at the same time. 

I also got a Thai iced tea that ended up being one of the best I've had surprisingly, definitely didn't expect really good Thai iced tea at a place like this. 

Overall, nothing was that outstanding, but I can understand how college students on a budget opt for this place thanks to their massive portions for low price. Just wish their service and cleanliness was a bit better. 

*chirp*
author: Jei C.

description:
This place is alright. Not the best Vietnamese place in SF, but not the worst either. This place has reasonable prices for decent portion of food! Most noodle soups (small and large) ranges from $6.75-7.50.I would say this is one of the better pho places on Ocean Avenue and it is conveniently located right next to 24 hour Fitness and near CCSF. The other Vietnamese places are either overpriced or Americanized. They have a variety of noodle soups, vermicilli bowls, rice plates, and even a whole page menu for drinks! I love how they have so many flavor options for fresh fruit drinks! They even have boba! Definitely will give that a try next time I pay them a visit.

I ordered a Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup) to go and it was pretty decent. Of course it can't be compared to what you would get at Turtle Tower but it will satisfy your pho/noodle soup cravings! The downside is that you need $15 minimum in order to use your credit card. So if you are coming alone and not planning to eat/order $15 worth of food, bring cash!! There's a Chase bank one block down! 

Note: Make sure you get the correct amount of change back if you are paying with cash. The cashier lady gave me the wrong change back!

They also charge 10 cents for plastic bags and for to go soup containers, 20 cents for to go box containers.
author: Shanna C.

description: Food is delicious (though I only ever order pho). Price is reasonable. Service is horrible: they don't notice when someone walks in and is waiting to be seated and they seem to get upset if you seat yourself.  They forget to bring out toppings (twice). I've never seen a single one of my servers crack half a smile, or say thank you; not sure what the deal is.
author: Mo S.

description:
I ordered soup noodle.  As a thumb of rule, you know you did not eat a bowl of  decent Vietnamese noodles when you are extremely thirsty afterward.  It should NOT be that way!! 

Price and service are fair!!
Taste:  soup has salty taste only, no beef bone taste whatsoever!!  

Eat at this restaurant since 10+ years ago because it is close to my house.  No improvement at all!  Always a disappointment!!  Had to drink cups of water afterward.
author: Gina B.

description: I love this place.  I've been coming here for over a decade.  The food is always fresh and leaves me feeling revived and completely satisfied.  The staff is always extremely friendly which is no wonder since it's a family owned and operated business.  If you want fresh and delicious Vietnamese food, this is the place to go.  Also, their BBQ pork Banh Mi/ Vietnamese sandwich is the standard for me to compare all others to.
author: V J.

description:
Nothing too special about this place. Staff are unresponsive but they get the job done. Food is mediocre and will satisfy your pho craving. The restaurant itself is not the cleanest. 

+there is a vegetarian pho option
-$15 min for credit cards
author: Anna H.

description: Was craving pho and it was the closest place so I popped in. Ordered the 5 spice chicken noodle soup and my chicken (came on the side) looked sketchy so I didn't touch it but the soup itself was really good and the price point was great.
author: Madi M.

description: The service is bad , Their sandwiches taste not good as An Chi Vietnamese restaurant which on 4683 mission San Francisco!
author: Bing L.

description:
Oily soup, so so meat, dirty store, bad service = never going back there.

Maybe I am spoiled by the good pho soup here in the south bay, I just couldn't say anything good about this place.

Apparently, some workers can speak mandarin, some don't. When we spoke mandarin to the guy that took our order, he was quiet for a long time, and he had an upset and impatient face.
author: Emma Y.

description: I came in the morning right after they opened. Mainly ladies run this establishment. Ended up ordering the pho dac biet with beef on the side, when i got the bowl the broth was very murky and tasted damn near atrocious. Beef slices were or smaller portions and pho was still hard. Ive eaten my fair share of pho to know whats what, im sorry but whoever gave this place 5 stars prob doesnt know a pho bowl from a poke bowl. Lady that served me was fairly nice though so i tipped.
author: John H.

description: Solid food. Great (cheap) prices. We had sandwiches, spring rolls, a rice plate, a make your own spring roll plate, and drinks for under $40. Everything was delicious. Place is a little divvy but it's clean. Highly recommend if you're on this side of town.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Dirty place, low quality food, rude service. So many other delicious pho options in the area to choose from!
author: Madison V.

description: Very happy with my experience here! Noodles, beef and soup was great! I ordered the bowl with coconut milk & peanuts. I enjoyed it! I've been fighting a cold all week and decided to grab pho after my evening class at city college. I looked on yelp for suggestions and noticed this place had one less star than the other pho place closest to the campus. I've been here before and remember I liked it, so I decided to go where I was familiar. I intended to pay with credit card and didn't realize the limit till after I was finished eating. My only critique is I wish they would have mentioned the limit before seating me, because I was eating for one person but I asked if it was okay to grab cash at the nearest chase bank and offered to leave my bag as collateral. They were kind enough to let me get cash and bring my bag with me. They trusted me when they didn't have to.
author: Grace S.

description: This place is OK. The menu is decent but the spacing and seating inside is somewhat acceptable. My recommendation would be to go to the Richmond district and get some better quality Vietnamese food. Plus, parking here is a HUGE pain. I highly do not recommend this place unless you absolutely have to.
author: Robert F.

description:
I always get their #60. It's good, but not consistent.
Their banh mi are decent. It's cheap.
Bun rieu lacks flavor! It was pretty bland.
author: Joann W.

description:
Their pho has really good broth; i like to add the sliced jalepenos and some bean sprouts and mint leaves :D  today we got the #1 and i got the #2 small, also had spring rolls and garlic noodles and one of the rice plates with chicken.  
the rice plate wasnt worth remembering anyways, it was really average and i dont recommend it. theyre much better for their pho.  the spring rolls are awesome but its peanut dipping sauce is lacking and gooey.  really refreshing spring rolls !
the garlic noodles were ok at first and got better as I kept eating. 
Get the spring rolls! Get the pho! you wont be disappointed
author: Amanda J.

description:
I came back for their bun rieu and loved it. And then came back a week later for bun rieu again. :D Very fresh, love the tomato broth, and the crap/shrimp paste in the soup is legit. The first time I had it, it was just a tiny bit bland but I perfected it by adding some fish sauce into the soup. The second time I had it, it tasted fine and I didn't have to add any fish sauce. 

I also tried their shrimp and BBQ pork spring rolls. The BBQ was a little too salty for me. It comes with fish sauce but I thought the saltiness from the spring rolls mixed with the salty fish sauce was way too much. I would recommend the regular shrimp spring rolls instead without the salty pork

Need energy to stay up for 8 hours straight? Their Viet coffee will do the trick!
author: Jane P.

description:
I remember the first time I ate here years ago. I was excited because it was Ocean Avenue's only pho spot. It was mediocre then and it's barely even passable now.

Years later and well, it's pretty much still the only pho place. I'm sure it's been bought over because years ago, staff was speaking Vietnamese here. On my last (and this will definitely be the last) trip here, everybody was speaking Cantonese.

Skip the pho. The broth is below mediocre and extremely bland. There was no flavor in the broth whatsoever. I had to add a lot of hoisin and Sriracha... only to just have my soup taste like...well, hoisin and Sriracha. I suppose that's much better than what it was like originally. 

They also obviously don't rinse the noodles or anything before plopping it into the bowl because I could taste the starch in the bland broth. Hmm, pho broth that's so bland you can taste starch coming off your noodles? Not good.

Brothers had BBQ chicken rice plates.. Both of those plates came out less than 5 minutes after ordering. SUPER SKETCHY. Why did it come out so fast!? Is the chicken pre-cooked?? Probably. The portions on the rice plate were so skimp. There was nearly 3x more rice than there was chicken.

Only decent thing about this last trip here was the bo tai chanh, rare beef salad. I am shocked this place even serves it but it was good. 

Pretty much done with this place. I didn't want to make a further drive out for decent pho but lesson learned.
author: Susy C.

description:
Pho Ha Tien is a REAL asian restaurant. You know.. below average service, average to above average food, and reasonably priced. This place takes the cake on all counts. 

I usually judge pho restaurants based on their Dac Biet (special / combination) pho  and this place is no different. For the newbies, Pho Dac Biet is pho with tripe, lean steak, beef balls, and beef brisket. The broth was well flavored and not too salty. Decent portions. The meat was slightly lacking but very generous with the noodles and sprouts. My meal was reasonably priced at $7.50.

Service was subpar as expected: not very attentive, took a while to order, and not entirely friendly. But hey, I was already on board with that before walking into the door. 

I've had better pho, more reasonably priced food, and better service. Those places are 4-5 star establishments. This place is nothing fancy but is delicious in its own right. I WILL be back for more.
author: Chris W.

description: The Pho was really good. I enjoyed the options they had. I wished they had taken the cilantro off the stem but that only a minor set back. I got this one staff worker who seemed like they didn't want to be there but who doesn't. Overall the food was really good for a cheap price. Amazing Bahn Mis.
author: David G.

description: I came here around noon and it was pretty busy. It took awhile for the server to get the order but the food came out fast. There was a bunch of people waiting to be seated because all the seats were mostly filled. The food is decent here but there are better places to have pho.
author: Wendy C.

description: This place is always packed on the weekdays, sometimes you'll even have to wait 10-15 minutes, but that's a good sign. It's pretty rare I'd give a pho place 4 stars but I really like the pho broth here and the noodles are cooked well. Tip: Don't order the HK milk tea, it was basically pure sugar water.
author: Angela K.

description: Authentic, yummy, and friendly! This place is great when you're looking for some good food in a laid back atmosphere. This is one of my all time pho go-to's in this part of the city!
author: Zoe B.

description:
It had been several months since my last visit, which was disappointing.  However, they seem to have new staff and, as a result, service (and food) have improved greatly.

The Bun Bo Hue is much improved - instead of a large pork knuckle they sliced the pork into manageable pieces.  There's also pork blood cubes and an incredibly tender brisket.  The soup had some heat but  was not overpowering.  The Bun Rieu and beef pho are also worth trying.

It still gets crowded during lunch, but if you try to time your visit before 11:30AM you'll have your choice of tables and there's ample parking on the nearby streets.

Good job, Pho Ha Tien!
author: Mike O.

description:
Fairly basic Pho spot, nothing special, nothing unusual or off putting. Taste was just about average for Pho.

I would come here if I was in a bind and literally had cravings for nothing.
author: Mario P.

description:
Decent bun rieu. I like how they give you a lot of the egg/crab mix but I think it could've used more flavor.  The noodles were really short, kinda like the bottom-of-the-bowl pieces.

The bbq pork and shrimp spring roll was good.  Kinda tasted like galbi. 

Service was horrible.  We asked to see the menu and they forgot.  I guess they don't like money.

Then she remembered when we asked for the check and she asked if we still wanted to see the menu and we said it was too late.  Her excuse was that the restaurant was too busy but from what I saw there were 4 tables and two servers.
author: Heejin L.

description: One of my favorite go to restaurants. I love their noodles. They have the best Curry noodles and Bun Bo hue. Their prices are very reasonable and they are well staffed unlike some pho restaurants.
author: Kathleen C.

description: So sometimes being in SF so long it's hard to keep up with alot of the new places that are popping up all over the place. I've seem to have missed this joint beings it's probably been here for a minute as well. The Tai' Ga Pho soup which has rare beef and chicken in it, amazing. Also ordered their imperial rolls which come super crunchy how I like. This place is right near City College and how did I miss it? New fan!!
author: Sven S.

description: one of the waitress's attitude is really bad......i feel kind of disrespected,but the food is good though:)
author: Yingying L.

description:
Came here for the first time on a whim after a rough night/morning that warranted some pho and so glad I did!

The staff is friendly and quick to respond. To get to the important stuff, the food!

I ordered pho the first time with my friend but she changed her order to the sautéed beef soup that was an amazing decision. the broth is curry based and spicy with rare steak. Sooooo good. I went back a few days later and will be going back soon for the same dish. Their banh cuon is really good too. Hard to find in many Vietnamese places so I had to order
author: Melanie L.

description: The best Pho. Ever. #10 Satay beef: Creamy coconut pho, unbeatable.
author: Sara T.

description:
Being out here in the "fog belt" and basically not having many choices for a good pho place this side of town, pho ha tien shines like a light at the end of the tunnel. 

The Pho ga had a fair amount of shredded chicken (mix of dark and white meat), noodles were cooked right and not clumpy, the broth is outstandingly flavorful.  I wish they'd give more mint and not cilantro for garnishing my soup. Overall, a great value at $6.50 for a small. Their imperial rolls are good.

I can live without friendly service if my food is cheap and comes out fast.
author: Janice C.

description:
We ordered take out.

One thing that stood out that was positive was that the raw beef that came with my pho was wrapped in plastic wrap, keeping it from bleeding on the noodles. Most pho places will place it directly on the noodles, which typically makes the the noodles look less appetizing.

My wife got the seafood soup, which had a different broth. The flavors of this dish were delicate and refreshing, a contrast to the salty and savory flavors of the pho.

It's hard to give higher than a three, because all I can comment on is the food. We'll stop in next time and hope to get a feel of the ambience, the service, and the consistency of the food.
author: Brian F.

description:
One of the few Pho places around Ocean Avenue.

This place didn't completely disappoint. The staff is all Cantonese speaking, so I suspect it's not really a Vietnamese place.

Pho is a bit plain, but passable. Prices are cheap.

I'd probably opt for a banh mi next time, but here is a perfect example of a Pho place I'd never go out of my way to visit again.
author: Doug R.

description: I ordered #1 and find it not good... it's a large bowl so I can't finish it on my own... the place has plenty amount of seating so there's no need for waiting. Won't come here again unless there's improvement on the cooking. Definitely won't recommend it to my friends.
author: Annabelle L.

description: It was OK until I discovered the HAIR in my pho, and you know what he does, gives me a bowl of curry broth are you serious, never eating here again.
author: Bear S.

description: The soup was good for the price point, but the chicken looked undercooked so I pushed it aside.
author: emily z.

description:
I must say, after seeing "Chef" I feel badly giving a 2 Star review to any restaurant, but this review has nothing to do personally with the cooks at Pho Ha Tien, it's more to do with the food and my personal preferences when it comes to pho. 

I was dying of thirst and a tummy ache when we left the restaurant after our meal, which is disappointing since the pho I'm used to from TT or PPQ leaves me feeling content.

My friend raved about Pho Ha Tien while we slurped our soup at Turtle Tower last week, so, it being his turn to choose our MNDS (Monday Night Dinner Spot), and based on his general enthusiasm for Pho Ha Tien, we stopped in last night for dinner and to chat about our respective weekend escapades. 

The restaurant is big with lots of space for diners, and many of the tables were full, so they must be doing something right. We both ordered the small Pho Tai (rare beef with noodles), hot tea and water, and Fried Imperial Rolls (which were the star of the meal for me). The broth was lacking flavor and, I can't prove that they use it, but seemed to have an MSG quality that made me very parched. The soup is served with thin rice noodles, obviously not my favorite, and they stayed pretty solid throughout the meal. I was hoping they would soften up a bit. 

The wait staff is friendly and brought lots of extra jalapeños, per my request. The meat seemed to be fresh enough. Not sure why my tummy was hurting after, but I doubt I'll be back anytime soon. $15 min charge for CC, fyi.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I love pho here. It was my first pho restaurant ever. I usually always take the same type (rare beef or rare beef with chicken) and it's always good. Noodles are not over cooked and meat is ok. I've also tried the sandwiches and they are good too. Pretty fast service as well! 

I give 4 stars because the service, even tho they are nice and polite, not always speak English but you can kinda understand each other. And also because is not like a super nice, comfortable looking environment. It's not dirty or anything, it just looks kinda old. Also, depending at what time you come it can be pretty hard to find parking. 

But again, I'm gonna keep coming because they price are also pretty good. ($6.75 for a small bowl -which is more than enough for me!!!)
author: Mari Carmen M.

description: Got a 5-spice chicken sandwich to go. For the price ($4.50), it was ok. Lots of bread but skimpy on meat and even less than veggies.
author: Amy L.

description:
One sentence to describe this place would be: Average tasting pho, at a very good location.  I pass by this place every day on my way to and from work and it is always busy.  MY first time trying this place was on Christmas Day.  It was busy, but we were seated instantly by the door. 

 The GF and I ordered pho and an order of vegetable egg rolls.  The egg rolls came first and the pho followed shortly after.  The egg rolls were really good.  I loved the crispy exterior.  The pho was very average tasting.  This would not be a place I would recommend to my friends looking for really good pho.  The location of this place will continue to make it thrive.  The quality of food is  irrelevant.
author: Victor L.

description:
I live nearby and I appreciate this place when I'm feeling too lazy to cook, or need to get my hot broth and noodle fix! I usually get a large beef brisket pho, which is great for the price. The service is alright; the staff are friendly but when the restaurant gets busy, it can take a while before someone takes your order or brings you your bill.

Unfortunately during my last visit, I was given tripe when I ordered brisket. As someone who does not enjoy tripe, I was somewhat disappointed but I will continue to come here!
author: Clarissa M.

description: Horrible smelling Pho; it had a strong stench of blood. I couldn't eat anything but two flavorless spring rolls and the sauce wasn't the usual peanut sauce I was expecting, it was some sort of dark sweet & sour sauce with peanuts sprinkled on top. The chicken shish-kabobs were tiny (false advertisement) and undercooked. My first Thai Ice Tea was good, so I ordered a second, but it was lacking in sweetness. I asked for it to be sweetened, and a spoon or two of sugar was thrown in unstirred, because I could feel the granules as I sipped. I got the sense if I complained it would've been a problem, so I paid the bill in cash and left the food on the table. Lost my appetite. Never again.
author: Zaariah B.

description: The owners at this restaurant yells at their employees in front of you. Neither the employees or the management make an effort to provide good service. They are also very rude. This is one place I will never go back to.
author: Raymond L.

description: Amazing food and service! Thanks Jenny! The garlic noodle and seafood Pho...delicious!
author: Orchid C.

description: The food here has over time gotten BAD LIKE REALLY BAD. I order Charbroiled beef and when I got the plate it look like it's was boiled and a week old beef. My wife got a small bowl of Pho and the broth was cloudy and that means it's from the bottom of the stock pot really BAD.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I decided to venture out to this place for pho. I came here on Wednesday around 12ish. I thought it wouldn't be busy since people would be at work, and the location was more residential, but they were packed. Still, they seated me right away... on a table with a family of four. It was a bit awkward, but I thought it was courteous of them to seat me anyways and to bring out my food first. First off, after awaiting five minutes, I got my meal. I ordered the beef pho bowl combo large. It was huge! The pricing was very fair. For a large, the price was around $8. The size was very generous and it was tasty. One thing to note is that there's a minimum for credit cards of $15. I ordered a drink and summer rolls to go to meet that requirement. 

Overall pricing and portion size was good, customer service was fast, and the meals are filling. I would come here again if I was in the neighborhood. Also, I would bring a friend lol.
author: Shelby B.

description:
Stopped by late on a Monday night and it was surprisingly still quite busy. We ordered pot stickers and cold shrimp rolls (spring rolls elsewhere) for starters. Also got the curry chicken noodle soup with coconut milk, garlic noodles with five spice chicken, and chargrilled chicken skewers. The soup was amazing, reminded me of my favorite Thai dish - khao soy. The price was very reasonable and the skewers actually came with rice paper, noodles and fixings to make them into rolls, which was fun for the kids. The garlic noodles and appetizers were just OK. Definitely plan on returning to try the actual pho though parking is also a little constrained in this area so just need to plan for that. 

Recommend trying it if nearby but not necessarily worth making a specific trip if it is not along your way.
author: Arshia K.

description:
Coming from Orange County with an abundance of authentic Vietnamese cuisine, I would have to say this doesn't quite match. The atmosphere is definitely on spot with it's minimal customer service and packed tables compiled with table stickers on the wall and a circular tray of condiments, but what was the flaw? The food! 

Feeling sick from my first experience with rain ( yes I said it, rain, living in SoCal any water dropping from the sky is rain, it's never just sprinkling lol ) I ordered the pho ga, hoping for a huge bowl of delicious soup that will bring me back to life. There was no chicken in my soup, just scraps of scraps. The vegetables that were provided was ONLY cilantro and bean sprouts. Where are the mint leaves? The onions? Quite dissatisfying.

Paying $7.00 for a bowl of pho is high for what I'm used to, and I just wasn't satisfied. I will try this restaurant again as it was packed so I'm sure there are better options on the menu, but pho ga I will venture to find another spot to satisfy my taste buds.
author: Linh L.

description:
Very sad!  My wife grew up in San Francisco and this was her favorite place in town and was looking forward to dinner.  Service was very bad and they never checked on us.  As for the food, it was so bad I left half of it in the dish when we left
Think twice before eating at this place I know my wife will never be coming back.
author: Jeff P.

description:
I used to pass by this restaurant everyday, twice a day, to and from high school. Many years later on a pho craving in the area, I finally got to try it! 

The ambiance is lackluster and old, and you're greeted by the compost bin at the doorway, but I find those things a little bit charming because despite all these things, its been around for years and years! My friend and I each had pho (mine small, his large). The portions are a little smaller than I've had, but its probably a healthy amount of food. The pho broth was yummy and the garnishes were fresh. 

I would return if I had a pho craving in the area, but its not something I would drive out of the way for. I am pretty excited I finally got to try it after all these years though :)
author: Angela L.

description: Super legit Vietnamese restaurant. Fresh authentic flavors at a very reasonable price. What they lack in ambiance they make up for with service. Great Sunday morning hangover cure.
author: Pablo H.

description:
I got the regular pho beef combination. The pho soup base was good and hits the spot. Compared to some of the Pho places down in the South Bay in San Jose this place is alright. The broth is nice and clear and the stock has a nice rich and crisp flavor to it. Although, I do wish they can add more meat to the pho bowls, I didn't think the meat to rice noodles was good enough like other pho places. 

Service, well you have to be a little more assertive if you want something like water or a refill. But this is usually expected from my experience in many similar restaurants such as these. So no biggy. In short, when it's cold, pho!
author: Arik A.

description:
Great pho, including a special BBQ Chicken pho unavailable elsewhere. It's what got me hooked and kept me coming back! After about 3 years going here, I have yet to find anything that rivals it. It wasn't until I became a regular that the service improved to the point of delight, but now, I look for any reason to go, friends in tow!

Don't let the customer service throw you. The food is worth it!  - but bring cash!!
author: Lauren B.

description:
Nice place for quick inexpensive meal. Most items were about $8. Tough off the street parking.
Line up outside the door to get seated for dinner, but faster if you do not mind sharing a table. Soup noodle is the item to order. Beef stew over rice is good but beef was a little tough. Waitresses speak Cantonese. The restaurant is small, crowded and a little dirty. Restrooms are upstairs behind the service counter.
author: Clifford W.

description: I've been here a couple of times over the past few years. I really like their vietnamese sandwiches $4. Decent size and it's tasty. Their vermicelli dishes saddens me. Don't get me wrong, the meat tastes great and everything else was good but they give you very little meat and a small bowl all for $8. For about the same price, I can get something bigger and about the same taste. The staff here are wonderful. They are super polite and accommodating. I'll keep coming here because it's good but just not happy with their portion sizes.
author: Benita M.

description:
Their menu is pretty extensive with all sorts of pho, soups, rice plates, vermicelli, even crab, etc. 

However, my favorite thing here is the #93....... Garlic noodles. $7. 

Not as buttery as Thanh Long's but also not the long drive down Judah. Good texture and flavor on the noodles and add a banh mi for $3.75 (I like the combo pork/thit ngoi and fish cake) and you got yourself a nice lunch for 2 for less than $13.  

I'll call in my order, pick it up in about 10 minutes, and have a nice garlic noodle/banh mi lunch @ Ocean Beach with Mrs G

3.5 stars but rounding up for the convenience.
author: Earl G.

description:
The nicest staff ever. Always so Gracious. Food is never a disappointment.

Wish they were not next to a gym. I'm always tempted to eat and not workout.


Keep up the good work here! 

I'll be back.
author: Jacky J.

description:
I wanted to try their bun rieu, and I must say it's alright for the broth, but when I tried their crab meat with egg, there was some egg shells. I wasn't too happy when I found out. 
ALSO,
Don't get a small. It's more worth it to get a large for a dollar more.
author: Sandy C.

description:
This place is alright. The pho is very fairly priced and they have a great variety of dessert drinks. However, the staff is rude and are slow with requests such as extra water or more lemons but extremely fast to bring you food to get you in and out as soon as possible. The restaurant is also kind of dirty. 

Moreover, the pho just tasted alright. My sister really likes their bam bu way (I have no idea how to spell it) but I felt like it was just average. Their sandwiches are really good however and fairly prices. 

Overall, I do love that there is a pho place near my house for me to go to then I have my pho cravings and their dessert drinks are very yummy. Just need to improve service and cleanliness and they can easily work their way up to 4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Good:
- Their pho is good, I would say for average price and quality is a 8.5/10
- Best thing they have: Imperial Spring rolls. Very oily but extremely tasty.
- Location and availability of tables is decent. It Doesn't overpacked like other Pho restaurants.

Not so good:
