- Service is kinda slow. They usually take their time to spot you and help you with your order.
author: H C.

description:
I absolutely love this place. 

Great quality food, reasonably priced and their staff is professional and courteous.. what more do you need?..  My boyfriend and I always get #28 with a dollar extra meat (not because their portions are small- but because it's amazing meat). 

I recommend this place to everyone..and their mama!!
author: Sabrina A.

description:
My leading place for bun rieu is the first place I've ever had it, Loi's. Since then, I've tried many different places, but no one made it quite as tasty.. until I came to Pho Ha Tien. When our server brought out my bowl of noodles, I can instantly smell the crab. The broth was flavorful and filled with ingredients! I almost finished the whole large by myself!

Mr. W. ordered the garlic noodles and five sandwiches. We didn't eat all the sandwiches of course! 

Everything we had was yummy and I think I'd rather come here over Loi's because it's one step cleaner than Loi's!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
I usually get the pho tai here and occasionally the beef meatballs, which is solid. It's not the best pho I ever had but it gets the job done. My friend gets the sate. It's good and I like to steal a bit from his soup. I would get it myself but it feels way too rich. I think I would feel way too stuffed if I had that, even though I like it more than the pho tai. 

Remind me to try the bun rieu! Looks like it's a popular item here and from the picture it looks hecka good. 

Guess I'll have to go back sometime soon!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Had bun Bo hue and the pork blood was disgusting and definitely not fresh.
Terrible service and the workers are always in a bad mood it seems. I asked for a to go bag and the lady basically threw it at me and then walked away. Out of the three times I've eaten in here, they will bring me my food and I have to walk up to a worker to ask for something because they're so inattentive to the tables. 
Two stars because their environment sucks but their banh mi is cool.
author: Lily M.

description:
I should probably start going to the 24 Hour Fitness next door instead because with food so bad, who would want to eat afterwards...

After being up all night partying on Saturday, my friend and I were hungry and needed a place to eat incognito. There's nothing more embarassing then having to run into people we know with club gear still on, disheveled hair and smeared drag queen make-up on. Since Jo Jo Café was closed, we ended up at Pho Ha Tien. 

On Sunday, 3.20.11, we arrived at 10:45 AM and luckily there was only one man eating there. PHEW! 

FOOD:
I'm very sensitive to the MSG in Pho broth, so I went with a Com Dia (Rice Plate).

SHRIMP, EGG ROLL, CHARBROILED PORK, SHREDDED PORK & EGG LOAF RICE PLATE ($7.95): UNAPPETIZING!

SHRIMP: Greasy, overcooked, chewy and stale. 

PORK: Dry and jerky-like. Tasted like it was reheated in a microwave.

SHREDDED PORK: Chewy, pork and gelatinous. It was the best part of the dish since it was probably store bought.

EGGROLL: Tasted reheated as some parts were crisp (outer ends) and some parts were soggy. Part of it was burnt to a char so there was charcoal-like after taste to it.

EGGLOAF w/ Vermicelli Noodles and Black Fungus: Moist and fluffy with a very mild flavor from the eggs and a subtle woodiness from the fungus. 

The rice was on the dry and tougher side so I had to moisten it with Nuoc Mam (fish sauce, garlic, lime) which was sweet and tart but watered down as it was missing that intense pungency from the fish sauce and vinegar.

As a side note: We wanted to order 7-up and they didn't have that or Sprite. C'mon now, SERIOUSLY?!?!?

SERVICE:
Typical Asian restaurant; fast but inattentive which is to be expected.

$15 minimum for CC's.

Yesterday was my third time coming to Pho Hao Tien, and I don't remember the food being as bad as it was. I noticed that everyone spoke Canto including the Chefs, so probably a change of ownership?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: #10!!!! "SATE BEEF" Hands down the BEST SOUP I have ever had! It puts basic pho to shame. Its like beef pho but made with coconut milk, peanut sauce and red peppers I believe. Its not a sweet soup! It has the perfect kick. Delicious! SIDE-NOTE:  Its very busy in there and they have the worse customer service, I asked for water 6 times, no one ever brought it. I ordered spring rolls as an appetizer before I ordered my soup, I had to remind them about 3 times. They finally arrived once I was finished with my soup. Not cool.
author: Jenelle A.

description: I came here to get some Pho after going to the target next door.  I don't expect a high standard of customer service from Vietnamese restaurants. However, the servers in this restaurant are especially rude. After I finished my meal, I tried to ask them for the check many times and the servers just ignored and passed by like nothing happened. The tables around me could clearly heard my voice and turn around. I even heard one server passed by with a "psss..." Overall, the food is below average and service is just horrible.
author: An L.

description: I came here a couple of times for lunch. It tends to get busy around 12pm but the food comes very quickly. The pho is usually decent with yummy soup base. I was disappointed the last time I came here when I ordered a HK style milk tea along with my pho. The milk tea had way too much ice. At least more than half the cup was filled with ice, I barely had any milk tea in there.
author: Melanie N.

description: I absolutely love the food here! I always order the fried banana with ice cream when I come here too :)
author: Cessy C.

description: Great Place for Pho, reasonably priced.
author: Shauna f.

description: This place is honestly so amazing, I love it. I got the spring rolls and sate beef and it was delicious. It's my favorite when I come here, the flavors are amazing. My sister got the chicken noodle soup which was also really good. I love coming here on cold days or when I have a hangover! I've also picked up from here as well and it's always fast. The portions are big and the prices are good, definitely my first choice when I want a good pho. There's a tapioca drink that's really good too, my boyfriend always gets it when we come and I end up drinking it all!
author: Tanya M.

description: I had just had a very satisfying experience at Comix Experience Outpost before I entered Pho Ha Tien and, lo and behold I was satisfied again. I was the only white dude in there. Actually I'm lying there was one other white person and I was actually forced to sit with her because of how many people were in there that day. I saw what she had ordered and looked hard for a picture of her entree in the menu. I pointed to the picture when the waitress acknowledged my presence and she returned with my order in 5 min or less. It was pretty good pho. There were "ox blood cubes" in mine. I don't know how I feel about that but the meal was great and it was totally affordable. I'll be back (tôi s tr li)
author: Anthony R.

description: I should have taken a picture before I ate everything . Also I regret not coming here more often after the gym . It's healthy and tastes amazing also the people that work here are nice . I enjoyed my meal , try the #10 I loved it . Thank you for a delicious meal .
author: G. N.

description:
Authentic Vietnamese menu. 
Average Vegetarian Pho. 

Everything seemed a bit sticky: tables, chairs, condiments

But would return to try other items.
author: Jane N.

description: Great place with fast service. I've been here so many times and each time I leave feeling satisfied. Apart from some complaints about the interior of the venue(I've never understood why established venues don't upgrade their interior when they're obviously successful), the food is great and so is the service.
author: Jeremiah A.

description: I started coming here because it's right outside of the gym. 1. I think the food is excellent. I have often had the seafood noodle soup and I've thoroughly enjoyed it, down to the last drop. 2. The pricing seems competitive to me. Large bowl of soup: $8.75 which I think is good. 3. Service has been consistently poor. I go in and I am ignored for 10+ minutes. Sometimes I just leave after 10 minutes figuring that the wait staff is very busy and I should try another night. 4. This restaurant looks very clean to me. It's closed on Tuesdays.
author: John H.

description: This restaurant has a special place in my heart. I've been going here for years. Great pho. Wide menu selection. Your traditional, standard, family-run Vietnamese restaurant. Quick but friendly service. I agree with a couple other folks that you will get hungry after a few hours as the portions, particularly when it comes to meat, aren't large, so I recommend ordering an appetizer - like imperial roles - with your bowl of pho or vermicelli/rice order.
author: Yvette L.

description:
Don't come here. Go to sunflower restaurant on Valencia and 17th . Terrible customer service. They gave me my check before they gave me water.  Ordered beef got served some 

questionable looking meat half of which was all fat 

Don't every come here. Point blank period
author: Chenea P.

description: I love ordering #10: Sauté Beef Noodle Soup. It's spicy soup with coconut milk and peanuts. It contains lettuce and strips of cucumbers. It's very delicious. I usually order it with a light spice level because I don't want too spicy. My other favorites are the vermicelli section. I like to order the beef vermicelli usually. The raw beef with lime juice and fried garlic is awesome. You mix up everything on the plate and pour the sauce and...YUM. It's so fresh in your mouth. Seriously, everything on the menu is good.
author: Jackie L.

description: This is my go-to noodle place when I'm in SF....its a little informal.  The dining room is cafeteria-style (great for lunch as the wait-staff bring you your food and leave you alone, though keep your water glass filled.   The Sate Beef noodle (#10 on the Menu) is AMAZING!!  Price is reasonable ($7-10 for most items but plenty of food).  Street parking on ocean ave out front, or free parking on side streets.
author: Sachin P.

description:
I love the pho here. A small portion is just enough for me. I always get the Pho Tai (rare beef on side). The broth is flavor and always piping hot. Recently tried the Imperial Rolls and I'm hooked on those too.

The only sucky part about this place is the service. I feel like if you aren't Vietnamese (or Asian in general) they kind of ignore you. If the food wasn't amazing, I really wouldn't come here at all.
author: Princess D.

description: Best bun rieu I've had in the San Francisco Bay Area. And it's awesome that they have banh cuon cha lua--it's not found often enough at Vietnamese restaurants. Definitely going back.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Uncle brought us here our last night in San Fran. We arrived as soon as they opened because we had a flight out pretty early. They knew my uncle from all the times he's been there and was very friendly.

I had Banh Cuon and it was pretty good! It was a lot though so I couldn't finish it since it was so early.

My uncle orders from here all the day and gets it picked up for his lunch break.
author: Jo L.

description:
unpalatable！
especially the beef！
***please bring $15 cash if you eat under $15 because (see attached) ...
author: Jenny Z.

description: Ordered the Curry Ga and Bun Rieu. Bland for both. The curry had no curry flavor, just coconut. Bun Rieu was just oily red broth but no distinguishing flavors. Maybe add salt and crab paste...?
author: Julie L.

description:
Pretty horrible service here. Came in, sat down and took them 20 minutes to come by and ask me what I wanted to order.  Then the waitress has the audacity to tell me she was busy. I pointed out each and every customer that came in after me, that she helped before me.  All she had to say was "Oh."  

Bitch please.  

Food=meh.  I've had better

Spring rolls were dry. 

Pho was ok. Flavorful but had way too many onions in it.
author: Chai S.

description: My favorite pho place in San Francisco besides Good Noodle! Everything is so on point. I come here more often than I would like to admit since I live so close. The staff is super nice and most of them speak Cantonese. My favorite is their number 10 pho with coconut milk and peanuts. It's amazing, try it!! I also tried out one of their appetizers today, the rare steak with peanuts and lemons and oh my goodness, what is life when you have this in your tummy? Definitely an instant favorite! Anyways, a (long overdue) quick little review for my favorite family owned pho restaurant on Ocean ave!
author: Abby C.

description:
Came here for a quick lunch hoping to get a decent bowl of pho. I had the number two large ($7.50), which is the Pho Dac Biet. They also have the XL sized bowl, Pho Xe Lua ($8.50).

It flavor is okay, came with 3 pieces of half cut beef balls, several pieces of meat, and some tripe. I was hoping to get a piece of tendon like other Vietnamese places I go to but that wasn't included. Again this was for the Combination Bowl of Pho. 

We were served hot tea and service was okay for busy 1pm lunch.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
Decent pho and great spot to eat at right after a gym session at 24 Hour Fitness.

Unfortunately those are only positives that I experience when I reflect on my experiences here at this restaurant. 

Service here is very poor, very typical in terms of rudeness when you are dining at an Asian restaurant.

Recently came here with a friend after a workout and was sat down. Waitress came and asked what we wanted to order... I asked if we could get two minutes to decide and she insisted on us ordering the #1 combo pho. Very rude here.

After finishing our food we were verbally told our amount in Cantonese, left a $20 bill on the table and it was quickly snatched.

All I have to say.
author: Sam K.

description: This is the place to go when you're looking for a decent bowl of pho and don't want to go far. It's good but not the best. The portions are generous and the price is right (XL for 9 bucks!?). I ordered a small beef stew and walked out pretty satisfied. There's also a 24 hour fitness right next door so it's a great place for a post workout meal.
author: Evonne T.

description:
The food is generally good but nothing really exceptional outside of the typical fare offered at the average Vietnamese restaurant. Place gets busy often especially for dinner and weekend lunches as its conveniently located next to 24 hr fitness and under a residential complex in front of K muni line. 

I would've given this place 4 stars if it wasn't for the very subpar unfriendly customer service and also somewhat utilitarian hole-in-the-wall unclean appearance of the place. I'm a regular customer and they never acknowledge me as one with a friendly greeting and service whenever I walk in. Especially the owners who I think are brothers. They never answer their phone either. Often times times at night they're cleaning up and putting chairs on tables and mopping the floor around you while you're eating your dinner even tho there's still 15-20 minutes left before official closing time. And of course they give you the check way before you're done eating. Yet judging from the numerous similar complaints from other Yelp reviewers over the years they don't seem to care about improving. Guess they get enough regular business with their cheap food that they've accepted complacency. They're also pretty cheap like charging extra just for some extra soup to add to the often dry (but tasty) beef stew noodle soup which is what I often order. I hate how many Asian restaurants (typically fobby ones) perpetuate the stereotype of the rude Asian customer service and this place definitely perpetuates it.
author: p f.

description:
What the Pho..

Everybody can be a little crazy at times. Shoot, I know I'm not the sanest of people on my morning drives to school or work. Not that I "love" cutting grannys doing 10 on 25 lanes, but I have a habit of arguing with my radio. Yes, my radio. It really pisses me off sometimes, especially when I'm cranky in the morning. 

The TYPICAL morning commute.. 

* turn on car, radio turns on *

Radio: "Accidents? DUI's? Revoked License? No Problem! You could be paying only $15 a month for auto insurance TODAY!" 

Me: No, you can't. You wouldn't even be driving if you have a DUI or a revoked license.. STFU radio! 

* tunes to next radio station *

Radio: ".. stupid h0e, (yeah) you a, you a stupid h0e, 
You a stupid h0e, you a, you a stupid h0e .."

Me: THIS IS MUSIC!? WHY IS THIS EVEN ON THE RADIO!?!?

* PRESS NEXT STATION *

Radio: "UNTZ UNTZ UNTZ WAWAWA WAWAWA .."

Me: FUUUU!! Thanks for the headache, Radio.. Y U NO LIKE ME!?

* turns off radio * 

Pho Ha Tien is your typical Vietnamese restaurant; operated by Chinese employees capitalizing on the pho franchise, has the gritty hole-in-the-wall feel, and carries along substandard service which is expected.

Raw Beef Carpaccio - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/E4zEQ-_w_Ogokj6balg5NA?select=dHwrnSss-XJv3X73p4Hg3g
Terrible. (see picture) It looks as if the meat was sliced with a handsaw, and where was the marbling!? It just looked like a 30 second mess. 

#1 Combination Pho (XL only) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/E4zEQ-_w_Ogokj6balg5NA?userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Again, your typical pho. The broth wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. A tad watered down and a mild variety of various meats which was quite off in ratio to the heavy amount of noodles. 

Curry Beef w/ Rice - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/E4zEQ-_w_Ogokj6balg5NA?select=0XpFftv88-y3_qz9S9S6eQ
This was clearly Beef Stew.. and a mediocre one, at best. Quite oily, there was more fatty chunks of stewed beef than lean. The stew itself also tasted watered down and became unappetizing not soon after. Wait, this was suppose to be Curry right?

What really threw me off was when in the beginning. While waiting for a table to open up for our party of 3, one of the female employees "strictly" told us to sit at a cramped table that would have resulted in elbow bumping with the other patrons. We said we could wait for a table to open up, since we saw others were finishing up, but she proclaimed, "NO TIME TO CLEAN UP" and DEMANDED that we sit at the table that she so "kindly" chosen for us. Wtf? A few other employees saw what was happening and quickly bussed one of the nearby tables clean for us, but throughout our meal, nothing but mean muggin' and no verbal service from that crazy nut. 

Asian dude arguing with his radio at 7AM? 
Nah, that's normal. But damn, some b*tches just be crazy.
author: Albert L.

description: Staff is decent and venue is relatively clean for a Vietnamese restaurant. However, pho broth is plain and the imperial rolls are scrawny. The sauce along with the imperial rolls tasted watered down. Definitely not one of the better phos around.
author: Genevieve M.

description: I do not recommend this phò restaurant. My boyfriend and I went and his soup had a long Griny hair in it and when we told the waitress she didn't apologize or even acknowledge it. She took the bowl and came back with hard uncooked noodles !! Never eating here again
author: Cecilia P.

description: Been coming here for over a decade and never been bad. Fair warning for vegans/vegetarians. I had the #23 (vegetarian broth with vegetables) today and found some tripe in my broth. I'm hoping it was just an accident but I'm not sure. So beware as this is the only labeled vegetable based phó they offer.
author: D M.

description: This place is not bad at all, serves big portions for a decent price customer service average. Food is always good. yes I'd recommend this place if your in the neighborhood. No need to go anywhere else further and yes they do take credit cards.
author: Braddah Rick M.

description:
Been coming here for years now... But not for the pho.  The pho is mediocre if you can even call it that.

I don't know what it is about their sandwiches though that keeps me coming back!  It's not like they have great amazing banh mi sandwiches here but that light crispy flaky crust that opens you up to the goodies inside is somehow crazy addictive to me.  Either the combination or fancy pork for me... be sure to add extra meat because they aren't very generous.  I also love their pate... Not as pasty as most other pate but still tasty with a little bit of peppery kick. Ask for extra pate as well.  You won't regret it.  With the extras the sandwich still only comes out to $5.50.  

Winning.
author: Colin M.

description: I like coming here when in the area, because service is quick, and the prices are relatively low compared to everywhere else in the city. I've never had to wait for a table, to boot. Food-wise, the pho broth here isn't as unctuous as other places, and the basil usually comes with bruised leaves, but the noodle portions are huge. The BBH and coconut broth noodles are pretty good, too. There isn't much meat in their bowls, though, so if you're craving protein, you'll need to order extras on the side. Also, they have a restroom, but it's in the back up a climb of stairs.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Pho is delicious, but celiac and gluten sufferers beware!! "Rice noodles" are NOT gluten free!! 

My gf was already recovering from a pizza place that gave us regular pizza instead of the gluten free crust. So we ordered our favorite comfort food, pho--because the noodles are always made of 100% rice!
Now she's has non-stop celiac food poisoning for three days. Gluten-free is not just a fad, there are people with life threatening allergies. Be careful and ask every time!
author: Tobi H.

description:
Ordered Five Spices Chicken, rice & a side of steamed vegetables. The chicken skins were spotted with a significant number of feathers, I found three short hairs in my food & the vegetables were steamed to near mush. "They taste like they were boiled in dirty dish water," my niece said. Agreed.

To be fair, my niece & a friend both enjoyed their respective meals. However, my friend DID revise his order after an initial selection. He later stated, "I forgot I don't like the chicken here." Thanks for the head's up!

I will not be back. Too many outstanding Asian restaurants in the area to settle for this.
author: Pollo D.

description: I'd like to think I know what good pho is and try and seek out the best in the city.  I've come here several times since it's often close to my work projects and also 24 hour fitness.  This place is far from the best for pho but it works if your in a hurry.
author: Paul T.

description: Man fuck this place i aint never had worse pho in my life and that shit was cold man who tf tryna eat some cold ass pho not only that the waiter straight up whip his dick out and put that shit in my pho cuz i asked him to take it back i was like fr fr the thai tea was bomb tho
author: Jose A.

description:
I love this place. It's reasonably priced and tastes delicious. I've tried the pho (rare beef yum), the boba, and the Vietnamese sandwiches (bbq, duck pâté, and the pork) and I love all of it.... 

If you want something fresh and satisfying try this place out, it does not disappoint.
author: B D.

description:
I was fooled by the crowd within the restaurant.  

I walked in and waved and was asked to be seated at the big table.  We sat next to an awkward couple and another guy waiting for his to go order.

I saw an empty table and requested to be seated there and instead the server gave the seat to the couple next to us.  It was understandable because they came in first, but then again they didn't request it *shrugs*.

So they got the table.  No big deal.  15 minutes later the server comes and ask the guy who is waiting for his to go order if he wanted tea and he had to point out to her that we were the actual patrons waiting for our order to be taken.  She leaves the tea at our table and walks off.

I looked around only to find that she had seated someone else at a small table and had already taken her order.  I had to stare down at the staff for them to realize that our order had not be taken.  Instead of having our order taken we were asked to move to a smaller table.  By this time I was irked....the pho better be DAMN good.

I stared intently again at the staff and they finally decided to come over and take our order.  

We ordered two # 2's, one small and one large.  I stared around again they fed everyone else before and after us.  They obviously forgot our order.  The bowls finally arrived and I was shocked.

I thought to myself...."this is a combo right????" There was no tendon, barely a full strand of tripe, and a few scraps of meat.  I am never the type to finish my pho and i finished this bowl.  I didn't finish it because it was DAMN good, but I finished it because they hardly gave me any food!

Now to the flavor.....msg water.....only hot sauce semi-salvaged it.  I left a pho restaurant hungry.....that should never ever happen to anyone!

The crowd are just the regulars that live there.  Next time I will drive to Irving for some real pho.
author: Michelle S.

description: I've eaten in the restaurant and ordered delivery. The pho tai has a dense sauce with lots of flavor. I would say the basic order comes with a lot of meat. The imperial rolls are crispy and flavorful. I'm very fond of the shaken beef and pork chop. The service was fine. I'm not someone who needs a lot of explanation about Vietnamese food. So, I really just care about the food being timely and the waitstaff being friendly, which was all true. I ordered takeout through Yelp. They seperated the pho parts so nothing was soggy. I've also ordered the dim sum. The fillings are very tasty.
author: Therese M.

description:
This is still my go-to place for banh cuon and I am still a big fan. But they break my heart every time I get an order of banh cuon that has thick skin and skimpy filling. Are the banh cuons consistent every time I order it? The answer is an obvious no. I just cross my fingers hoping I get a "good batch" made by the "good chef" with thin skin and lots of meat filling every time I order it. However, one component of the banh cuon is consistent, and that's their flavorful pork filling - which is what primarily keeps me coming back.

Otherwise, everything in my old review holds true.
author: Christina C.

description: Favorite pho places in San Francisco! It's perfect for an occasional after workout treat especially since it's next to 24 hour fitness. Shrimp spring rolls are my favorite and I always get plain noodle! Great service and food
author: Rene L.

description:
I came here with my dragon boat time for dinner around 5:30pm on a Saturday and we were able to get seats because we reserved ahead of time. Though is started getting crowded around 6:30pm with people waiting outside to be seated. 

The pho here is alright and I definitely have tried better. It doesn't take too long to get your food .

The bathrooms here are a bit small though there is one for men and one for women.
author: Amy T.

description: Not a bad location. Came here looking for a quick cold remedy. As always I love me Pho since being Asian and all. I ordered a large bowl and was surprised I finished it all up cause normally I can't finish a large bowl by myself. I remember loading the soup up with all spicy condiments that was offered to me that day. Felt better the next day...I swear by it.
author: Tina L.

description:
Excuse my language, but this place fucking sucks. 

I ordered the vegetable pho with tofu and they literally gave me 4 small ass pieces of tofu. The whole reason I ever order pho is for the tofu and veggies, at least I got SOME veggies, *shaking head*. 

I asked my waiter for water when we ordered and a plate of lemons because my boyfriend likes to put lots of lemons in his pho. Perhaps these people need to figure out the difference between limes and lemons -_-. Didn't get EITHER of those things, so frustrating. We get our pho, so I ask the girl that brought it out for some water (second time I had to ask) and she looked at me like I was stupid. So then I ask the LADY THAT DOESN'T SPEAK A LICK OF ENGLISH FOR SOME WATER and guess what she does RIGHT IN FRONT OF ME. She gets a DIRTY glass and runs it under water in the sink and then put ice and tap water in it. ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME?! I SHOULD call the health department on these lazy fucks and the fact that she did it RIGHT IN FRONT OF ME not even trying to hide it, EW!!!! I don't even want to know what their kitchen looks like, HELLA RATCHET!!!!!!!

I am a waitress and I have worked in the industry for about 7 years now, I would NEVER treat a paying customer like that, I was almost tempted to not leave a tip at all (which I have NEVER done before IN MY LIFE!!!) But I was sooo grossed out at this place that I couldn't even eat my meal. My boyfriend made me tip anyways, which is unusual! I'm thinking about filing a report on these people, for real. 

NEVER eat here, go somewhere else.
author: Courtney S.

description: I love coming here on a chilly day to warm my self up since it's right down my house. Unlike other pho places when I get a medium or large they don't only just put it in a bigger bowl with hella soup but with actual more noodles. I also love how when I get a coke they give me a bottled coke because I can't finish a can coke with pho. Handy dandy to take the bottle home and drink another time. The people are nice and the mirrors around everywhere makes me happy since I love to touch up on myself every now and then. The soup tastes good and the rice plates were good. I wish they had more pictures on the menu so I can tell what's what and how it's going to look though.
author: Sul L.

description:
They're nice, the food is fast, there's always 1 open table somewhere, never had any issues here.  I think San Jose has better Vietnamese food but I'm white and I don't know any better--five stars!

To the people saying it takes too long for the bill: just pay at the register and be on your merry way!
author: Max H.

description:
My husband and I used to go here on a regular basis until we moved further away. It is one of the best, authentic Vietnamese restaurants we've been to (and my husband knows what's best, he grew up on Vietnamese food ;)) ). 
Their Pho is great - my husband's choice but I love their Bun Riêu... Not a lot of restaurants have it which is a disappointment. Also the Bánh Xèo is soo good, but I haven't been able to find it anywhere else so now I'm forced to make it at home. Their Banh Mì sandwiched are also our favorites. 

My only dislike about them is that the restaurant could use some updates especially in the cleanliness department.
author: Marta B.

description: I went to this Place for Vietnamese for years next to 24 hour fitness. It like the "Bun Tuoc Nung Cha Gio "roasted pork on a bed of rice noodle with Fish Sauce with lime zest called "Nuoc Mum"
author: Chanh N.

description:
Came here because it was recommended by my boyfriend he said he had came here before (a long time ago) and how the soup where really good, As soon as we are walking in we get this horrible smell of seafood they had the compost right next to the front door gross! We walk in not sure if we sit ourselves or we get sat, a guy comes sits us downs maybe like 2 minutes go by and they come already to take our order? We ask for a few for Minutes, I ended up ordering the chicken curry noodle and my bf gets his usual seafood noodle soup & we also order a Bbq beef sandwich our soups came out pretty fast I'm pretty excited to try my soup....But I try it and I did not like the flavor maybe because it had coconut milk or just because it was not my taste! The weird oily after taste it left.... Yuck! It just wasn't my cup of tea well in this case cup of soup I got about 2 3 bites and didn't finish any of it! Not one time did the server come n ask if everything was okay nothing! I mean I'm pretty sure they knew I didn't like it since I had a full bowl In front of me... The sandwich comes and the bread is so hard the top of my mouth hurt by the end of the sandwich it was lacking beef more bread then meat. Only reason I finished the sandwich was because I was so hungry!        



They come drop the check didn't say one word us the service was bad!! Didn't even want the food to go but my hubby loves soup n he liked it so we got it to go.. : | overall I didn't enjoy my experience here there are so many Vietnamese places in SF trying something new was not a good idea lol! I should of sticked with Kevin's noodle house in Westlake.. Ha
author: Erika E.

description:
Decent pho, decent egg rolls, decent char-broiled meats with rice. All their vietnamese stuff is on the slightly above average scale. Mind you, I'm being generous here. Their broth has long since been watered down, I know they freeze half their stuff, and if it weren't for the fact they're the closest halfway decent pho place around, I wouldn't come here.

Their derivatives of american cuisine are terrible however.  Friend ordered a pork and shrimp crepe last night, since he is a major fan of them.

What we got gave us the immediate impression it came out of the deep fat fryer because it was literally dripping in grease. We asked the shift manager at the time if it was deep fried, but he corrected us that it was pan fried! 

The inside was horrible. A mess of onions and bamboo shoots, with a light scattering of pork bits and and some of the toughest shrimp we've ever tried chewing. To top it all off, it was bland beyond bland. We called the manager over again and he defended himself by saying that it was 'how it was supposed to taste', that the filling was not seasoned whatsoever, that it was meant to be eaten with the fish sauce and vegetables on the side. 

We could not send it back as it seemed, so I paid for us and my friend said that he would never come back. I still would, if only for my usual pho, but at least I know that this place can't cook a crepe. Don't order the crepes.
author: Ivan J.

description:
A Vietnamese restaurant that doesn't speak Vietnamese. 

Imperial rolls were good.

The rest of it is okay. I am also very particular with pho.
author: Carrie-C N.

description:
I always get a rice plate here and its the best but the pho is always a good serving for the price it is
The employees are always friendly and make sure your get the service you pay for.
author: Penuel B.

description:
Satay Beef Pho has the highest place in my heart. It always make me have pho attack.

Killer: Satay Beef Pho
author: Wayne Z.

description:
Best Vietnamese sandwiches around. I come here all the time for one thing only. 

The BBQ pork sandwich.

I get their pho every once in a while and its great, but I always find myself craving one of their sandwiches. I'm hooked.
author: Tom G.

description:
Best BBQ chicken noodle soup in San Francisco (.)
I go here every weekend and they never disappoint me. 
Always friendly I will definitely recommend this place to eat. Also they have other food that taste fantastic but top is the noodle soups.
Best place ever. Price is great for quality of foods they have 
Also sandwiches are the best in the block. 
This place is good hands down. No one can reach the level of goodness. 
Love to eat here been here millions of times and never been disappointed.
author: Oscar T.

description: Ordered bun bo hue to go. They packaged used limes so I'm assuming they reuse old bean sprouts and limes plates when people do not eat them after dining in. The meat, especially the pork feet, also tasted old and gross. I didn't even bother finishing the rest.
author: Michelle H.

description:
portions are huge, but I literally only go here for their bun bo hue.  

their bbh is on point and a lot better than other places I've tried in the city (primarily Irving street)  the soup base has just the right spice and they load it up with meat and pork blood cubes. I do wish they had a real pig's feet in there because I love the tendons and the meatiness.  a lot of noodles and top it off with some lime and bean sprouts.

pho - do not get pho here. meat was dry and tough. super disappointing. the soup base was so sweet??? which was really weird. the portion was HUGE but I could not eat the meat here at all. 

imperial rolls - it was pretty good and I love the crunch it has here!  I would definitely order this again.

service - attentive when you called the waitresses over and they take your order pretty quick.  just a bit awkward with the gym being next door.... but post work out meal? 

parking - a lot of meter outside, but also can find residential parking if you try!
author: Josie L.

description: Parking sucks but this place is fast and super tasty. If you are looking for good Pho, they are the best in the neighborhood. On hot days I like their vermicelli. And they have the best imperial rolls around! Wish they delivered, though!
author: Rosalyn W.

description: I always come here for pho since its pretty good for student that go to City College. The #1 pho on the menu is a pretty large bowl of pho. Not many people want that big so they would go for #2 for large or small. I never had bad pho here before and I plan not to.
author: Nick F.

description: Best curry chicken soup in town ever. Family run place. Great prices. A little slow on service, but you can always just go up to the counter. Really excellent food.
author: Lu C.

description: The soup was great once they brought my order back out. The service was absolutely horrible. They ignored my friend and I the entire time. It costs .50 to get a to-go box. When we asked for the check the ladies took over 15 minutes to return, once we paid they asked for a tip. It was very unprofessional. I would not recommend going here.
author: Maggie S.

description: If you're in the neighborhood and craving pho, this is a good option.  The fast service will get you in and out.
author: Heather R.

description:
Great customer service (The food comes out quickly but I'm not rushed out) and can't ask for a better location (right next to the 24 hour fitness). Nothing like a hard day's workout and then walking right next door for hot bowl of Pho. 

I've tried pretty much everything on the menu, but here are some favorite items:
#2 - Combo Beef Noodle Soup - Flavorful broth and fresh beef and tripe
#25 - Charbroiled Pork - The BBQ Pork is delicious!
#46 - Fried Spring Rolls - Fresh out of the fryer. Crispy!
#92 - Combination Pork Banh Mi - Crunchy roll, Pork (There's definitely a theme here!).
author: Veronica C.

description:
Update: I tried their Spareribs Noodle and it wasn't that good.  I will stick to ordering the super good BBQ Chicken Noodle Soup.  Pictures have been added.

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: A lot of easy street parking free and meters.  No wait.
_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: Average.  Has small TV with sports or news normally playing.  There is free wifi in the area.
_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: This is one of the best places to get pho in San Francisco.  Try the BBQ Chicken Pho.  The chicken is served on the side and is crispy and flavorful. 
_____

Overall Experience
5/5 Stars

_____

Pictures

BBQ Chicken Noodle Soup: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/E4zEQ-_w_Ogokj6balg5NA?select=-XH57EjYPpiukwhtQJnIEg

Spareribs Noodle: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/E4zEQ-_w_Ogokj6balg5NA?select=C7ZEAPjttSPFtpjv6cygPg
author: Elliott N.

description:
Their food is pretty inconsistent. I usually get the Bun Bo Hue but it seems to taste different every time. When it's good, it's really good. It is also really spicy so if you're not a fan, I don't recommend it.
Their Vietnamese sandwiches are also pretty good.
author: Julia N.

description:
This was an okay place. Unfortunately I was not satisfied with my meal here. The pho is very lacking in meat, but abundant in noodles. The soup was light, but not bland. The pho didnt do it for me, the prices are average. Id rather get pho somewhere else. The fried bananas with ice cream here are amazing. Crispy fried bananas with caramel drizzle and sweet vanilla ice cream. I'd definitely come back just for the fried bananas.
The service was great and the place was packed when we got here, but seating was available.
author: Veronica L.

description:
This place sucks.

I ordered the Duck & Bamboo Vermicelli and was disappointed. The bamboo was barely edible - very chewy, big chunks and not good. There was barely any duck meat - mostly just scrapping off whatever was on the bones. The soup was bland - I kept adding stuff and it was still no bueno.

The combo rice plate was skimpy! There's a shitload of rice underneath thin slices of pork, there was a baby eggroll, the egg cake, maybe a shrimp or two and some veggies. Not worth it. 

That's what we get for eating pho in SF.. should have drove across the bridge to Oakland..
author: Jennie P.

description:
I like this place. ITs not the best but its close by and right outside 24hour fitness on ocean so its very convient for some grub after a good work out. 

I enjoy the spring rolls and deep fried imperial Rolls. For plates, i go with dry vermicelli shredded and charbrioled pork, or the BBQ chicken. Im not a fan of pho soups so i cant judge the pho. There quick, nice enough, and it looks clean. Closed on Tuesdays and dont accept credit under 20. BOOO!
author: Benjamin B.

description: Place is solid for what it is.  It's our favorite local spot for a yummy, cheap, and fast lunch or dinner.  Service is friendly and efficient.
author: Bret W.

description:
The atmosphere has this old school seventies feel reminiscent of my favorite Vietnamese delicious hole in the wall restaurants in Little Saigon in Southern California growing up.

The Bun Bo Hue is delicious.  Soup tastes fragrant and spicy, a good variety and generous amount of meats you would expect in this dish, noodles taste right.

The three color drink, with a mix of coconut and pandan flavors, is delicious too!
author: Jeff T.

description: Love this place! You'll see me here getting take out at least once a week. I tried the bun bo hue at the place down the street by Ocean and Phelan and this one is a million times better!
author: Evelyn N.

description:
I attempted to become a "regular" here, because it was the closest pho joint around and because pho is god damn delicious. 

I gave them about four tries before I gave up. Once, we were one of two groups in the whole restaurant and the service was still shitty, almost as if they were doing it on purpose. They insist on giving me the fattiest, most inedible beef in my pho, the last and final time I came here I removed all the fat globs from my soup and left them in a nice little mountain on my plate as a sign of contempt. 

They never "check up" on me, in fact they refuse to make eye contact with me altogether. Multiple times I've had to physically get out of my seat to ask them for things - for refills, to take my order, to get the check. Wtf? What are they paying these people to do? 

Never again.
author: Alyssa T.

description: The staff are very friendly and welcoming. I got the Bun Bo Hue and it was ok. I've definitely had better but it wasn't bad. My sister got the vermicelli and BBQ chicken, and said it was decent as well. The service is fast. The prices are fair and I would recommend this place if you're in the area or want a quick bite to eat.
author: Katherine L.

description:
No frills, no ambiance, Asian restaurant but the pho is pretty good. Be aware that when it says "spicy" on the menu it really means it!

Only complaint is our appetizers arrived after we were brought our main dishes

Prices are reasonable - 3 large bowls of pho, 2 appetizers, and drinks was about $42
author: Bumble B.

description:
I've been coming here for years now because I live around the area and it's walking distance from my house. Let me start off to say that this place is a family-run business. I love the servers/cashiers as I have gotten to know them over the years. They're friendly people and they always know what I want to order -- BBQ chicken sandwich or if I want to do something different, BBQ chicken rice plate, haha.

They offer a variety-type of food & drinks like pho, sandwiches, vermicelli, rice plates, tapioca, soda, beer, etc. I think the food is decent. Every time I bring a friend over, I recommend the BBQ sandwich and they always love it. I brought my roommate here for her first time trying pho and she loved it too! The pho isn't spectacular but it's decent! All nice and hot..just like any other pho, haha.  

It's located next to a 24 hour fitness, so after your work outs, you can always stop by for a quick meal or drink! Parking is sometime hard to find since it's on Ocean Ave..always busy and stuff. Decor is alright, full of mirrors! Wouldn't recommend using their restroom though..kinda dirty (at least from the last time I saw it..but that was yearssss ago!). 

Oh, just to mention - their BBQ chicken for the sandwiches IS pre-cooked. They add the ingredients into your sandwich and reheat it in a microwave again. lol. I don't know if I was allowed to say that..but just letting you guys know.. since I always eat that. Still tasty to me though! Nice and warm :) I don't taste the pre-cookedness so yeah..  :) Still recommended! 

Overall: 
+ Service: 4 stars (Am I biased because I know them after years of coming?)
+ Food: 4 stars (I'm always ordering the same thing..BBQ chicken sandwich!) 
+ Decor: 3 stars 
+ Cleanliness: 3 stars 
..Why did I give them 5 stars? I gave them 5 stars because I come here all the time and their customer service meets my expectations. Not the best I've ever gotten, but good enough for me, and I love their food!
author: Mandy G.

description: I come here for the chicken Pho and I absolutely love it! It's also very decently priced and affordable. When I'm feeling like treating myself I also get the shrimp spring rolls which are amazing. I took a couple of my girlfriends here and they raved about how good the Thai Tea was.
author: Mari C.

description: This is my local pho place I go to. The bun rieu is pretty good, always get it here. One of the better places around sf. Top spot is still the place on Irving. Service is good too. The thing I would suggest is to turn on the air conditioning on hot days. It would make the dinning experience a lot better during hot weather.
author: d c.

description:
My Uncle came to Pho Ha Tien about three years ago to have pho.  I don't know if he ever finished his pho because he found a fly in it.  I mean, come on.  REALLY?!

I also tried their Vietnamese sandwiches.  The chicken tasted so bland... the bread was soft, not crusty, not French roll, nothing special... there was no sauce or anything to make it tasty... it was just SO bland.
author: Christine A.

description: I searched Yelp in hopes that I could find a Vietnamese Restaurant that delivers to my house is in Daly City.  The reviews are good and the food looks great but I guess I have to visit the restaurant because they do not deliver any longer.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Pretty decent Vietnamese fair, but the prices and the taste sure can't compare with what you'd get in San Diego or Westminster - but hey, at least it's down the street from me.  The Banh Mi is quite good and I ordered it to go one time during my lunch break.  It came up quickly and was good and served on good bread (banh mi = bread afterall!).

The Bun Bo Hue was ok when I ordered it, but it wasn't the best I've ever had.

They do have green chopsticks, so that is a start.  If they stepped it up a notch then we'd really be talking!
author: Brian L.

description:
This review is for the bún riêu only. 

My bowl of bún riêu was very bland over all. The broth was bland and the meat was bland. The riêu part was supposed to be made up of crab meat and eggs but I only saw and tasted eggs. 

The food was cheap, though.
author: LeTran B.

description: I come here after the gym with my friends to grab a bite to eat once in a while. The Bun Rieu is decent. I tend to get the sugar cane shrimp or meatball grill a lot. I don't like the extra work of making my own little spring rolls, but it's nice to be able to get other meats if you don't want the traditional ones. I also like to order the steamed rice rolls with fancy pork. This place is no frills, what you see is what you get.
author: Adelina W.

description:
New to the area after moving from inner Richmond. Had the craving for some Vietnamese and after driving on Ocean Avenue we stumbled on this place. Although on the menu they do offer several versions of roasted crab, we only got the pho.
The pho was ok, nothing much to brag about. The garlic noodles are heavy on the garlic flavor, maybe too much garlic powder? Lol! We left with our tummies full but later experienced reactions from ingesting too much msg. For those that have reactions to msg (mono sodium glutamate), beware of this place as their soup stock is heavily dosed.
author: Mark M.

description: The guys treat customers like shit. I feel unwelcome and unfriendly here !! Only female servers, 2 male cashiers are snobbish. Never want to come back!!
author: Ely T.

description:
Awful customer service. I believe the guy that answered the phone was the "manager"? Yelp says they deliver; but every time we called in for delivery in the past 6 months, we've been told "they are in the progress of hiring a delivery guy".... Sometimes, the nice ladies answered the phone would tell you the manager is the only person that can deliver but he doesn't come in till late afternoon.  They basically don't offer deliver service, please fix your yelp info and stop misleading your customers! 

The broth is water-downed, so we had to ask for extra spice & extra spicy.  But the "manager" that answered the phone was impatience and rude.  He cut us off before we could finish up our request when we called in to order pick up.  First time, we thought he just had a bad day and we let it go.  We gave it another try and called in for pick up couple weeks later, same attitude... The quality of the food there been getting worse, probably due to the lack of managerial skill and lack of customer service there.
author: L. P.

description:
I love this place. It's very inexpensive and the food is tasty. I like that they are open late. 
The service is actually really good they are not rude or pushy. And aren't in a hurry to get you out the door. 
My favorite is the chicken BBQ sandwich you must try it and also the fried rolls.(not sure that's the name of it)

The curry soup is good as well. 
The reason I give it 3 stars is because the bathroom is not the cleanest and I try to avoid going.
author: Scarlett F.

description:
I used to come to this place occasionally for their vietnamese sandwiches and dry vermicelli dishes whenever i was in the neighborhood. Back then it didn't disappoint and was fairly priced.The service was average but the food portion was decent and there was always a crowd of people eating there. 
Surprisingly, after 5 years of not coming to this place, I decided to give it a try again since I was in the neighborhood. OMG it has gone super downhill from what I remembered and I'm so sad to write this review but it must be said.

Food: I ordered the pho ga and my boyfriend ordered the bbq pork vermicelli dish with  eggrolls. We also orderd a combination pork sandwich.
First of all, the pho ga said it comes with a variety of "fresh" vegetables on the side. All it came with was a pile of old bean sprouts, some old cilantro and a lime wedge that was dried out. Where is the mint and other aromatic herbs??? When my pho ga came out the first thing that came to mind was the pho ga I had from Yummy Yummy. I was envisioning a sweet chicken broth with ample amounts of shredded chicken and chewy noodles with some thinly sliced onions floating at the top. What I got from Pho Ha Tien was SUPER watered down broth that was really oily. The shredded chicken pieces looked like scraps of unwanted chicken,not to mention it was so skimpy. The noodles were all clumped together and seemed undercooked. I was so disappointed because for $1.00 more I could have had something way better at Yummy Yummy.
My boyfriend's vermicelli dish was also disappointing. First off, the portion was small and most of the bowl consisted of vermicelli noodles. He said the few bbq pork pieces he got had no bbq flavor and tasted a bit sour. The egg rolls were super oily, so much that he had to dab it with a napkin and I didn't see much herbs & vegetables underneath the noodles.My boyfriend isn't a picky eater but he took a few bites and pushed the bowl aside. He moved on to the vietnamese sandwich, and boy, was that a disappointment as well.
I remembered raving about these sandwiches 5 years ago. Now all I can say about it is skimp, skimp, skimp. There isn't any sort of combination in that sandwich. If you go to Dinosaurs and order a combination pork sandwich, you'll get a real combination pork sandwich for $1.00 more. This place had 2 types of meat for the combination but only gave 1 slice of each meat. Even sadder was I got the ends of one of the meat so it wasn't even a real slice.They also skimped on the veggies. The only thing they didn't skimp on was the mayonnaise, which was oozing out the sandwich. 

Service: When we arrived, we were not greeted by a waiter and we chose our own seats after standing around for a bit. After we sat down, a waiter came with the menus, placed it down and walked away. Weird...but didn't phase me much since most Asian restaurants are known for shitty service. We waited a while for the waiter to take our order but he was doing other things so another waiter came to take our order. Within 5 minutes of taking our order, three waiters come out with all our food. Holy moley that was really fast! Did they pre-cook everything ahead of time? 
After we finished eating for a while I tried to flag down our original waiter to get the check. He walked swiftly by us a few times and didn't give us eye contact so I had to verbally call him out when he was a few tables away to get the check. A woman came with the check and it totaled out to be $21.15. I put down $25.15 hoping to get back change and tip them $2.00 for their mediocre food and shitty service. When the woman came back to pick up the check, she looked at it, said thank you and walked away. We sat there for 5 minutes waiting for the change to come back but it never did. I was so shocked...why in the world would I tip you 20% for that food and service? You must be crazy to think it was worth even 10% tip. We walked away and vowed to never go back to this place...horrible.
author: Suzanne L.

description:
Sometimes, all I want on this earth is a bowl of garlic noodles and Pho. And a maid. And a raise. But Pho Ha Tien can't deliver miracles.

My cousin Griselda D. hooked me onto this place years ago. We used to frequent the nail shop and the hoochie Brazilian clothing store across the street, so we decided to stop in. I've only had three dishes at this place:

- Garlic noodles ($6.45): Personally, I love when my garlic noodles are slathered in minced garlic. I LOVE garlic. They're actually comparable to Thanh Long's garlic noodles only theirs have too much butter. 
- Pho ($6.70): I get the #2 combo noodle soup (beef brisket, tendon, tripe, beef balls). I like that the beef comes rare so that it's cooked in the broth. The broth isn't too salty. Portions, as in most Pho places, are huge.
- Curry chicken ($6.50) : Too much sauce. The curry was a bit too overwhelming for my taste. 

Service: Don't expect much here -just the basics. They bring your food and then pretty much forget about you. But that's typical, so I don't expect much. I get take-out most of the time, anyhow.

Parking sucks. Don't even attempt to block the neighbor's driveway next to the restaurant, even for a second. They watch you like hawks and will have the tow truck on you before you know it.

Overall, this would definitely be classified as a hole-in-the-wall. But they're a great place for Pho, with reasonable prices. They also serve garlic crab, which is next on my list to try.
author: Mariela D.

description: This place is pretty good and clutch when you are looking to grab some pho to-go.  Portion sizes are very generous and I like how I brought my pho home and it was still smoking hot and ready to be devoured.  Nothing negative to say about this place.
author: Kristen F.

description:
Regular Vietnamese joint. 

The pho was good, tasty and nice for a cold night.

The eggrolls are deep fried...bad for you, but yummy.

The bf got the dry vermicelli noodles. He found it a bit disappointing and promised to take me to a place that serves it better. 

I will come back and try their other dishes - viet sandwiches and pork chop over rice.
author: Margaret R.

description: Im currently putting my order in and I specifically asked to put our order on hold because one of our members were missing. The waiter came with 1/4 peoples order. Customer service here is a hit and miss here. They will take your order but they do not pay attention to detail. This is very irritating to have only one person eating. In addition, we were served with a broken glass cup. Few minutes later dishes fall on the floor making a huge commotion. Where is the manager here???
author: Kawaii T.

description:
Pho Ha Tien is the only pho restaurant in this neighborhood. There's not much competition for them, which is probably why they're still around.

The pho broth didn't taste that great. There's just too much soup without the beef flavor. The beef quality's pretty low so it was kind of chewy. Noodles were good. Can't really mess that up unless you over or under cook them. The portion size is a bit on the small size.

Service was alright. Waiter came and took the order. The food came out quick and that was it.

There's better alternatives in other places. This would be a place where you go to if you're carving Pho and can't drive some place.
author: Steven B.

description: came here for a quick meal during easter evening. it was very easy to get a table, and I ordered the rare beef with tendon. Orders came out super fast. I was disappointed in my order because there was like 3 little chunks of tendon... very sad. But, it was $6 for a small, and you really can't beat that.
author: Anita H.

description:
Not too shabby . . .  Peter thinks the Bun Rieu is pretty damn good.  I thought the Pho Tai was pretty good as well.  The noodles and rare beef were fresh and the soup was flavorful without any hint of MSG.

The Cha Gio (eggrolls) were excellent!  They use the crinkly wrappers and the filling was delicious.

The Hainan Chicken Rice Plate was a disappointment.  Bland, blah, and waste of stomach space.  The broth that accompanied it was unexpectedly sweet and not salty.  Don't order!

When we're in the neighborhood, this will be our go to (or bring to because they deliver) pho place.
author: Christina L.

description: Nice guy and fun laughter amongst the staff.  Will have my wife review the bun bo hue when I get home.
author: Evan A.

description:
Parking: Mediocre meter parking or residential parking (but must compete with gym members
Payment: $15 minimum for credit??? no bueno
Food: mediocre
Service: mixed 

I came here between the time that i was on the way to my second job. I was pretty upset after parking my car to find out it there was a $15 minimum. I could be wrong and it might be a $10, but I do remember it because something outrageous. I hesitantly search for an ATM because it was just one of those piercing cold days where no other lunch would suffice besides pho. 


I ended up at west portal and got change. I returned and luckily there was no lunch rush. I order the seafood noodle soup and was immediately disappointed with the portion.  It was a tiny, though typical small portion. I must be spoiled with portion size since I've patronized other establishments with bigger portions? Though the size disappointed, the taste should have made up for it right? Wrong again. Though it was not terrible, it wasn't the best. The shrimp was overcooked and there were too few pieces of meat. 

I know seafood is pricey, but c'mon! You can purchase bags of seafood for a reasonable price and still get a decent amount of seafood. Unlikely that I'll return,even though it is close by.
author: Connie C.

description:
Horrible service. I had the pan fried crape with shrimp and pork. I waited about 30min for my food. While waiting I watched at least 10 people (no joke) who came in after me receive their food while I waited. Even the person who came with me received his food a full 15min before me. 

Not sure how long it takes to make a crape but 30min wait is unacceptable especially of they managed to serve several other people first...disappointed.
author: Remy A.

description:
Vermicelli bowl with pork and imperial rolls: solid.  The nuoc Cham was too sweet though. 

Crab and asparagus soup: will not get this again. Heavy on the cornstarch, and the crab tasted canned.  I would rather pay more for fresh crab, since they seem to offer it on the menu.

Service was so so.
author: Jing Y.

description:
Attracted to this place by the neon Pho sign, this place delivers just as  I expected.  Not to shady and not too fancy was very impressed with the Pho.  Spring rolls were tasty as well.

And the workers speak decent english.  You can pay with card, too. Another plus.  I order the pho bowl special and it comes with meatballs.  A lot of pho specials don't come with meatball, only tripe, and the other 3 different meats.  

MEATBALLS IN THE SPECIAL! YAY! YAY!

Just a word of caution: If you happen to get a window table make sure you go to the gym before.  I had a seat by the window and every time I looked out the window, I had a view of people walking to and from the 24 hour fitness; made me feel a tad bit fat as well as reminded me that I need to work out more.  But if you know you won't be distracted by gym-goers than you'll love this place just like I did.  

Will be eating here very often...very often.
author: Hazel K.

description:
Crowded on the weekend at lunch time.
Took a while to get our food - probably because we ordered something most people do not get.

Got Bun Rieu and it was really good, albeit a tad oily.
We made this dish from scratch this weekend and I have to say that Pho Ha Tien did pretty well imitating homemade food.
I would probably get this dish from here again if I had a bad craving.

Edit: Their imperial rolls are not good.  Tastes like oil.  Maybe I had a bad batch.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
Not the cleanest, nicest, cheapest place for pho. This place is cleaner than Pho 2000, Pho Huynh Hiep 3 - Kevin's Noodle House, Banhwich and Ha Noi Bistro, but that isn't saying much. Flies were hovering and the tables were wiped with a cloth that looks rarely washed. 

The staff just ain't as bad as Ha Noi Bistro. When I asked for onions, they ignored me.

The food is OK, but my large came up to be $9.00 and a small $7 without tax and tip.
author: M C.

description:
Haha, 

Decent Pho, no wait, what more do you expect?

I always come here to get their #2 large after working out at 24 hours fitness center.

They opened their restaurant at a right location.
author: Evan L.

description:
I'm between a 3-4 stars on this one. I occasionally come back and the quality is either hit or miss, very inconsistent.

Chicken pho is my top item; however, I've noticed lately they do not just use free range, but also give in some of the white chewy not-tender chicken pieces.  There is never enough chicken pieces too.

Next, the beef broth with the tender beef isnt very tender at all (comes more chewy).  The soup base is good since they don't use much msg (as I think), so it is a place worth coming back to.  

Two bowls (1 small & 1 large) comes out to about $14, very cheap eats.
author: Ju D.

description:
average decent pho. I come here mainly because it's close to my house. their pho is not the best but is isn't bad either. 

surprisingly, it gets pretty busy here on weekends even with the horrible parking in the area!
author: Kenny L.

description:
I've lived up the street from this place for the past year or so and I have to say how much I love it.

I spent the first year just getting the #5 Pho with Thai ice tea and it was perfect every time. 

I eventually got tired of eating Pho every week and now have switched to the #33 curry chicken. I must say that it is like falling in love again and that is why I am writing this review. 

Its so good you might even want to travel from a different neighborhood.
author: Mikee C.

description: Solid prices, but the "rare beef pho" was pretty bad..we couldn't eat the meat (old, tough, chewy, tasteless), and therefore paid $7 each for a noodle stew..we were both still hungry after.
author: Sonya Z.

description: I ordered a pho beef noodle soup with only beef balls. Everything was going fine and i was actually enjoying my meal then I found a piece of hair in my soup that was way too short to be my own. When I complained, the waitress said,"the hairs are part of the beef ball." Im sorry since when did beef balls come with hair??
author: M W.

description: It's really pricey Vietnamese food. The bowl size for my imperial rolls and charbroiled pork was much smaller than the one that I get from lam hoa ky on Irving. But even so I think the portion is the same just a lot harder to mix in a small bowl. They provide cilantro, bean sprouts, lemon and peppers for everyone which I thought was nice. My friend ad I came here for dinner. She ordered seafood noodles and a lychee boba. Our meal was a little under 20 bucks which is really pricey for two people especially for Vietnamese food. Or that's how I feel at least.
author: Alex T.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to get Bun Rieu!! It is so good here!!

The imperial rolls are delicious as well. 

I usually order those two things along with a nice cold glass of Thai Iced Tea. YUM!!
author: Milly H.

description:
THERE'S A PLACE ON OCEAN AVENUE....

Hehe.. I had to!
Anyways, Asian restaurants are not big on customer service... (I'll gladly sacrifice the sweet attitude for cheap food!) So as long as you don't expect that, you won't be disappointed.

Get their BO TAI CANH! Its basically carpaccio... freakin delish! Especially if you're trying not to stuff yourself with carbs after a workout at the 24 hour next door.

Otherwise, i'd recommend the pho. noodles aren't perfect, but they aren't overcooked or undercooked either. Broth is nice.

If you aren't looking for some exceptional pho, but just craving a good ol' bowl of hot noddles, this place is A-OK!
author: nichol l.

description:
After a walk by Lake Merced, my bf and I were both craving pho. I laughed a little at the reviews, majority saying that they came here post-workout. I think what drew my curiosity lay was in the reviews regarding their broth. Okay, must try this broth and see if it is good as it gets. 

Typical, pho house. Quick seating, less interaction, and all food. My boyfriend had the normal pho with steak and beef balls; while I kept to my standard steak pho. We both went large, which isn't typical, but I was really craving for something to stick to my bones. We also got our standard young coconut juice drinks, secretly trying to add to our check since there was a $15 minimum if you use card.

So why the five star rating? Well to my boyfriend and I, this was the best pho we both agreed we had ever. And he's been eating pho longer than me, plus he introduced me to this comfort food wonder. The broth and meat is what made it so delicious. The flavors are indescribable and I knew that I was definitely in good pho mode when I practically slurped up the entire bowl. Couldn't get past the broth though, my poor tummy could not contain anymore of its goodness. 

Next time I am in the Merced Manors district, I know where I am heading.
author: Jamie L.

description:
been coming here for a long time, mainly because its right next to my gym...talk about great location for a pho restaurant

anyways, the prices are reasonable, though they have been steadily increased as the years progressed. the food is a-okay, everything from noodle soup, to shrimp spring rolls, to the chicken vermicelli, chicken mango salad, and my all time favorite the raw lemon beef slices

dont expect a smile, but expect prompt seating, prompt services, fast food service, and tasty food.
author: Long C.

description:
Two words.  Garlic noodles.  Those are the only two words you need to know.  Go in to Pho Ha Tien, say it, and you are set. 

I know this is another viet pho house and in fact it has all the pho, rice plates, viet sandwiches, viet sweets, etc you want. But the gem at this place IS the garlic noodle.  I know garlic noodle is not exactly a viet dish, but this place gets it right.  The noodle is not too wet nor dry.  The garlic is not over powering but you can smell it right when the dish lands in front of you, and oh, that smell, what an aroma.  The best part of this is unlike other garlic noodle places which charges you an arm and a leg for garlic noodles, you can get an order for $7 (or a pound for roughly $25)!!!

I order a side dish of fried quail thinking I need something else to go with the noodle and boy was that a mistake.  Don't get me wrong, the quail was good presentation wise and taste (though a bit on the skinny side), but the quail was such a distraction for me to enjoy my garlic noodles.  

There was this father/daughter in the next table and I picked up bits and pieces from their conversation that their dinner here was a celebration of some sort.  The daughter was so bent on buying something special for her dad but couldn't decide what.  As I was leaving, I told them to get the garlic noodle, they won't regret it.

Next time I go, just garlic noodles, a glass of tea and nothing else.  I may even be able to down a whole pound of it!

Credit card for $15 or more.  Only street parking either meters right in front or sf style permit parking a block away.
author: Vito L.

description:
Cheap consistent good Vietnamese food. Can't even start to complain. Pho and rice plates are all good. Live in the area so I am here regularly.

I remember I got a small pho (not really that small at all) and a pate sandwich for I think $10 and change. Solid food!

I recommend!
author: Tom L.

description: I absolutely love this place. I go here quite frequently, and I come for one kind of Pho: the Sate Beef! It's a curry broth that is to die for. Great for a foggy/rainy day! I also really enjoy their shrimp spring rolls. It's not the kind of place where you go for the ambiance, so don't expect that. I recommend Pho Ha Tien to all my friends!
author: Jonathan B.

description: Rude and dumb. Sat me at a dirty table and didn't clean it, I asked for a beer and the lady had no idea what it was when it's clearly on their menu then never brought it to me (had to ask another lady for it), and now I've been sitting here waiting for my check for about 15 minutes while all the employees see my plate pushed in front of me with napkins on it and I'm playing on my phone... Meanwhile they're talking up a storm. Pho isn't even good! At all! The only flavor in the broth is salt. Not coming back.
author: Melissa C.

description: Worse customer service ever. Rude waitress. Asked for steak on the side she was being completely rude and even mocked me having my steak on the side.
author: Julie N.

description: The food is so good and at a great value. Rare beef noodle soup had generous amount of meat.
author: Jen S.

description:
The food here is good. It's pretty much your typical authentic Vietnamese pho house. 

I ordered the usual vermicelli noodles with shrimp. Great flavor. Shrimp was perfectly cleaned and cooked. I like my shrimp lightly grilled and not blackened to bitterness. This place delivered. 

Prices are reasonable. Customer service was friendly. 

If I happen to be around the area again, I will gladly return for another round.
author: Ann S.

description:
I looooove this place for take out! Cheap and fast. YUMMMMM!

I have also dined in here. You get your rushed waitress/waiter, order.. and voila~! Here comes your pho. Ive said it before and I"ll say it again, you don't go to a vietnamese place for customer service. You come for their quality food. 

I'll for sure be coming back for a visit soon.
author: Neek W.

description:
I've had better pho. 

Apparently I was in the wrong place at the wrong time when desperately craving pho. Tried this spot and could only compare it to every other pho joint I had previously visited. I longed for Kevin's Noodle House #2 while I slurped the beef broth and noodles. The Thai iced-tea was much too sweet.

Folks: make the drive elsewhere for quality, reasonably-priced Vietnamese pho and sandwiches.
author: Drea B.

description: This is an okay place. The workers move fast which is good for someone who wants to eat and go. The food and drink ordered were fairly average. Nonetheless, still an okay spot for a quick bite if you want Asian food.
author: Rj M.

description:
I had Bun Rieu here. The taste is probably average. Vietnamese iced coffee is slightly too sweet due to a generous amount of condense milk.

A great place for lunch and fast service.
author: Saran R.

description: Regular here, come here almost like at least once a week. Never ever order anything other than the pho ga with flat rice noodle. Honestly the best I ever had in the whole city. Their service is usually on point except when I come here during dinner time or near closing time then they tend to forget about us the last 2~3 times I was here during dinner. Noodles are always on point but only one time I came here they gave me some skinny rice noodles (usually those are dried) instead of the thick ones (fresh).. I'm guessing they ran out but I didn't get notice of that from my waitress.. regardless still their pho ga is always on point.
author: Lily Y.

description: Reallly, this is the only place to eat on Ocean avenue. A bit of a whole in the wall, and not big on ambience, but the food is good. The only place on Ocean avenue with consistent quality.  All of their dishes are good too. Not a date place, but a good place for a basic healthy everyday meal.
author: bobo f.

description:
My family and I love the broth here for pho! We probably come thru twice a month. Service has always been good except when very busy.
The raw beef salad is sliced well and delicious. I just wish they served some sort of greens on the menu.
And yes, hot HK milk tea!!!!
author: Betsey L.

description:
I came here on Monday since I've been having huge pho cravings for a while. I normally don't like coming here because it's usually a) very crowded and b) kind of overpriced, but, it was super convenient that day.

We had a party of six people, and it was so packed that there was a small line forming. It was also kind of hectic, trying to get to six people seated. Luckily, there was a four person table, and the table directly next to it (literally, there was no space of anything) was a table of two. Since two of our party didn't come yet, the four of us sat down, waited for the table next to us to leave, and then the other two in our party arrived. 

We already ordered before they came. I ended up getting the one I always get at any pho place: #1. It's normally #1 in pho places, and it's normally a combination of beef balls, tripe, flank steak, and some other beef-related meats with noodles. This also only comes in XL size. Someone else ordered the same thing, Bun Bo Hue, Fried Fish Cakes, and the Charbroiled Pork and Egg Roll vermicelli (#28) dish. Everything ordered was a large except for the fish cakes and the #1s.

The two #1s came first after about five minutes or so - super quick! It was HUGE. It was pretty standard, but again, it was just... well, really big. The soup was flavorful, and I added lemon and bean sprouts in it. I finished the entire thing because I barely had any breakfast, and I don't recommend trying to finish it if you truly can't.

I didn't get a chance to try the Bun Bo Hue, but apparently, it is super spicy and very filling. After the other two in our party came - they ordered a #17 and #21 - the fried fish cakes came.

I tried one. I, personally, didn't like it. The outer skin is kind of tough, and I assume it's meant to be that way, and the fish cake is way too chewy. I don't like foods with textures I consider strange (which, this one was). Also, it came with a small bit of pickled carrots, white radish, and lettuce. I didn't try any of the veggies though.

As for #28 (the vermicelli), I did try some. They didn't give a large amount of the sweet sauce with carrots in it; some of the noodles were still slightly dry. But other than that, the pork and egg rolls were cooked perfectly.

Service was great. They seated us quickly, considering how hectic it was and how hard it was to get a 6-person table. Food was served in a short amount of time, they were gracious enough to give us extra bowls without us even asking! 

Although this place has great service and good food, it is SLIGHTLY overpriced for pho. My beef ball combination noodle thing cost $8.25 for an XL size. I don't come here often, but when I do, it's mostly for convenience sake. I would prefer to go to a place where it's slightly cheaper, but almost the same size portion for the exact same meal. But that's just my two cents and my personal preference. There's honestly nothing too bad about this place.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Since I live around the Ocean area, this is my go-to place whenever I want Vietnamese food. I have been coming for years and I love everyone here! They're all really friendly and fun to joke with. Whenever I step in with my family, almost everyone remembers our usual order too :) There is a huge variety to choose from; from the standard pho to noodles to cold vermicelli to sandwiches, the selection is endless. The appetizers are delicious as well! I like how they actually remember to not add certain things to your dish when you tell them not to because I've had experience where other places completely forget and turns around and gives me attitude like it's my fault they added them.

Parking is usually hard to find because Ocean Avenue is metered parking everywhere so unless you're lucky, you'll have to walk a bit for street parking. It's all worth it though!

Oh, and they're closed every Tuesday!
author: Joye C.

description: The Sate beef, number 10 is amazing! The bbq chicken sandwich is also great
author: J.j. H.

description: Come here on occasion because it's convenient. Food is usually fairly good. Today I ordered the pho and imperial rolls to go and ate it as soon as I got home while the food was piping hot. Imperial rolls were good as usual, but the pho was pretty terrible. No flavor to the broth. I had to add sriracha, salt and pepper. It still was really lacking. It was like they forgot several ingredients and served up something unfinished. Won't be going back again.
author: s r.

description:
