Me and my friend were really hungry for a combination pork chop, fried chicken, egg roll  that most pho places have.... except here. When we asked for pork chops with FRIED chicken, the waiter was like "you can add it for a cost" 
i was thinking thats fine... but then i realized they didn't even have fried chicken on their menu. he started to walk away and I chased him down to double check that it was fried chicken and he was like "no BBQ chicken" WHAT?! haha! We specifially said FRIED chicken like 10 times. 
We ended up getting combo pho and pork chops. Both we really really on the bland side.... 

there are def better pho places that have better tasting pho and the combination rice plate I love so dearly.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Get. A. Sandwich. They have seriously the best banh mi. I used to go there at least once a week and just get a tofu sandwich to go and was never once disappointed. Their sandwiches are also significantly larger than at most vietnamese places, and for a really decent price. If I still lived in SF I would be eating one right now.
As for everything else, the service is pretty good. Most of the staff was really friendly every time I came in, I did have a few rude encounters but they were mostly from one employee so that mostly reflects on them and not the place overall. The pho is decent but not amazing. Service is usually really quick.
author: Paige L.

description:
So I'm actually not big on Pho, but my friends that I went with literally ate everything and I think they started to eat the bowl too? I don't know, maybe they were hungry.

But I ordered the curry, ummmmmmmmmm..... NO. It was more like curry, then they added a gallon of water to make it into a soup, then chopped up a chicken in the kitchen and threw it in, gaaaa-ross...No thanks
author: Edrian D.

description: I got food poisoning here on new years day,(yesterday) food was good but it all came right back out. I ordered the number 11 bun bo hue.
author: Vic C.

description:
My local haunt for pho in Ingleside, now that I live about 3 blocks from here.

It is by far the best pho I've had in the City - rare beef and meatball is the greatest. Yes, it seems a little dingy at times, and I've never used the bathroom (I'm up the street and prefer my own digs) -- but what makes this place worthy of 4 stars (unlike the 3 you see in the other reviews) is that the wait staff treats me like a regular, which I've now become. They know me, they know my girlfriend, they know our usual and they always treat us well.

For that, they get the 4th star.
author: Vee B.

description:
I've seen this place busy a few times and decided to try it, after reviewing their menu.  I love good Vietnamese Pho restaurants and have been to a few of them in many different cities.

Pho Ha Tien is one of the worst ones I've been to!  Their appearance is dirty and filthy - it almost looks that the last time they washed their windows was during the "dot com boom".

Their Pho soup was sub par, borderline bad.  Broth not reach enough, noodles and meat plane and distasteful; amount of meat was too little compared to other places in San Francisco.

I had to ask 3 times for water before getting it and that was the only interaction with the server during our lunch.  Not that in many other Pho places they come over and ask us how we're doing, but it does not hurt to expect that.

So, overall, I'm disappointed with his place and would not recommend to others.
author: P F.

description: The Pho is fair--the broth is fine, but the protein portions are very small (pork spareribs was less than 2 oz). I'd have given them another star if the service was warm or friendly. It isn't. It's also not the most spic and span kitchen--just sayin. I'd say that it's best quality is that it's cheap.
author: David C.

description: Here again for the pho and curry chicken rice.  The soup base is pretty good.  Their sprouts and greens are pretty fresh which is a good sign.  I like their sandwich.  Ahhh since there's no better pho for miles around, I guess this is what we have for this neighborhood.  Forget about the ones on Geneva or Mission st.  Fast, consistent food,  have been here for awhile not a drive by.
author: Mar H.

description: I'm so thrilled to find excellent Pho so near my neighborhood.  This place is a new favorite.
author: Kali C.

description:
Dirty as hell had 4-6 flies flying around my table, gum under the seat and chair

didnt accept credit had me walk to find an atm which was 3 blocks away took my cellphone as collateral

portion of the meal was okay i had the combination bee pho

service was awful , experience was bad, overall a nightmare

they should pay their costumer to eat here

FLIES  EAT SH!T, THEY FLY AROUND YOU MAKES YOU SH!T

GET RID OF FLIES
author: Dylan C.

description: I've been here 3 times. 3 freakin' times and was never satisfied with their food. I forgot how it was like the first time, but it seems pretty decent and that was probably a year ago. The second time I came back, I brought two friends with me. We were hungry after a long day of work. I still remembered that I ordered the bun bo hue. That was a really large order but the meat isn't what i expected. It tasted like frozen meat, i swear. My friends were somewhat satisfied with their dishes, so i guess it was just myself. To be honest, its getting worst and worst everytime. The third time I came... I'm speechless. After we finished the pho we saw some clouded thing in the soup. Might want to consider some other place for pho before this one.
author: Kris C.

description:
This is the kind of pho place you go to if you are in the area - it's solid but nothing too amazing. Came here with a friend who used to frequent Pho Ha Tien and was in the mood for something easy and quick before my flight out of SFO. I had the rare beef and chicken pho, he had the rare beef and we asked for the shredded pork spring rolls to start. 

The broth here is a little thicker and saltier than I prefer, but it definitely is delicious - I feel like this is the kind of place they just throw a brick of noodles into their broth and serve it because it definitely comes to you in a big chunk that is difficult to separate. Nothing special here. We ordered the spring rolls to start but after we'd already done some decent work on our pho we had to ask somebody where the heck our appetizer was. If the spring rolls had come out and were delicious it would have been different. But the shredded pork spring rolls were a little dry: I know there's sauce, but some inherent moisture might be nice. 

This pho spot is A-OK.
author: Tanya D.

description: I came to Pho Ha Tien today to satisfy a pho craving. Seeing as this was the (relatively) best rated place in the area, I decided to try it - fully prepared for the fact that it has 3.5 stars. Well, I can now say that it is definitely not underrated. When you walk in, there's a faint urine-like smell...not super appetizing to say the least. I thought maybe the further in I got, the less it would smell but I think I just kind of acclimated to it.. Anyway, I got the #3, large, the pho tai, I believe, just beef and noodles. It did come out really quickly, as in literally 5 seconds after I ordered which was a little weird. There was something bizarre, maybe missing, about each ingredient. The noodles had a weird texture, the soup was extremely bland and the beef tasted a little stale. I was surprised by the amount of, or lack-of noodles as well. Sufficed to say, I do not think I will be visiting this establishment again. I think I will have to venture to other areas of the city to *hopefully* get some quality pho.
author: Irene K.

description:
I came back recently after a 3 year hiatus. They increased their prices and it cost me $10 for a BBQ pork sandwich and an iced-coffee. Seriously?! I don't even know how they justified the prices when I asked. They just gave a half-assed breakdown on the prices. I could get a pretty nice lunch anywhere else for $10. 

Whatever. Loyal customer, no more.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Place gets very busy during the afternoon. I ordered the small Beef Meatball pho since I wanted something cheap for lunch. My friend got some sort of curry pho? For $6.50, I guess it's an ok price for the portion. The portion wasn't extremely small but I would still get the large if you're hungry. There's also a selection of Vietnamese sandwiches on the menu for $4 as well.
author: Tony C.

description:
Solid but a tad on the expensive side. Got the extra large chicken pho ($7.70) and lots of noodles but not much meat. Nothing spectacular about the pho, but solid. The imperial rolls ($5.20 were good. The spring rolls (the ones wrapped in rice paper) were good but only 2 for $5.20? Also got the charbroiled chicken kabobs ($10.70) that come with rice paper, lettuce and cucumbers to make wraps with. Tasty and messy. Also grabbed two drinks. Bill was $45 with tip. 

Yes if I just wanted cheap then  I coulda grabbed two bowls of pho but to me pho should be in the $5 to $6 range and PHT charges the $6-$7 range. Ditto with the springs rolls/imperial rolls and kabobs. Every item to me is just $1-$2 more than your usually Pho place.
author: Dom L.

description:
Live in the neighborhood so when they opened (8 years ago?) I was so grateful that I can have a bowl a pho without trekking too far.  Used to eat here once a week but now once a month.  What I enjoy:  Cold Shrimp Roll, Vegetarian Pho, BBQ Chicken Rice Plate with Fry Egg, Bun- Dry Vermicelli Charbroiled Shrimp with Imperial Roll and hands down just love the Chicken Kabob.  Round, clear skin dipped into the hot water bowl and you fill it with, a crisp lettuce, cold noodles, chicken, basil and dipped in the fish sauce absolutely delicious.  

Place has adequate seating for twos/fours and larger parties with your average Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant atmosphere.  Service is prompt but it seems the places has gotten a bit worn and greasy around the tables.  Service is somewhat friendly especially the guy with the glasses and blue shirt but the guy at the cash register seems like he's always kinda brutish, unfriendly, never smiles and never says thank you.

I think if they bump up their service and act more friendly they can increase their business.  The place seems busy whenever I go in so people probably accept it as just how these Asian places operate.  The female servers don't speak much English but they are very prompt and quick with any order you request.

Overall,  I like the place and enjoy the food.  My kids love the BBQ Chicken Vietnamese Sandwiches.  Just leave out the hot peppers for them.
author: Doug I.

description:
Ordered delivery here again and it was the best out the 2 previous experiences.

This place is really hit or miss.

 #1 Pho is good but was advertised as XL; it looked more like regular.
It needed to be heated up on the stove because the noodles were shaped like the box.

#26 and 28 were approved by house mates.

Their combo sandwich was average.

All in all, a solid 3.0 - 3.5.

(Pho is the greatest food when you are under the weather)
author: Vance T.

description: My go to pho place at the moment.  Imperial rolls are a must try, they're pretty good.  Their pho is good too, one of the better ones I've had in the city.  Boba is a hit or miss.  Vietnamese sandwiches are pretty good too.  I just wished they had a half and half combo...half serving of pho and half serving of sandwich because I always end up getting both and finishing neither.
author: Maysee V.

description: Order the number one. It was pretty big and it actually tasted pretty good. I am a regular here and I have noticed the price has increased a lot ever since it first opened but overall the best pho on Ocean.
author: Peter C.

description: #10.  Every time.  Something like $6 for a small and $8 for a large.  Thinly sliced rare beef, chopped peanuts, coconut milk, beef broth, rice noodles, topped at the table with bean sprouts, fresh basil and chile paste, and a dollop of hoisin on every bite.  My GI tract is less enthusiastic, but it is subordinate to my mouth in such matters.
author: Danny N.

description: I love this place!!! Everytime i come here their hospitality is through the roof. Every person Ive encountered here has been polite(2 stars) Their Pho is some of the best ive had so far (ive only been to 3 places they takd the cake!!!) Their portions are large, very filling... i always end up taking some home... their Thai Tea is good too... i love the fact that it comes already mixed and sweetened!!! To top it all off... their affordable!!! GO HERE, IT SO WORTH IT!!!
author: Racquell C.

description:
Vietnamese iced coffee is delicious!!
The pho is always something to look forward to. 
Great place overall.
author: Malkov D.

description: So the food was pretty tasty, but the service leaves a little to be desired. Price is cheap of course, and who doesn't love a big bowl of PHO!!! Tasty stuff though the chicken was a bit tought, all in all, I would totally go again. :-)
author: Sam K.

description: I am a vegetarian and this place rocks in that context.  They have an excellent tofu Vietnamese sandwich.  Also, their fresh vegetarian spring rolls were as good if not better than the sandwich.  The vegetarian soup was also awesome.  The guy who helped me was very nice and did not seem irritated at all that I don't eat meat.  I am cool with non-native English speakers, but never the less I should add that his English was perfect if that is an issue for you.  The price was reasonable, the service was good (got it to go), and most importantly it tasted excellent.  I want to add that they were really busy when I dropped in and they still made the food in a reasonable amount of time, given it is really fresh.  Go here.  You'll love it.
author: Lancelot C.

description: Excellent phô tai and bun thit nuong! Extra points for my being the only whitey I could see at first glance.
author: Sharman G.

description:
I've gone here a few times with my husband, usually after 2-3  hour workouts on Saturdays from 24hour next door.  I know, I know, but we worked up quite an appetite back then...

Before my lunchtime workout today, I knew I'd be hungry, and was in the mood for something "Asian", so I stopped in, placed and paid my order for chicken salad and garlic noodles before my workout, and told them I'd pick it up by 1:45p.  Star for taking the order in a timely fashion, and star for the order being hot and ready at the pick up time.

I'm enjoying it right now as I'm typing this.  The garlic noodles are GARLICKY, no joke (star).  It was the first thing I smelled when they gave me my order.  I put it in my trunk, and when I parked the car to head back up to my office, the trunk was crazy smelling like garlic.  Went to the kitchen, plated up a little of each order, and am I surprised.  The texture of the noodles are perfect.  No need to save all your money for Thanh Long or Crustaceans.  This is the real deal, and for $6.95, hey, why not?  (It's actually not a hard dish to make at all, I've made it myself, but that's besides the point...)   The chicken salad is actually a papaya salad with chicken breast served on top.  And both containers have LOTS!  (4th star!)  Enough for me to bring home to the fam bam tonight for dinner.  (I MEAN LOTS).

So, go go go to this place, even just for these 2 items...
author: Jennifer V.

description: Really solid neighborhood Vietnamese restaurant. Everything is good. It's family friendly. Good prices. Minor ding for old decor.
author: Michael S.

description: The #99 BBQ pork sandwich is freaking awesome!!!!!! Must try and really cheap!!!!
author: Bertamus R.

description: Ehhh maybe because I used to live in San Jose and I was spoiled with really good pho, I don't think their pho is that good. Their  soup was okay but potions are really small, especially with the meats. I remembered I had only 4 pieces of meat in my bowl boohoo!
author: Lubin T.

description:
I hate to write bad reviews, but...

I came here a couple months ago for the pho and my soup tasted like soap. I didn't come back for a while after that experience, but decided to give it another shot today. I'm sorry to report I had the same experience today. I hate to say it, but I'm pretty sure they're not rinsing their bowls thoroughly while washing them.

I hear the sandwiches are really good, and are wrapped in paper so they don't have contact with doses.
author: Emma A.

description: I come here for the BBQ Sandwich. It has jalepeños in it.. to whom it may concern. My friend always orders the #7 Large (whatever that is.. some kind of soup). I order the Iced coffee in a french press and pour it with a glass of ice and condensed milk. There are many selections of appetizers and soups as well. Pho Ha Tien is LEGIT.
author: Asher B.

description: I really love this place. The people are really friendly, the service is fast and the food is fresh and delicious! It's always packed--good sign--but, as others have observed, they're never in a hurry to usher you out. I'm a nanny for a little boy with autism; he's often messy and acts strangely. Sometimes restaurant owners are put-off by him. The people who work here know him and like him and we always feel welcomed, which I really appreciate. I come here whenever I can. Also, I love the curry noodles!
author: Gabriella V.

description: It's alright.  I prefer to take out rather than eat-in.  They have a good vegetarian pho which I don't usually find.  It's a value play and there really isn't much competition so that's as good as it gets.
author: Yohdaddy M.

description:
Inexpensive, delicious, and diverse selection of pho.  They also make a good BBQ chicken vietnamese sandwich and imperial rolls.  They serve the best bubble tea drinks offered along Ocean Ave.  

Restaurant always appears to be crowded especially around lunch time.
author: Joe J.

description:
Second time ordering delivery and it appeased our appetite for this rainy and wet Saturday afternoon. 

Pho was average-
the noodles tumbled out of the box only to be shaped exactly like the bottom half of the box.

Broth was good- 

meats were ok.


Sandwiched were tasty/ crispy.
author: vin t.

description: Fresh, authentic Vietnamese food here that is inexpensively priced, as Vietnamese food should be.  The best I've had in San Francisco, after almost 15 years in the city, and definitely one of the best outside of Vietnam, where I lived for a while (in Saigon, Hanoi, and visited everywhere in between) and the restaurant whose food is most reminiscent of my Vietnamese mother's cooking. I couldn't pay a restaurant a higher compliment.
author: Kim Lan G.

description:
This place is great. I can always come here for a cheap lunch. Plus, I love pho. 

I highly recommend this place if you are going to work out at 24 hours fitness
author: Michael C.

description: I have only been here once and it was for their Vietnamese soft rice rolls.  It's hard to find a Vietnamese restaurant that has rice rolls--let alone good tasting ones. A lot of rice rolls are hard if they are not made fresh and tastes gross. The rice rolls here are surprisingly good. The filling inside the rice rolls are minced pork and black mushroom. It did take some time for it to come out but I think it's because they have to make it fresh. I didn't mind the wait. It comes in 6 rolls and I ate every one of them. I can't speak for the other items on their menu but I will definitely come back just for their rice rolls.
author: Anh W.

description:
Pho Ha Tien and I have a LOVE/HATE relationship. 

A couple years back I lived so close to Pho Ha Tien that I could throw a rock at it from my front door. I LOVED that it was so close, and while it's not the best bowl of pho in the world, it did the job.

A couple years back I also used to go to 24 hr. fitness with regularity (ahhh the good ol days! I'm busier now and don't make it in as much as I would like, don't judge me!). I always HATED walking out of the gym after sweating my ass off lifting weights and playing basket ball and smelling pho in the air. It's like going out to eat dinner only to be seated right by the bathroom.  Or it's like your fart is unexplainably tolerable for you but not for the other guy standing next to you! I know... I should stop now, you get the point.

There's better pho out there and service is marginal, but I still make it in every now and then when I'm in the area and too lazy to go further. You can't be too mad at a middle-of-the-pack bowl of pho... except when you're breathing it in after a workout!
author: Brian L.

description:
This place is nasty. Everything tasted like dishwasher soap, maybe they dont believe in rinsing ...

My brother and I decided to come get some Pho today after our dentist appointment (totally broke the no eating after 30 minutes rule). We both got the number 1 XL for 8 dollars. The noodles were okay but the soup tasted a little funny. It was too sweet and it smelled weird. Turns out the smell was dishwasher. Took a sip of their Lipton tea and the same weird smell/taste was found there. 

I dont know why they have so many customers, maybe its because its the only PHO place in the are but I am not going to pay $20 dollars for two for soap flavored pho. Maybe it was a bad day but I doubt it.
author: Dorian T.

description: Yesterday I was at my friends house around the corner from Ocean Ave and I was craving some "authentic" pho for a reasonable price. I typed in Pho in the yelp search box and this place popped up first so I thought I would give it a try. When my friend and I walked in they greeted us with smiles. I ordered the small Pho Ga(chicken pho) and my friend ordered  the small steak/tendon beef broth pho with a side order of fried shrimp. It was just as I imagined ! Delicious !! The small had a satisfying amount of noodles, and the fried shrimp were not over cooked and dry. I will definitely eat here again. I gave them a 4 stars and not 5  due to lack of service. They never came back to our table after we got our food nor brought our check to our table. After waiting patiently at my table when my friend I finished our meal I finally just got up and went to go pay. Still, that doesn't take away from the quality of the food. I will definitely be back soon :-)
author: Jasmine R.

description: Consistently good basic Vietnamese, well worth the visit. In all the years, only one less than satisfactory meal and that was many years ago. Love the place. The decor is a little cheesy but the food more than makes up for it.
author: Jack H.

description:
I only tried this place because I was two doors down, otherwise, I'd have never stop by with shabby front awning.

They have a large selection of banh mi (sandwiches); larger than they do of pho. So my boyfriend and I ordered a small bowl of pho and a sandwich to share. The sandwich was DELICIOUS and had a lot of filling inside, but the bread did flake a lot of crumbs. The pho was mediocre, nothing special. I tried their housemade soy milk (the server pushed towards me ordering the housemade soy milk over the canned soy milk that I had wanted), which was actually really good. Most places that I've tried housemade soy milk tastes aged, but this one, undoubtedly was fresh and had the right amount of sweetness. We also tried the ca phe sua da, which was far too overloaded with condensed milk and the coffee wasn't dark enough.

Pros: Great sandwiches, fresh soy milk
Cons: Closes early, pho is not special, quite dirty.
author: Jenn D.

description: The Pho was flavorless and the shrimp spring rolls were terrible. The Vietnamese sandwich was solid and the garlic noodles were great. The prices are good. If you're in the area the sandwich and the garlic noodles are worth it. But skip the Pho. Three stars just for the sandwiches and the garlic noodles.
author: Angela C.

description:
Tasty potsticker
+ Flavorful combo beef noodle soup 
+ Savory charbroiled chicken kabob
-----------------------------------------------
= Happy Belly :)
author: Sarath S.

description:
Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.
author: Ron H.

description:
Good pho. Nothing extraordinary, but hey, pho is pho. It's hard to screw up. The place is comfy and casual, and this one waiter just loves to joke around with my girlfriends and I. It helps to add some personality to the otherwise typical divey Vietnamese joint.

The banh mi here is actually better than those I've had from other places. They use some kinda saucy mayo that adds a lil sumpm sumpm. And at 3 bucks, how can you go wrong?

Great place to chill and grab some comfort noodles, especially on rainy days like tonight.
author: Kate V.

description:
One of my bf's favorite pho place.  Their rare beef appetizer is very good with just the right amount of sauce.  

We usually get the #2 bowl, pretty much the same as other Pho places, but their broth is just super delicious, very sweet broth that I don't want to add anything to contaminate it.  I tried the pig feet with shrimp noodle soup today, and the noodles are different from other Pho bowl, they are round, fat, and semi-clear rice noodle.  They are so fun to chew haha!  but the pig feet, not too excited, and they only give you 2 shrimps....  BUT the broth is still satisfying with fun noodle to chew.
author: Gigi T.

description: The banh mi here is mediocre and bordering on gross. It's effectively made on a Safeway roll instead of a baguette. Won't be back.
author: L M.

description:
This place is horrible!!  Their basil leaves were unfresh to begin with...then it took them 25 minutes for our pho to get to the table!  There were two tables that came after us that got their food first!!  I had the pho tai with beef on the side and they gave me only a few pieces of beef...literally!!  My friend got pho with beef and beef balls...the order came with NO beef balls at all...when we asked them where the beef balls were...they looked at my friend like he ate it!!  WOW!!  This is the second time I tried it giving them a second chance...nope...NO THANKS!!  I really do not understand why this place is packed all the time too...maybe cuz there isn't really any other pho place around??

Yes...one star...horrible service, nasty food, dirty place, and just plain never coming back again....
author: Patrick C.

description: Pretty decent place to get a bowl of pho when in need and near by.. I sometimes feel weird about ordering lots of food here being that it's next door to my gym lol.. I believe they are close on Monday? Service was ok took a while to get something to drink had to ask twice but over a decent experience at this place
author: Jared V.

description:
Not every Vietnamese place in SF serve the rare beef with lemon juice, peanuts, onions and cilantro.  That is one of my all time favorite appetizers and I seem to always crave it, but its hard to find.  I only know a handful of Vietnamese restaurants that actually serve it.

I decided to give this place a try while I was in the area.

Very dissappointing!! The meat wasn't sliced thin enough, the sauce wasn't sweet enough, the peanuts weren't crumbled enough.

Did not do it for me=[
author: Sarah F.

description: First time to this restaurant. Had a great lunch! The chicken Pho was delicious with a good amount of veggies provided. The veggie spring rolls had a nice variety of vegetables and were not filled with tons of noodles (a personal pet-peeve). We tried a few new dishes (like #60) and were pleasantly surprised. The kitchen was quick at getting the Pho prepared, but our appetizer came out quite a bit later.  Not much of an ambiance, but the service was good.
author: Leanne G.

description:
!!!TOOTHPICK IN PHO!!! This is the only pho restaurant in the area so my fiance and I stop here for lunch almost every other week during our break from work. Today we came during noon and it was packed. We were seated at the round table with three other men who just kept staring. One of the ladies came to take our order and I asked her if we can get another table that just opened up. She said people are waiting that just came in, and I told her that we have been waiting and all she said was "SO ARE YOU READY TO ORDER OR WHAT?". RUDE! So she took our orders and I saw that some people just got up at another table and I asked the bald guy if we could sit there and he said yes. After that the waitress gave the table up to people who just came in. The bald guy realized that and luckily someone else got up at another table and he said that we could sit there. Sorry, but I don't feel comfortable sitting with three other people who stare at you while you are trying to eat. Anyways, after that we ordered our usual seafood pho, which I think is really good, and a vietnamese sandwich that we always get because it goes good with the soup. We asked for waters and the waitress forgot until we asked the bald guy, and I guess he told her to go and get it for us. SO HERE IT GOES, HALFWAY THROUGH MY FIANCE'S BOWL SHE FOUND A TOOTHPICK IN THE NOODLES!!! I DON'T EVEN WANT TO THINK OF WHERE IT CAME FROM, BUT THAT IS NASTY AND COULD HAVE INJURED HER IF SHE ATE IT. WE DIDN'T EVEN BOTHER TO SAY ANYTHING WE JUST PAID AND LEFT BEFORE THINGS WOULD GET OUT OF HAND BECAUSE IF WE TOLD THEM WHO KNOWS WHAT KIND OF BS THEY WOULD SAY BACK. THIS WAS OUR FAVORITE PLACE FOR PHO BUT NOW WE DON'T KNOW IF WE WILL EVER RETURN BACK.
BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU EAT HERE BECAUSE I HOPE THIS NEVER HAPPENS TO ANYONE.
author: Eddie S.

description: Been coming to this place for a long time, and I have to say I've never been disappointed. The food doesn't make me jump up and sing hallelujah nor stop me from coming back. It's what I expected fir this restaurant. Above average.
author: Troy V.

description: This restaurant is more chiness style than Vietnamese restaurant. The honest Vietnamese restaurant never charge a small bowl of soup with rice plate order. Never and never.. That is different between Vietnamese restaurant and others. Only business name is 100% Vietnamese.
author: Peterson L.

description: That "special" flavor the other yelpers kept referring to in their reviews...it's star of anise, found commonly in a lot of Chinese soups.  The pho was alright.  I just, I don't know, I rather have that flavor broth in a Chinese soup?  They got my order wrong and didnt' give me any tendon.  They realized they got my order wrong and did nothing to correct it.  The reason why I gave 2 stars and not 3 is that the noodles were all clumped together at the bottom and just were not as tasty as other places.
author: Aly A.

description:
They have a great menu, of curries, pho and rice and noodle dishes.

This is one place I love going to for Pho...hearty portions, great flavor, and just inexpensive.  They also have the vietnamese sandwiches which are good too!

Hey the service is the usual stuff--very mediocre.  They grunt, direct you to a table, and you get the water.  And at some point they take your order.  But the food comes pretty quickly...
author: Fannie S.

description:
I'd never had Vietnamese food until I moved into this neighborhood.  This place is literally down the block from me, and it's super cheap, so I come here all the time.  I'm still very tame when it comes to ordering, but I usually go with their bbq pork sandwich or a simple bowl of chicken and beef pho.  The garlic noodles here are pretty good too.

I don't have much to compare it to, but the food is always consistently good and the prices are cheap, so I keep coming back.
author: Tamara N.

description: If I lived near Ocean Ave, I'd eat there every other night. The seafood vermicelli or combination soup is a taste sensation; even better on a cold, foggy day. The rice rolls can't be passed up. The food is estraordinarily good value.The 5 *s is entirely for the food.
author: Marion H.

description:
I don't know if I just ordered wrong or what, but this is the worst Vietnamese food I've ever had. I guess I should've expected that when the place itself smelled like piss.

We ordered the spring rolls, the chicken skewers, and BBQ chicken banh mi (this one to go). The spring rolls were bearable, but I never knew chicken could taste so nasty. Maybe it was an off day?

The only reason why I'm not giving this one star is because the lady who served us was really nice.
author: Jess S.

description: My car was being repaired around the area. So I wanted to grab a bite to eat for lunch. So I felt like some Pho noodles. So I check them out on yelp and they got pretty good reviews. So I figure since I was around the area I'll give them a try. I sat down next to the door and was handed a menu. That's the only thing that was fast. It took me about 30 seconds cause I already knew what I wanted to eat. I noticed that they sat three other tables after I sat down. They took their order and got their food even before I even ordered mine's.  Pho is (in my opinion) all about the soup. If it is bland or is the soup rich with flavors.  In this case it was bland....nothing to get excited bout. And if you add on the terrible service then this would equal to about a star. I know going to any Asian restaurant the service is bad. But when three other table sit down before you order and get their food before you can even order then I think that that place is bad hence the one star. I will not go back ever!!!
author: Jon W.

description: We had lunch here on a Saturday in April, walking from San Francisco State University.  Our group was reasonably large (~ 8 of us), but we were seated and served promptly.  We ordered a variety of soups and sandwiches, ate a lot and shared around.  We certainly had no complaints with our experience.  In fact, things were better than that: there were lots of comments to the effect that the food was "yummy" and "tasty".
author: Kenneth R.

description: Not impressed. Used to go there years ago and I don't remember food being so mediocre. I ordered small #2 which was combination of beef and beef balls pho. There were 3 slices of beef and 2 balls. What? It was all noodle! I've been to other vietnamese restaurants in the area and they are generous with the meat portions. The 2 stars go for the broth which was tasty. I am still sticking to Ben Tre in SSF. Way much better service and tastier food!
author: Love SF A.

description:
With pho in the name, you have to order pho. It seems like common sense, but I've made that mistake too many times. My mother loves restaurant pho, so we keep coming back here, but every time just feels like a disappointment. 

To be fair, I'm comparing restaurant food to homemade, and it's hard to get the two to match. The pho is ok. It's fine. There's a lot of it for not a bad price. I was feeling adventurous one night and ordered the duck and bamboo noodle soup because I like duck and I like bamboo. The broth was lackluster and the cuts of meat were irritating: gizzard, neck, and the bony part of the wing. The bamboo was the old and bland. 

My mom enjoyed her pho as always though, and it's the only Vietnamese joint in the area.
author: Kim D.

description: I hate people who are not honest.   8 of us were eating there tonight.   They secretly added 15% service fee to our bill.   And they didn't cross out the tip column in the credit card check.  This kind of act seems to us so treacherous.
author: Perry L.

description:
Not the best in SF, but it was alright.

Came here with my family today. Getting pho was planned, but coming here wasn't. I ordered the #3, large b/c they didn't have medium. I got full about halfway through, but luckily my brother was still hungry after he finished his large order also, so nothing was wasted :)

The beef slices were pretty tender. Flavor was decent, a little on the bland side. For the price, it was alright.
author: Florence S.

description:
I am a regular at this restaurant. Being a City College student this is one of my favorite after class lunch spots. I decided to review this place finally after trying another Pho restaurant, and thought i owe this a review.

My favorite dish to have at any Vietnamese restaurant is the Sate Beef Pho and this place has the best I've ever eaten. It is so flavorful and a huge helping of noodles, YUM. The sandwiches are also very well liked by me and the other patrons i have been with. The spring rolls and imperial rolls are also very good.

This place also has very good prices and the service is not the best all the time, but you cant have it all.
author: Troy S.

description: Good pho. But very horrible service.  Restaurant was only half full with patrons. Waited 15 minutes for the waitress to fake our order. The pho came quick.  I had to follow up and ask about my dry vermicelli order. She said they were barbecuing the beef.  Waited for another 15 minutes for the rest of the food to arrive.  Funny thing when the food arrived, it was COLD.  Not even warm!!!!  Well,  I guess they do everything in 15 minutes increments, cuz the bill came without us asking for it.  What's up for the 2 people standing around in back of the counter, not helping????  Horrible!
author: Sandy K.

description:
Went there mainly to get garlic noodles, which were alright. 

Good Service. Free hot tea.

Not really quality vietnamese food, although it seemed to be pretty crowded when I was there. 

minimal parking.
author: Shaina T.

description:
decent place, friend's house was in the area and we decided to grab a bite before we headed over.

we ordered pho, banh mi, and egg rolls.

the pho was okay, noodles were kinda hard still, but not bad. 
the sandwich was good, add sirarcha and hoisin sauce...makes any sandwich taste good.
egg rolls were crispy, but lacking something.

service was eh, much closer pho places near my house. but this place is decent. looks kinda dirty too...parking fairly easy
author: Christine M.

description: Located on a nice part of Ocean Ave of SF, this Pho place has friendly servers and a nice atmosphere. The pho broth was flavorful and the bowl was delivered steaming hot. They give you a lot of vegetables to add into the broth if you want. Overall a pretty good spot in a nice area.
author: Sven S.

description:
I've only tried their curry pho... and thought it was okay. The curry flavor was too overpowering - the dish would have been better with some coconut milk in the broth to balance out the strong curry flavor. I already have another restaurant I get coconut curry pho from but wanted to try Pho Ha Tien's version of curry pho (which I hoped had coconut milk in it...). And now I know that their version is not for me. Better luck next time with another of their pho bowls? 

+ Their spring rolls and imperial rolls are good!
And their sandwiches look delicious - will come back next time to try those out.
author: Christine C.

description:
This place is hit or miss, but it is definitely cheap. Good food, large portions, but it sometimes very busy. 

The fresh squeezed orange juice is a bit pricey though.
author: Wayne M.

description: Second time here, the portions are great for most people but i was still hungry after eating the XL AND drinking all the soup. It was pho and it gets busy!
author: Frederick A.

description:
Yes it's our neighborhood pho joint and I wish it were awesome, but it's nothing spectacular.  It gets the job done, though if you want a cheap, hot bowl of noodle soup.

Today I ordered a bowl of chicken pho.  There was very little chicken and it was mostly skin.  But frankly I'm a huge fan of MSG and it satisfied my craving.  Plus I have a cold so pho + sriracha sauce was a no-brainer.

The banh mi  sandwiches are pretty tasty.
author: Amy A.

description:
This place is pretty good for some quick Vietnamese food cravings. Typical menu of pho, vermicelli and rice plates with reasonable prices. 

I've been here several times and the food service is fairly fast and the restaurant can accommodate a nice group of 10 on their big tables. The quality of the food is always consistent as well...although I find their portions have gotten smaller these days...

Three stars because I've had better vietnamese food and the overall selection of dishes and drinks wasn't too spectacular, but for the price you're paying it's reasonable.
author: Jen L.

description: Another example of a simple, no nonsense neighborhood joint serving pho and other plain ol' Chinese and Viet dishes. Cheap, hot and big bowls of pho. I've had a few different ones now, and they all have in common a clean, non-oily broth with just enough savory to be filling and not overal salty. I wish they would serve a bit more bean sprouts and cilantro with the soup. It's a plain jane decor, out on busy Ocean Avenue. Classic place for a paramedic pull over.
author: Art H.

description:
**3 STARS** relative to:
Casual Vietnamese; no-frills restaurant

I come here for three things: bun bo hue, pho, and banh cuon. They do each of these items well enough that I keep coming back. The rest of their food is not bad, but I wouldn't commend it. It has a well-rounded menu that offers some of everything, but I usually only order between the three I previously mentioned.

**Favorites**  Bun bo hue.  Banh cuon.

**Recommend?**  I would recommend this place for their beef noodle soups, namely the pho and the bun bo hue. Their broth is rich in beefy flavor. The bun bo hue is spicily divine. It's a good place to come for quick Vietnamese food that offers a variety of items for everyone. Don't expect ambiance.

Their bun bo hue is a little different from the typical bun bo hue at most places, which makes it stand out quite nicely. The flavor of their broth is unique and keeps me coming back. It's worth trying.

I am not a fan of their meats on rice plates or cold noodle bowls, nor am I a fan of their eggrolls. The eggrolls are too tiny for me. The cuts of meat that I have received on my rice plates and noodles bowls weren't good cuts, and they seem to be pan-fried instead of grilled, which makes it lack that delicious smoky flavor.

The five spice chicken on rice might be one of the exceptions. It's actually quite good.
author: Lovina C.

description:
Just an OK Pho. For me, the bun here is better.
Nothing really special, just very convenient.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Lately, I have discovered that my favorite food is Vietnamese food.

I got the medium beef combo Pho ($5.20) and the pork combo Bahn Mi ($3.50).

It was a staggering amount of food, and I think I ate it in about...7 minutes.

Wish I could have Pho/Bahn Mi for every meal.
author: James H.

description:
My initial guess is that this place really deserves only three stars, but considering how often I actually eat here I can't justify an "A-OK" three star rating.  I mean, I have to really enjoy it or I wouldn't keep coming back, right?

Overall, food is consitently good.  I particularly like the rare beef pho and the chicken curry soup.  Garlic noodle are good too, but I'm sure there's some better in the city somewhere.   Service, though not very attentive, is quick and efficient.  Price is reasonable.  Location for us is fabulous as we have a general lack of quality restaurants in the "oceanview" neighborhood.  Parking is always easy.  One reviewer noted that he had never used the restroom here and I ditto that remark.  It's way too close to home for me to try.

We come here when we are too lazy to cook and too cheap to be really "waited" upon.  Which is happening more and more lately :-)
author: Michelle M.

description:
jeeeeeeeez, didnt realize how often i ate out this week.  I really like this place.  PPQ is overrated. lol.  Their #1, you know, the infamous #1 has REALLY really sweet beef broth. Yummmm, idk how the hon does it, but he can always finish the XL.  
Tip: get the beef on the side, so you can cook it yourself in the soup.  Its just like hot potting. what a deal!  

I had the combo sandwich here, yum yum yum, the bread was toasted to perfection, and their pate is NOT cat food, like other places.  Together, our dinner came to $12.50 cool huh?
author: kim w.

description:
Great food, but the place seemed like all the employees were just all over the place. I wish I can just base this review on the food, but that would just be a little biased because food is alway more enjoyable if the service that comes along with it, is enjoyable as well. So three stars it is. They were quick to seat us, but it took a while before they came and checked if we were ready to order.
My boyfriend and I ordered the charbroiled pork over rice, along with a Thai Tea and a side Spring Rolls to share. The food was really great. I had a bite of my girl friend's sandwich and it was super delicious. The only thing I'd have to say was a little miss was the Thai Tea. It was SUPER sweet, like, I NEED water with this sweet, lol. I only drank 1/4 of it and my boyfriend had a taste, but didn't even bother finishing it because of how sweet it was. Maybe it was just a miss for that day, but other than that, I think this place is work a second visit.
Btw, I think it's kinda funny how it's right next to 24 Hour Fittness. Every time I talk about this place to friends, they always think I go work out for an hour or so, then gain it back from eating at this place, lol! They forget that I've only eaten here once.
author: Michelley D.

description:
Can't speak for their pho since I didn't get it... 

Rare beef with peanuts, onions and fish sauce. YUM! I love raw beef. Super good though!!! The flavors mixed together made it extra good, just make sure you eat a breathmint or some gum afterwards.
author: Constance C.

description: Not impressed at all with these guys. Used to go there years ago and I don't remember the food being so mediocre. This restaurants was among my favorite ones but that could be because I was new to California and I knew little about real good food. Before arriving to California all I knew was what I had when I lived in Peru. Pho Ha Tien deserves nothing but zero stars. I have had better pho. Apparently, I was in the wrong place at the wrong time when desperately craving pho. Tried this spot and could only compare it to every other pho joint I had previously visited in San Francisco and several other cities I visited. I longed for Kevin's Noodle House #2 while I slurped the beef broth and noodles. The Thai iced-tea was much too sweet. People make the drive elsewhere for quality, reasonably priced Vietnamese pho and sandwiches. Overall a pretty disappointing experience. Next time I am in a mood for Vietnamese food I'll go somewhere else.
author: Rodrigo M.

description:
I had dinner here last night, it wasn't turn out to be great dinner. 
1. The broth doesn't taste so much well. It's a bit sour, and boring. There aren't any aromatic herb and spice flavor compare to other pho place.
2.The person next to us just sat down, we waited 3minutes already and that person gets to order before us.
3.The water provide to drink wasn't cold enough to cool from the hot, warm soup while we drink. Seem to be cheap on ice. 
4.The noodle was clump in a ball, and it was hard to break apart. It most like sat for awhile, unfresh, noodles serve to us.
author: U T.

description: Family, friends, Pho equals great food and a good time.
author: Jose V.

description: Average tasting pho. Decent atmosphere. Not worth $7 a bowl.
author: Katherine E.

description:
This review is for take-out... 

I'm not a pho expert by any means, but I wanted a tasty soup to clear up my sinuses. Seafood noodle soup and egg wonton noodle soup, complete with packets of hoisin sauce, sriracha, and limes. Just what the doctor ordered - now my head feels 5 lbs. lighter and the back of my throat is on fire. All with good taste.
author: Courtney S.

description: This place boasts a lot of good menu Items you wont normally find at basic Pho restaurants. They have things like roast duck and various pork options (my personal favorite). The service is pretty lame, which isnt a big deal for me seeing as its Pho and the waiters/waitresses aren't exactly chatting you up. I would never call this place mind blowing but its certainly the better Pho option to various competitors in the area.
author: Alex H.

description: I had the pho, it was standard to most other pho places...  The service was okay, we had to ask for water and the check twice
author: Donovan R.

description: This place makes the best authentic pho in Ingleside. The broth is so delicious and the meat is always tender. My friend always gets the curried chicken pho with big veggies. I recommend this place any time of the year
author: Siobhan R.

description: Considering I walk past 3 pho restaurants to get to this once, I'd say it is the best in the neighborhood. The atmosphere is very no frills, but the wait staff is quick and attentive, the pho is steamy and delicious and it is all for a great price. What more do you want in a neighborhood pho restaurant?
author: Nadia M.

description:
I only went to this place because it was the only pho restaurant close to SFSU that I found on yelp and I must say it wasn't too great. 
The food is whatever, they had the basic so it satisfied the craving. However the service was awful, I mean sure we are a couple of students that probably won't leave you a hefty tip, but at least try to act like you are glad we are here.
author: Michelle W.

description: Solid three stars. It's good pho if you are in the neighborhood and you are hungry. Cheap, fast, and taste pretty good. But the portion is a little small.  I eat a lot if pho in my life, this is only ok, but not worth a special trip to the restaurant.
author: Sandie Y.

description:
Date/Time: Sunday ~1:30pm
Occasion: Lunch
Party of:  Two
Ordered:  Fancy pork Vietnamese sandwich & Pho bo tai vien (rare beef & beef ball noodle soup)
Location:  A little filthy interior but very spacious for a Viet restaurant.
Total incl gratuity: $24

Heard this place was really yummy so decided to give it a try.  Not particularly impressed.  The pros are that they definitely give you really large portions. I ordered my pho regular size and it filled up me rather nicely.  The sandwich, which we ordered as an appetizer, arrived quickly was nice and toasty.  Not bad considering it was only about three dollars.   The pho broth was different.  It was sweet.  Not sure if I love it though it wasn't horrible.  Service is your typical Vietnamese restaurant.  I have yet to find pho that I love love love in SF so I'll keep on trekking on.  Overall, A-OK for this place.
author: Jess C.

description: I love this place, I go here on my own frequently and am never dissapointed. The portions are large, everything is fresh and has great flavor. Prices are also great. I get hungry just thinking about it.
author: Graham H.

description:
Even though I only give them three stars, I come here A LOT!  Like 2-3 times a month!  They're fast, food is decent and cheap, parking is good for SF, and I like the sunlight on this side of Ocean Ave.  Seriously.  

There are better pho and bun places in SF, BUT not in this neighborhood.  The dining room is always full, but not packed.  Important.  that means I can always get a table with minimal wait or no wait at all.  

The servers don't speak English well, but just order by number.  They know the drill.  All the servers have been here for years!  I prefer the sandwiches and bun over the pho.  I get the BBQ pork sandwich.  

The pho is okay, not great.  (If you want great, see my other reviews) Veggies are usually very fresh.  They offer some other Vietnamese dishes that I'm not as familiar with, but I have sampled them.  Not bad, if you're feeling adventurous.  

I looked at some of the other reviews.  I have had the dishwasher taste experience in the bun before, but never in the pho.  I've never been hit up for a tip though.
author: Stephen F.

description: The Pho here is nasty! Don't go here!! Even their fish sauce tasted bland. How could  somebody mess up fish sauce??
author: Jangalina J.

description:
Only reason I tried the place is because its the only one around where I just moved.

Pho was unbalanced. More meat than noodles which is to say the meat was average and the there were sparse noodles in it. The broth was nothing spectacular either. I'd go to pho Hoa(chain place) rather to this any day.

At least I got a courteous smile from the server as opposed to the pho house servers off of Irving street.
author: Bill N.

description: This restaurant has pulled through on so many occasions. I'm a huge pho lover, but whenever I come here, I gain a new favorite dish. The rice plates are plentiful, so you definitely should have no problem eating your fill. I just ordered the Curry Chicken Vermicelli soup, and holy smokes, I think I have to order it again every single time in the future! Seriously, try out that dish, but also any vermicelli dish, because I think this place does it right.
author: Teresa C.

description: The taste and texture of everything served is of excellent quality. In regards to the portions of meat in the Pho? WHERE'S THE BEEF!!? A bit skimpy on the meat but, I guess you get what you pay for as with what little meat was in my Pho was delicious. The interior is somewhat shabby in the canteen style that is the norm with most Vietnamese restaurants. The staff is not exactly welcoming in that, they don't look you in the eye and they seem to be rushing off to just push the next customer on and out. Other than that, the food is good. The herbs are fresh and aplenty. A very different Imperial roll in that they are tiny, thin and in the same form as lumpia. They were yummy and the fresh mint garnish was a nice touch. I will go back for sure to find my comfort zone in their menu.
author: Out O.

description:
My roomate told me that this place was really good and I have to say its just okay.  I cant say that it stands out.  However, I do like how it also serves sandwiches.  

I agree with some on here that ordering an XL didnt seem to add more noodles to my XL bowl.  I do like how they dont hold back on the meat though.  Some spots hold out on both and thats just no bueno.

I'll probably be rolling to this spot every once in awhile.
author: Mark L.

description:
Quick service, tasty sandwiches full of little bits of awesome (fresh jalepenos and cilantro).  Sanwiches are larger in comparison to some of the other vietnamese places around.

Very multi-cultural cliental.  Quick service, but a little cold.  

Whatever...you get your food quickly and its great and very fair prices.  They shouldn't have to treat you like a god, they just need to bring you your food without being an ass.
author: Ryan S.

description:
I like it. It's not impressive, it's not amazing, but "good". 

It's a solid place to eat Pho, and sandwich. Portion is good, service is quick, and it's cozy. 
No complains at all. 
I will keep going back since it's close to my place.
author: A O.

description: Not the greatest quality of food, but I really enjoy the flavors and the experience. The ambiance is very off putting and so is the overall cleanliness of the place.
author: Alan H.

description:
So if I were to have a last supper and had to pick a meal of choice, I think that it would be a giant bowl of pho.  I mean really what is there not to like.  Tasty soup, lots of noodles and a variety of meats to choose from  And this is a great opportunity to use all of my favorite condiments. 

As we walked up to the place, I thought that this place just might be good.  I said that because I could smell it a block away.  I was right!

We ordered 2 small bowls of the number 3 (rare steak) and an order of vegetable rolls.  Within 7 minuets the food was out to use.  The broth was nice and clear and piping hot.  Just the right amount of rare meat.  The veggie rolls were also delish as well.  

I am certain that we will make a repeat trip really soon. 

Also if you are looking for ambiance... this is not the place, but at least you are certain to get a great bowl of pho
author: Jennifer S.

description: In my 3 years in SF, I've eaten here probably 20 or 30 times.  Just really good local for dine-in or takeaway, super-fast service, tasty tasty!
author: M P.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 5/5
Price: $
Portions: 5/5
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 4/5

I LOOOOOVE THEIR IMPERIAL ROLLS!!!!
author: Eva H.

description:
I live 5 blocks away and go here about 3x a week. I love this place. Food is so good and super cheap. 

This place is always packed but for a reason. I highly recommend their Seafood Noodle soup, iced coffee, and garlic noodles.
author: Monica M.

description: Try the BBQ chicken sandwiches! If you add some Hoisen and Siracha sauce, it tastes like Teriyaki chicken!
author: Erika L.

description: This is probably the most authentic and delicious Vietnamese restaurant I have ever been to! The people who take your order and seat a person are not too friendly, but that is what makes the restaurant authentic. When you are seated, you are served hot tea (which is free), and are given menus. The rare beef pho is my absolute favorite! I also always get a bbq chicken sandwich and dip it in the soup. The service is fast and on your table you find all the delicious condiments that add to your pho that make it even more delicious. Before being served pho (if that's what you ordered), someone brings you a plate of bean sprouts, lime and leaves to add to your soup as well. Bear in mind that this restaurant won't let you use a credit card unless your meal is $15 and over, but that shouldn't be a problem because there are numerous ATM's in the area on Ocean Ave. This restaurant is my go-to place whenever I am craving pho!!
author: Cristina N.

description:
My wife and I went here this Friday afternoon and were pleasantly surprised. It exuded a homey like feeling that drew us in. Not to mention the aromas wafting through the door as we walked up. 

It was a no frill interior but comfortable the less and plenty of room. 

We had an appetizer of Calamari, deep fried in a simple batter served with a nice vinegar based sweet peppery sauce. Good stuff for dunkin and startin the supper off. Arriving at the same time was something  my wife noticed on the menu and thought it would be a pretty cool dish. It was Crab and Asparagus soup served with whole pre-blanched aspargus, crab meat, chopped scallions and an egg. served in a seafood broth. We were both happy with the flavor and portion, not to mention some good asparagus and substantial quantities of crab meat. My wife washed all that down with rice and BBQ Chicken and I, the broiled beef strips covered in unsalted peanuts and a sweet BBQ sauce that didn't overpower the chicken. Of course. accompanied with the token pepper and vinegar dipping which was integrated with carrot strips and fresh chopped scallions. 

All pretty good stuff.  We were both happy we stopped for the first time.

We washed all the food down with the pre-dinner tea and two beers. 

The bowls of Pho being served around us were huge and accompanied with tons of veggies. Next time, that's what I'm trying. 

Give it a try. We'll be back.
author: Wayne B.

description: Love it. The food is so good here I had the House Special it was a nice combination of everything and the vegetables are fresh. They use Lipton Tea not impressive. O one more thing the place is not totally clean by that I mean the doorway and the floor. Even though it's not that clean I would come back.
author: Aurelio L.

description:
So, I have been really into Vietnamese lately.

(no comments from the peanut gallery - that means you Darin I !)

While exploring a little known area of the city (to me anyway) searching for a new place to eat my BF and I stumbled across Pho Ha Tien. Being a cold, foggy night - I thought a big bowl of piping hot Pho was just what the doctor ordered.

I don't know much about Pho. To be quite honest, I had never even heard of it before the great "How do you pronounce Pho?" debate of Yelp Talk 2006. After that, I was intrigued. I tried it and have been hooked ever since.

That being said, I don't particularly know what makes good Pho. I just know what I like - and I liked the Pho at Pho Ha Tien. My main requirements are flavorful broth, generous noodle portions and H-O-T. The pho here filled those requirements nicely. They offer numerous variations, but I stuck with my usual - rare eye round and well-done flank steak. 
The BF had the noodle soup with barbecued pork. He didn't love it - he was surprised that the pork came on a separate plate and needed to be dumped into the broth - but he liked it. He gave higher marks to the three colored coconut drink he had for dessert. I just don't get Asian desserts - but that is a whole other review. Overall a very pleasant dining experience. I'll for sure go back.

Oh...

We also had a Vietnamese shrimp roll. It was amazingly fresh and so big I could hardly fit it in my mouth 

(Darin!)
author: Jamie M.

description:
This is definitely the spot.  Great portions and super friendly staff.  The rare beef pho, imperial rolls, cold shrimp rolls and the various vermicelli dishes (all about the imperial rolls + charbroiled shrimp one) are where its at.  That combo skewer platter with the rice paper you soak at the table is delicious too.  All the herbs and veggies they serve with your main dish are fresh and the decor is pretty standard for a small pho joint.

And and and, something this place has on most other pho places... napkin holders are well stocked, clean chopsticks/silverware, and table tops!  Can't be getting my sleeve wet after sloshing around in my pho....

Parking is decent, $15 minimum for credit card purchases so don't be afraid to take-out.  They also have a location downtown that used to be my mans lunch staple before his office moved.
author: Margaret L.

description:
The pho here is alright. I usually substitute for egg noodles (this helped during lent when I gave up anything with flour).  I've had better pho but if you don't feel like driving too far then this should satisfy your craving. Just make sure its not on a Tuesday because they're closed.

Service is so & so. When they bring you the food sometimes I feel like they're gonna throw it to you. It could be a little cleaner but I guess with the high turn-around time all they can do is take a towel and wipe down the table. Oh and my mom tastes MSG and trust me she can smell that stuff from a mile away!
author: Lola L.

description:
Four stars because they serve Bun Cuon and I can't find it anywhere except Little Paris, and Little Paris's is not fresh!

Bun Cuon:  ground pork and seaweed wrapped inside rice paper, dipped in fish sauce = YUM.

Bun Rieu, my other fave is decent here, but they should lay off the flour a little on the crab/pork paste.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Sadly, this place is awful :(

I used to go there often, but not anymore, not since we found THREE hair in our food. It was disgusting. I mean we have found hair before, but that time it was like "okay just one hair, we forgive them."

Then

"What the?!?!? another hair???"

Then

"OMG EWWW there's another one!!"

Yuck!

My bf assumed that the food probably fell on the floor and they put it back in the big chunk of soup. That was why we found so many hair in them.

Ew no more. And the service is terrible. No smile. No emotion. Waiters don't seem to care about customers. They might be rich already or what? If you don't love your job, then work somewhere else!
author: Sweet J.

description: Wasn't really feeling the broth or the meat.
author: Mike L.

description: This is my regular pho place. Not only is it close by, I think that they have a decently flavorful broth and I've had only one bad experience here. You don't want to go early in the morning. Their broth hasn't cooked out enough yet. I don't think they start their day early enough. You want to go probably sometime around noon or so. I've had their chicken and rice and some other dishes and never had a bad experience with those either.
author: Alton Y.

description:
They should add "Anything But" in front of their restaurant name.

Was that tasteless? .... Not as tasteless as their pho. I mean come on. At first I thought I just drank too much the night before because I honestly couldn't taste ANYTHING but the WARM broth. Not hot, not even 'just the right amount of hot'.. it was lukewarm.  Yikes..

2stars for the cheap prices and good service, I guess. Next time I'll stick with a sandwich.
author: Av A.

description: Delicious Pho!  Great prices. Relaxed atmosphere. Tiger beer. Definitely coming again.
author: Mike R.

description: The Pho here is pretty plain. The meat was very thick, chewy and tasted overdone and rubbery. The noodles came in one big chunk. I guess I wasn't in the mood to eat or something, but what was good was the soup!
author: Caroline L.

description: Good pho, but not my favorite spot in the city, I mainly go here out of convenience since it's the closest pho spot near my house. If I'm up for a drive I prefer either place on Irving/19th Ave.
author: M R.

description:
I just started going here the food is cheap and pretty good...I only have had the imperial rolls and the chicken noodle soup..

Although I did read a review that mentioned hair in the soup not one but 3 at the time of writing this Im kind of grossed out (yep just a lil)
author: Kim R.

description:
Its cheap and the food is decent.  There's not too many options for vegetarians. I had the tofu sandwich and tofu and spinach soup. There was nothing great about either dish. The soup was sorta bland but I wasnt really expecting much for a place that predominately focuses on meat soups. The sandwich had a slight sweet taste to it. 

Finding parking is a b**** and the sanitation of the place is a little suspect. I didn't notice anything myself but I'm not surprised by some of the other reviewers comments either.

I was on the fence on giving the place 2 stars but It is cheap and the service is quick so I gave it 3. If I could I would give it a 2.5
author: Richard C.

description:
The pho is nothing spectacular, but it's convenient when I'm hanging out near GP.  Have to say, though, it's pretty pricey compared to other pho places.

Stick with the pho, though.  I once tried to order some chicken dish which turned out to be a disaster.  Think cheap Chinese lunch deal.  And the shrimp rolls (and accompanying sauce) are abominable.  

Also, word of warning: Never order a bowl of pho with extra noodles. Instead of using a larger bowl to accommodate the extra noodles, they just shove everything into the same sized bowl which results in a noodle-y nest on the bottom.  Plus, they end up skimping on the soup because they have to make room for the extra noodles.  Grrr.
author: Helen C.

description:
The food is average, the same as any other Vietnamese place in the city, but every time I come here I'm incredulous at how rude some of the employees/owners are.  The waitresses were fine, but the men are a whole other story.

We came in here expecting to sit down and eat, but then decided to order to go.  The waitress pleasantly took our order and we waited.  But then some guy behind the counter reprimands us for sitting down at a table when we're just ordering takeout.  On several other occaions that I've come here to buy Vietnamese sandwiches to go, the 30-something bald guy behind the counter who takes my money is seriously lacking in customer service skills.  Never cracks a smile or says thank you, and is standoffish.   Do you hate being here?   People skills not your thing?

Food average, but I'd drive out of my way to avoid this place.
author: C. L.

description:
What makes Pho Ha Tien my favorite pho spot in the city?  Simple.  It's next door to my gym.  And for some reason, consuming large quantities of warm, spicy soup immediately following a hard workout makes me feel  like I'm doing something good for my body.   
If I'm not in a soup mood, the chicken salad is also excellent.  Their spring rolls are always good and probably the best dipping sauce out of all the pho places in my regular rotation.

But the one thing this spot has that will always always always rank it tops on my list:  hot ginger tea.  If there's any better drink in San Francisco, I don't think I've found it.  It's one of a kind, and you simply gotta love the insulated mug they serve it in.  Pho + hot spicy ginger tea = yums.
author: Becca V.

description:
I love getting their Pho here when I'm feeling sick.  I recently moved to San Francisco, and used to have this place back home that makes the most AMAZING vegetarian pho.  So, I came looking for another vietamese place that makes a good vegetarian noodle soup here.  

This place, while not quite meeting the amazing standards of my old place, makes a very delicious and light pho (its called Noodle and Vegetables w/ Tofu & Chicken Broth on the menu- you just ask for it without the chicken broth). A few things that aren't so great is that this comes with A LOT of bok choy- and not just the leafy part so for those of you that aren't huge fans, you may have to move it to the side.  The vegetables taste very fresh, the broth is light, and the tofu is soft.  Another small complaint is that on the side it comes with a type of parsley instead of my preferred basil- although people that order beef-pho get the basil. Overall- its at a great price and they are very kind there.

Just remember to bring cash because they don't take cards!
author: Gabi S.

description:
Pho Ha Tien is conveniently close to home...and when i'm in couch potato mode it's not a bad place to stop in. The pho and the sandwiches are alright.

Service is, well, efficient. i guess i'm not the only one who thinks the staff never smile or are anything other than grumpy.  i tend to nix dining in and just call for pickup.
author: iGab C.

description:
After a horrid experience at Out The Door the other night I just had to go back to Pho Ha Tien and remind me of what decent Vietnamese food tastes like.  Pho Ha Tien is right around the corner from my bf's place and it has served as the perfect spot for hangover recovery, cheap dinner when we are too lazy to cook, and when Im sick and hes taking care of me I ALWAYS send him here for Pho.  

Everything is solid standard Vietnamese food...nothing absolutely astounding, but always solid. The service is...well what youd expect...not the most sociable, but always polite and swift.

I just got back from pickin up some veggie spring rolls and Vietnamese Iced coffee.  My tummy is very happy. THIS is what Vietnamese Iced coffee and spring rolls should taste like!
author: Seana L.

description: Curry chicken over rice was good. Yummy but not as spicy as I like. Very cheap and reasonable. The food came quickly . Tea was shabby and it took a bit of arm twisting by my date to get some ice water. Would go there again during the day, cause we shut that mofo down strolling in at 10 minutes before closing demanding grub.They were not a-holes about it.  My date got the pho and it made his nose run a lot , but i'm not judgmental like that --  the excess nasal drip was due to spicy noodley pho goodness. Overall it deserves a solid three, but man it makes me miss East Side San Jose so much I almost teared a little.
author: Carissa M.

description: I'm not a huge fan of pho but this place is ok.  Sizes are generous and food is decent.  The decor is not the best but it is relatively inexpensive so you get what you pay for.
author: Annabelle K.

description:
Had dinner here with my mom last night...it was ok. Not the best Pho I've had in my life but it satisfied my taste buds.

The waitresses were nice but they were quick to take our order. We barely sat down when the waitress first approached us. Their pho was ok and their fried egg rolls were mediocre as well.

Cheap prices though... =) I probably wouldn't come back unless I was really desperate for some Pho and was stuck in the area.
author: V M.

description:
The main question is whether or not they have good pho, right?  And the answer is, yeah, they have good pho.  They also have the bbq over rice or rice noodles, which is also good. And they have Vietnamese Sandwiches.  And they have sweet milkshake-like drinks. They have other stuff on the menu, like La Lot beef and other more complicated Vietnamese stuff, but they seem to be out of it those all the time. 

I have a low bar for pho places, though.  I mean, it's just got to be good pho.

There's only one problem I have with this place and that is that a few of the people who work there are really  grumpy, particularly one guy who I think must be the owner.  This is not the greatest place to take kids because the dining room is small, but it's also noisy (they seem to always have the TV on, which faces the diners, so don't go there if you want someone to concentrate on you).  There are no frills here.  Just decent Vietnamese food.  I like it just as much as New Loi's
author: John G.

description:
Love it. 

Go there 3x a month, almost always get the rare beef pho and fresh veggies spring roles. The BBQ chicken or BBQ pork sandwhiches are excellent- especially for $3. It's the best cheap, fast comfort food around.

I've never had a problem with the cleanliness. 

I have to admit that the service is minimal and they're pretty indifferent to your requests- but I find it all kind of endearing. 

Closed on......tuesday.
author: martin l.

description: used to come here between classes and sometimes my boyfriend and I would do takeout. they used to have basil. theyve replaced it with coriander. the soup is on the bland side so i dump hoisin into it.
author: Rose M.

description: Great Pho, really great broth, the Pho Tai beef was very good and looking forward to trying other dishes there soon.
author: matt l.

description: We LOVE this place!  Great service, they are very friendly and recognize their regular customers with a smile and hello.  Seated and served really quickly.  Great food, always fresh and consistently tasty.    Some of the best banh mi around.  We always order the BBQ pork banh mi, the pot stickers, plus the #3, #6, #47C (beef noodle soups and pork & shrimp spring rolls) and Tiger beer mmmmm!  Sometimes mix it up and get a chicken pho instead, which is also really refreshing and delicious.
author: C P.

description:
I've been going to this place for years, I haven't been in awhile so we decided to come back today since I was craving for some Pho. Service is usually great even when they are packed. 
Ordered our usual: charbroiled pork over rice, imperial rolls, fresh spring rolls, BBQ pork sandwich and this was my first time switching something different in my Pho. I wanted Pho but instead of rare meat, I wanted Wontons. Yea I know I know, I just wasn't craving the rare meat. Anway, they gave me egg noodles instead of rice noodles which wasn't even crackin'. I thought that I made myself really clear but I guess not. If I wanted Wonton noodle soup, I would've gone somewhere else. Lesson learned, don't switch up your Phos! Food is usually pretty good but it was just super salty today. I also like their taro dessert which reminds of a Filipino dessert that my father used to make.
Anyway if you want a quick filling lunch and is in the neighborhood then check this place out.
author: Anna P.

description:
I like to go here every once and a while because it's near my house. They have a big menu, but it is not too vegetarian friendly.  Though there is some selection for vegetarians. 

The staff is not really too friendly, but they have pretty good service. I like the cold spring rolls. The peanut sauce is not too spicy. 

I'll be going back.
author: Alex S.

description:
terrible parking.  its hard because 24hour fitness is right next door.

i was looking for a vietnamese place close to home.  mount davidson is where i live.  i usually go downtown to another place when i need what i want.  but i just didn't want to drive downtown.

i tried this place.  it was a bit pricey for bbq pork or chicken over rice.  the meal was okay, it seemed kind of fatty for me.  it just didn't seem like what i wanted.  

the fish sauce that they gave was much fishier than i'm used to.  in fact it was too fishy...lol.

i've been here three times but i don't think i'll be going again.

unless, i forget that i didn't love it here.
author: Bing D.

description:
Ok. I actually think their pho is sub par, the meats sorta rough, soup lacks a little bit in flavor, and lemons are not strong enough. They however managed to get the extra star from me because of their humongous selection of food that is not too bad.

Here are a couple of things that are really hard to find, esp. DECENT in Vietnamese restaurants up and down the bay excluding San Jose's Lion Plaza because they might have better.
- Bun Rieu, a crabmeat, pork, and tomato variety of pho. It's pretty good here, it's one of the only places I know that serves it too!
- Banh Cuon, dude, honestly, seriously. If you can get it without that THICK white coat around the meat, you're lucky. Here you can, it's good, but the fried onion they put on top of it compromises the flavor.
- Banh Xeo, as much as I like it. Don't get it here, it's quite disappointing, esp. after the one at the Lion Plaza, or from your mom's cooking. But if you're in the craving for it, at least you CAN get it.

In my belief, their sandwiches are pricey, I'm used to paying more like $2.25 for my Banh Mi Dac Biet, Combination special.

I like Ha Tien, but I wouldn't order just like the Pho Dac Biet, maybe like a vermecelli bowl or rice or what I listed above.
author: Winè C.

description:
Usually come here if i'm too lazy to find a place to eat after the gym (its right next to 24 Hr on Ocean). The place is everything you'd expect a pho place to be: slightly dirty and a name that sounds like all the other pho places in the city (Pho Xsoier sldkjfoei blah blah), so i never know the names of the pho places i eat at. They have some different food here, like the Satay Beef pho - the soup is made up of some spicy broth w/ lots of coconut milk (never seen that in a pho place). 

Until now i have not  had reason to complain about this place, but yesterday my sis found a dead fruit fly in her beef and beefball soup. She was already complaining about the small amount of beef she got in her soup, so i guess the restaurant made up for it w/ another form of meat. She already finished more than half of it and was at the point where she's like "should i complain?" and i tell her, "you already ate most of it and the fly's been in there the WHOLE time, and an asian place like this is not gonna give you a free meal." 

I will not be coming here anymore unless i'm dying of hunger after a long cardio workout.
author: Douglas F.

description:
The Pho? Cheap, hearty portioned, and pretty good. When you walk in you usually won't be greeted by friendly waiting staff. Instead the employees might stare at you as though you should know where to sit, walk up to you, and lead you to a table. When you order they don't really acknowledge or thank you for coming. The food is pretty mediocre, but is yummy when you are too lazy to cook spend or more than $9 a person. The place seems like clean on a normal standard. I'm not sure how clean those chopsticks are and they kinda scare me..the food does come out fast though.

In the long run, the food is okay and the service is like speaking to a rock wall. Stern and quite.
author: Nick B.
