description: Tonight I came here and ordered the small beef brisket with tendons and tripe pho noodle.  The soup was very tasty. However, my one knock on this place: for the bean sprout side plate they provided, there were no jalapeño peppers included. Usually that's one of my favorite part, adding the peppers to spice up the soup.
author: H K.

description:
I've only been to Pho Ha Tien and I really don't remember too much from the first time. The only thing I do remember was the waiter was friendly and funny. 

On to the food, it was just ok, I've had way better. But to be fair, I live in San Jose half the time and the Pho down here is better in general. I got the number 1 so there was plenty of food. The steak/beef was well done, over cooked. I like my beef a little raw/pink. the beef in the Pho was tough and dry. 

We also ordered egg rolls, fried. and it was good. Not san jose good, but better than some of the other restaurants around here. 

so why the "3"? I was leaning towards 2, but I did like the egg rolls and I would come back again, just won't order the pho again. I might actually get a crab next time.
author: Jin S.

description: My wife and I are discerning Pho people. We love this dish almost as much as Ramen so we were recommended to this place by a Japanese lady who swears by it. It is not very plush and feels like a cafeteria but in terms of the beef pho, it is up there with the best. It's the food that counts after all. Service is fast if not impersonal but you order, eat, pay and leave. It hits all the right spots in terms of fresh, tasty and value for money. Order any of the beef phos - the #1 extra large is great value at $7.45 with loads of meat but the #2 large is sufficient for the very hungry too. Also try the (cold shrimp rolls) and imperial rolls. Fabulous.
author: Richard M.

description:
Pho Ha Tien has been a temptress since day one. Who can resist a bahn mi/noodle place that is right next door to your gym? I am amazed that my resolve lasted almost 7 months of gym going before I broke down last week. Bahn mi are pricier here, weighing in at $2.75 except for the fish cake sandwich that's a whopping $3.25. I've never had a bahn mi that was over $3 and I've never had a fish cake sandwich, it does not tempt, although there must be something good about it or people wouldn't pay such exorbitant prices. 
I had the combo pork sandwich and it reminded me of the bahn mi I ate as a kid. Classic flavors hit the spot, but something was a little more gelatinous than usual. Not my favorite (Saigon Sandwiches), but at times very convenient and tasty enough.
author: Candice L.

description: after a month of frequenting this place, still a solid three stars. service is pretty fast even on busy days. broth for the pho is alright.. as in, once it gets cold, you don't want to finish it. still come here when i need a vietnamese fix though.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
It's tasty. It's next to my gym.  After a 6 mile run on the treadmill on a dreary drizzly day.....the Pho craving is UNBELIEVABLY intense!  

Verdict? My Pho Ga (Chicken soup) was quite tasty.  Good flavor, not too greasy, a little lacking in chicken though.

My friend's Pho Tai (Rare beef) was also quite good.  He liked the flavor quite a bit.

But he commented that he's pretty certain there is MSG in the pho.  MSG? Why? Why put it in if it's not necessary?

Nonetheless, after a gym workout, I'm likely to make it here again in the future.
author: Jane A.

description: This place is a pretty decent restaurant for some nice pho and Vietnamese sandwiches. They give a good amount of noodles, and the broth is pretty good. Other than that, nothing really stands out compared to other good pho restaurants. As for the sandwiches, they are pretty good and cheap. So for me, it's good for a nice small lunch or snack. This place loses a star because of the flies flying around. Other than that, I'll only go here if I was in the area.
author: Nick L.

description:
Yowza! Eat a sammie here! 

What can i say about Pho Ha Tien. My friends and I drive ALL the way across town to grab one of their totes delish sammies. Why, you ask. Duh, they're only the best Vietnamese sandwiches around! 
Barbecue pork is my fav!!! 

Tip: We sneak 'em into the movie theater. So lame I know...but lots of fun.
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
The pho here is nothing to write home about (in either the good OR bad sense). I won't write about the fabulous broth (because it's not so fabulous) or about the AWFUL service (because it's not awful). 

In fact, this is about as run-of-the-mill as a pho place can get. And I will continue to come here all the time on cold rainy days because it is cheap, adequate, and convenient. Not to mention the food always comes out right quick. I think I'll go get a bowl now...
author: Shelley T.

description:
Very tasty pho  but I have to agree with the reviewer below, the owners are grumpy.  However, he was nice enough once to turn on Blues Clues for the kids so my husband and I could eat in peace.  
The green dessert shake with the tapioca and coconut milk is just delicious!!
author: Rio K.

description:
Okay, so I come here often since it's sooo convenient! I can easily say I've been here more than 50 times. LOL. And I must say I've grown to like this place a lot. 

The people remember me and my bf every time we come in, plus what we like to order. Haha. I usually get the #2, it's probably the most popular bowl there. Another good options are the vermicelli with bbq pork + imperial roll and the lemon grass chicken. 

This is basically my home for pho if I'm not willing to travel to too far. I like. In fact, I love. But it's still not my favorite. Will you take 2nd best, Pho Ha Tien?
author: M J.

description: I would give this place 4.5 stars. We eat here... a lot. It's very bare bones. No frills....but a delicious bowl of pho. The broth is great and the noodles are never soggy. It's cheap, and easy. The rice plates are great and I always get a sweet drink to go.
author: Jennifer C.

description: BBQ chicken noodle soup is by far the best soup dish here...and the prices and portions are awesome!! Also the fried Imperial rolls are always a good add on no matter what you order.
author: Travis G.

description:
Casual place with a variety of Vietnamese foods to choose from; unfortunately, very few veggie options (I recall one and a half: tofu sandwich or veggie pho in chicken broth, hence the half).  Service is pretty quick, though, and the small portion is pretty big and filling.  The veggie pho included a few slices of silken tofu, broccoli florets, straw mushrooms, and julienned carrots.

I think you need a minimum total of $15+ to use a credit card.
author: Lynn O.

description:
I absolutely love this place - it has got to be the best Vietnamese restaurant that I've been to. (Although I'm a little hesitant as to whether it's authentically Vietnamese..they have a lot of dishes that seem..not Vietnamese? But delicious nonetheless).

Prices are cheap, and the menu has a lot to offer. Every other place I've been to only carries spring and eggrolls. This place has a nice big variety of rolls, it amazes me. The pho is great, and I also recommend the curry chicken w/ a fried egg. :) The service is what you expect from an Asian restaurant (Don't worry, I'm Asian, I've seen it all).
author: Tiffany T.

description: Never tried the pho here but I have tried their bahn mi, garlic noodles, beef steak cubes and thai iced tea. I love their BBQ pork bahn mi!  Garlic noodles are nice and greasy and beef steak cubes have just the right amount of flavor. I hate that when I crave for a bahn mi and want it from here, it's somehow always a Tuesday, the day they are closed. Another thing I like about their bahn mi's is the affordable price at $3.25.
author: Eugenia G.

description:
Super good and cheap. Beef Pho and Pork Bun + some Spring Rolls for $19. Can't beat that.

From our meal, it would seem they've cut down the MSG as we didn't have any issues and am usually sensitive to the effects.

Place is a little dirty/divey but the people were friendly and I'll definitely be back for a sammich.
author: matt n.

description:
Great pho, with a truly amazing broth. Tastes like they use lots of bones to create the broth, which has tons of flavor. 

The place is a little dingy, but it's basically clean, spacious, and seriously, the soup is very tasty. I crave this at any time, and when you're sick, there's nothing better. This is not your mother's chicken soup.

Also go for the Charbroiled Pork, which is like candy on rice. Ask for a double order of the pork and you won't be disappointed.
author: Kristin P.

description: I love Pho and lets just say I eat a lot of it. I come to this restaurant three times a week because I work down the street, its not that expensive, and it is convenient. The Chicken Pho is good, but the broth is a hit or miss. Everything else that I have ordered  is flavorless. I liked that the waitresses never talked to me so I could eat in peace. However, they have this 15 dollar minimum. I never carry cash on me and sometimes they take the card instead of me scrounging up dollar bills. I just read on my bank statement that by them accepting the card, it really meant that each meal they charged me 15 dollars. So, if you think they are being nice by accepting your card they are not, they are just cheating you out of your money. After finding this out, the soup is nowhere near that good. I will be going elsewhere from now on. Also I had to think to myself why would I eat at a place where I did not even want to go to the bathroom because it was so unclean.
author: RachelJean H.

description: Came here after going to the 24 Hr Fitness next door (no, didn't actually work out, just sort of touring the area).  I tried the small #3, pho w/ rare steak.  The rare steak slices were nice, and with the fish sauce on the table, it tasted a bit like home-made hot pot.  The soup seems to be full of MSG or made of something that was a bit artificial tasting and was served piping hot and took forever to cool down - I don't know if I was particularly impatient or what... but I did not want the noodles to get too soggy, so I wanted to cool it down faster.  They had a TV in the corner playing the NCAAF championship game, which helped pass the time.  This place is nice in a pinch.
author: Gerald C.

description: Best spring rolls and sandwiches, just the way how i like it. Waiters are all super friendly. I always crave for my #10 and extra spicyyy!
author: Sandy L.

description: Not the greatest pho places but there are a lot worse.....take away two stars becuz they could def add more meat to the pho bowls and there is a guy waiter there who is an a**hole.....1st time i was there he treated me like some low life scum off da streets and even had the nerve to demand a tip
author: Sang L.

description:
This is one of my guilty pleasure spots!! i am addicted to the #8 Chicken & rare Beef Pho..It has to be one of the best Pho spots in the city. The broth is amazing and they are very quick..Thumbs Up!!


Jamal
author: L Jamal J.

description:
I go there so much that they already know what I want to order. Actually, I think they stopped treating me like a customer and just like a hungry daughter they constantly have to feed.

The noodle soups are the best.  They manage to keep the noodles chewy rather than soggy.  And the marinated pork is the best meat.  Sandwiches are all delicious.  Don't bother with anything that is not traditional Vietnamese food (like the curry, ick)  even though the owners speak Cantonese.

The place is pretty dirty and the bathroom even worse so don't expect a nice place.  The food is relatively bland so if you like flavorful food, it probably doesn't taste good.

They are closed on Tuesdays.
author: Lucy H.

description:
This place is OK.  The food is not magic, but not tragic either.

It's the only vietnamese noodle place in the 'hood (actually, they recently opened a satellite restaurant down the street closer to CCSF, but they mostly only serve sandwiches and have much more limited hours...but I digress), and for that I am extremely grateful.  Apparently, so are other people too because the restaurant is usually somewhat full and busy.

The noodle dishes are sandwiches are decent, but they don't knock my socks off.  The servings are generous and the prices reasonable.  The service is quick and attentive.
author: Anne M.

description: Not my favorite Pho place, but pretty dependable.  If we are in the neighborhood (usually for a basketball game at St. Emydius), it is a great place to stop in.  Very friendly place.
author: Glenn L.

description:
walked by this place a bunch of times, finally gave it a try and i was not disappointed! i ordered the bbq chicken noodle soup, only $5.75
my boyfriend had the combination pork bahn mi for about 3 or 4 dollars? both were delicious, and everyone else there seemed to enjoy their meals as well.

we will definitely be coming back :)
author: Cristal F.

description:
I love this place near 24 Hour Fitness on Ocean. It's about the pho! Great service with free tea but it's the pho ga that I really find terrific. I like the big windows in the front booths too. 

If driving it's best to avoid Ocean Avenue businesses, in general, unless you have plenty of quarters and don't want to run one more errand. The SFMTA carts patrol that street with a venance and meters there don't take credit cards. Seems everyone I've asked gets a ticket  at least once in a while if they use Ocean Ave.
author: ava l.

description:
This place is lovely.  The food is inexpensive and delicious.  I love the bbq chicken and they serve it with rice, with pho, and in sandwiches so I get a nice variety.  Their bun bo hue is pretty authentic which is great.  I can never find a vietnamese restaurant that isn't scared to use pig feet except maybe in San Jose.

The waiters are nice and fast with the food.  The waiter with the glasses is hilarious.  He's got a dry sense of humor, so if you're not down with that, you might get a strange vibe from him.  Another waiter always deals with my broken vietnamese and also encourages me to keep speaking the language.  

Overall, the place has tasty food and the service is good.  Nothing to complain about.
author: Kristine S.

description:
For their price, I give four stars.  This is not a traditional Vietnamese restaurant.  And, you would have to know what to order and when.  The pho soup is somewhat tastier in the evening than early morning, better on weekends than weekdays.  I recommend Bun(cold vermicelli) more than rice plates, but I wouldn't recommend trying imperial rolls here.  If you take home the Vietnamese sandwich,  try toasting it for half minute; you will enjoy it more.  
If you don't know what to order, Try #60 (Steamed rice rolls wrapped w/ground pork) for meal, and #120 (Three color coconut drink) for dessert.  I'm sure you will like it.
author: Mari L.

description: Chicken Curry and Combination Beef Pho was very good.  Service was great, atmosphere was casual, clean and welcoming.  Food was cheap, great value.  I highly recommend this place and only don't give it a five star rating because it was very good but I was not quite blown away.
author: Ben P.

description: Not great but not bad. I tried the rare beef and spicy pork combo pho. They seemed to skip on the meat but gave plenty of noodles. I was a little disappointed that they didn't give jalapenos as a condiment. The only time I could recommend Pho Ha Tien is if you're in the area and its passed 9pm- when most pho restaurants close in SF. I go to school right next door and dont get out till 8:30. But if that wasn't the case my ass would be eating pho on Irving.
author: David D.

description: Fast, inexpensive and local.  I particularly like their curry chicken noodle soup, it's hot and sweet with big chucnks of potato and chicken in it and just the right amount of curry.  I've also found their waiter to be kind of amusing. The first time I was there someone asked if it would be possible to do a substitution and the waiter replied, "Oh, anything is possible." It was funnier in person, some of the humor gets lost without context.
author: Jane D.

description: After a long NYE, I decided on Pho as my first meal of the New Year with my girls. We all got the #3 Beef pho, fried calamari, thai iced teas, and some bbq chicken spring rolls. After having pho a few times I have a better idea of what's good and what's not. It was ok. Not the best I've had but pretty good, the broth more so than anything. The thai iced teas were premixed so I was extremely disappointed with that. Calamari was coo but not as good as it could've been. If you're craving some pho and don't know of anywhere this will suffice but next time I'll hit up Mama's kitchen in San Mateo.
author: Nancy R.

description: i love this place! good pho. my favorite is the #5 small and order of #56! quick service and friendly staff!
author: Nicole Q.

description: I ordered a number 10(Sate Beef) to go, and when i went back home i found out that they gave me a COMPLETELY different order. On the other hand, the food that they gave me, was not a good dish, i found a tiny plastic wrapper... I do not recommend this restaurant.
author: Lizzie Q.

description: PHO!! How can you go wrong with it? I've never had bad pho before till I came here...I mean I've had decent pho before but this was just bad...the broth was so bland. Tell me why the soup was warm when it came out! I didn't even finish it..I guess if I ever to decide to go here again to order anything but the Pho. But other than the food the service was good and the bill came out to be really cheap..but I suggest do not order the Pho here.
author: Wendy T.

description: Pho Ha Tien is the only vietnamese restaurant number I have saved in my phone. They make the BEST BBQ pork vietnamese sandwiches EVER. Unlike other sandwich places, their pork is not dry and tastes great-although a little fatty. I add a lot of srirachi sauce cause it makes it "oh so tasty".
author: Linda W.

description: My family and I love this place.  Our usual routine is work out next door at 24-hour Fitness, then binge on vietnamese food...totally defeats the purpose LOL, but we gotta eat somehow.  It's really busy on late Saturday mornings, and the line is out the door.  The staff manages to seat everyone, but awkward to share the table with others sometimes.  Love their eggrolls, rice plates, beef stew, sandwiches, dessert drinks, and pho.  There's something for everyone, so if one doesn't like noodles, they can have rice, specialty entrees, sandwich, or appetizers.  The restaurant is spacious and full of lighting.  Location is convenient via transportation and plenty of parking.  It's close to everything...whether you crave for ice cream, just head over to Rite-Aid for cheap ice cream, or head to a  nearby bakery for pastries, or pamper yourself to a mani/pedi for cheap.  I love Ocean Avenue...may have to write about that next hehe.
author: Christine R.

description: Had the noodles, egg roles, and bbq beef. Not really good, not really bad, but I had better at other places. There soup is ok too, nothing to brag about.
author: Mike G.

description: San Francisco is such a heaven of Pho, 'cause it's pho pho pho everywhere u go. This is a particular one that I always go, usually after work out with friends at 24hour next door. I know, such a waste of work out lols. But there are too many places around here to fill your tummy. But this place has really good pho, always enjoyed mine:)
author: Marlis T.

description:
When it comes to pho [pronounced like "fun" without the "n"], I like a lighter, more simple broth. For Southern-style pho, I stuff the sprouts into the bottom, throw in some basil and squeeze in a little lime. Everyone has their own style of eating pho. Stealthypoo doesn't like the sprouts, so she doesn't put in any. She likes to put in a whole lot of sauce. It turns her bowl into a murky vat and masks the flavor of the soup, which I'll never understand, but that's just how she likes it. At Pho Ha Tien, I ask for the rare beef to be served separately from the pho. I put those slices in and wait until they're a safe color to eat. I've asked for the beef on the side at the pho place in Westlake, and their slices are much too thick and don't come out as tender as the ones here. It really depends on the cut of the meat. These are thinly sliced and not completely frozen when they reach your table. No matter the temperature of the broth, the meat seems to come out soft. Just don't leave it in too long before eating!

Prices are cheap. If you're feeling extra hungry, there's a larger size bowl you can get, and then you can add on noodles or extra orders of meat. The extra side of meat costs almost as much as getting another small bowl of pho, so you might just want to do that. Not sure how many slices come in that side order.

Service isn't horrendous. It's family-run. One lady is easier to order from [the older one] than another who always appears grumpy. Parking is a pain in the butt [one of the reasons I'm rarely at the gym]. Not impossible, however. The K-line runs right along Ocean, so one could take that. 

This is the place I go to when I wake up on a weekend morning craving pho. Of course, usually what happens is we'll end up at this place, and I'll order something else because I took a look at their extensive menu and another caught my eye. The bun (rice vermicelli bowl) is a safe bet, and the rice plates are fairly simple. The sandwiches are acceptable and have served as sustenance during the summer Stern Grove concerts. We would get to Stern Grove early, save some spots, and then one of us would grab sandwiches from Pho Ha Tien after 10am. I also like to get my fix of Vietnamese coffee here [strong coffee with condensed milk = SO GOOD], even though with braces, I shouldn't be drinking any coffee. I just brush quickly afterwards!

They are closed on Tuesdays. I've forgotten on several occasions and driven by - oops. 

It's 3.5 stars, but since everyone else gave 'em such a low rating, I've moved them up just a little bit. It's not a place for everyone. I think I'm more on the generous side with this place because I've been going there for awhile now. I like it. Doesn't mean you have to.
author: Tinna H.

description: There is no difference if you order the #1 or #1 with extra noodles. WTF, all wanted was some more noodles as I was hungry. Should order two portions. Complain to the waitress that I ask for extra noodle and she said it was added. My wife have the same with no extra noodle and looked the same, rip off city. Over all the food is OK because I live near here and don't want drive to sunset for Pho.
author: Phillip K.

description: I thought that it was extremely funny how when I order a large and XL, it seems to have the same amount of noodles and meat in there, except in a different sized bowl. Anyways, the pho is good, but i dont feel like im getting as such a good deal as other places. the rice plates weren't so good, especially when half of the pork in my rice place was fat. service was good, the waitress was friendly and patient. i would give it a 3.5 if i can do half stars, but i think they deserve a 3 more than a 4. :]
author: Danny Y.

description: I grew up eating pho and if it tasted like this, I don't think I'd still be a fan. The broth in the pho tai was greasy and left a bitter aftertaste in my mouth. In addition, after unceremoniously plopping down the food, the waiter was nowhere to be found. I ultimately had to go to the counter to pay. So mediocre food + mediocre service gets a mediocre one star.
author: Nathalie L.

description: Nothing special. Wouldn't go out of my way to come back here. Just a big fat meh...
author: Jen D.

description: Ok, I didn't have the Pho, but some other dishes. Never ever again. The crepe tasted like it was cooked in a very synthetic coconut oil. I didn't even want to bring it home for the dogs.
author: Catherine D.

description: Not sure what is so great about this place.  Yes, they have a good selection of Vietnamese dishes like Banh Cuon, Bun Rieu, Pho, etc...but nothing is out of the ordinary where you can't get anywhere else.  The prices are not as cheap as some other places of this caliber either.
author: Selene K.

description: I had the rare beef with lime as an appetizer and bun rieu yesterday, or a few hours ago. For the bun rieu, I had them use the noodle that they serve in the pho instead of the vermicelli that is normally used in bun rieu. The bowl of bun rieu came out and there wasn't enough soup in there. The noodle soak some of the soup up. I had a large and there was so much noodle. I was overwhelmed when I saw the bowl. The soup base was so bland. Yes, I've had better. I didn't finished my bowl. The rare beef was just ok. The fish sauce is mediocre. There's isn't anything good about the food here. But then again, I am really picky when it comes to Vietnamese food.
author: Linh N.

description:
overall i give this place a 3.
why?

Because the service was ehh.. ok, but the food was decent. I ordered the Charboiled shrimp with rice, i have to say they did give me more than the rice i'd expect haha.

The place was not clean. well thats IMO. The price was good, not to expensive. but thats pretty much what i have to say about this place.
author: Andrew H.

description: Super cheap and incredibly fast on the sandwich line, but the chicken is a bit suspect and the stomach was unsettled post-grub. Wouldn't go back, but would try the pho at their other location.
author: Jason B.

description:
This pho restaurant has been around for a while.  The quality here is so-so.  The pho soup is mainly salty with little beef flavor.  The meats portions are barely adequate and the noodles are decent.  There is quite a lot of MSG in the air when you sit down.  

The service is decent and the prices aren't bad.  It's a good place to go if you are absolutely craving pho on Ocean Ave.
author: John L.

description: Pho is decent considering it is the only place on Ocean st. The prices are expensive for a very SMALL bowl.. I mean very small. The service is always great, their sandwiches are one of the best in the city!
author: Mike H.

description:
i've only had their vietnamese sandwiches here, vegetarian at that, so i have no idea what the rest of their food [pho and other items] taste like.

i thought their veggie/viet sandwich was tasty.  but then again i can scarf one down w/room for more after a workout at the 24hour next door.  and after my saturday workouts [which usually are a longer and harder since i have that day off] anything and everything is tasty.  i just want to shove food in my mouth because i'm so god damn hungry!

i have yet to try the ones at baguette express and saigon, maybe then i can really compare because i'm not too savvy on vietnamese sandwiches.  although i do know i like them.  mmmmm..  the combo of french w/asian is just yummers!
author: Sheri N.

description: Mo Pho please!  Near Ccsf campus on Ocean, this place is frequented by locals & many high school or college students in the area.  But beware  since they don't open on Tues. -- a day I had classes on and forgot before I came this way.  I've had different items off their menu, but the pho is most popular. Wish they gave more noodles--brooth just ok.  If really hungry, order some rolls on the side too.
author: Eric Y.

description:
it was a cold rainy day and a city college student who didn't want to go to class decided to cut and get some warm hot food. 

i found instant parking right in front of the place, which was cool since it was pouring rain outside. 

I ordered a bowl of Beef Noodle Pho which is typically what i get the first time i try a viet restaurant. I must say, the taste that day was really good since it was a rainy day. 

Now, if it wasn't a rainy day, i would not have visited this place at all. It always looked dark and shabby and gave an impression that they will serve janky food. 

Overall i would give it a 3 star since i never went back after that cold rainy day, maybe when i decide to cut again.
author: Eric Y.

description:
I come here a lot to get their noodle soups and bbq chicken spring rolls (which are delicious with the peanut sauce) 
Their food is pretty decent. The dining room is shabby. Restroom looks gross but still useable. Employees are OK.

I found a hair rolled into my bbq chicken spring roll today which was pretty sickening. But at least they gave me a new one and an extra roll. And they weren't being hella shady about it.
author: Kristol C.

description: A nice place to eat. The pho is good portion and has a fresh taste. Good service and the place is clean. The place is small but has a nice cozy feeling. Nice place to try.
author: Leon C.

description: come here fairly often for fish cake sandwiches which are really good,and the rare beef pho. service is ok, but the food is worth it i would say
author: Erik K.

description: When I'm hungry, tired, and feeling lazy, noodles are the perfect food, especially when someone else makes it.  This is a good, fast, cheap place to get noodles and sandwiches.  The atmosphere is very "meh" but you're not going there for that.  And, as a non beef and pork eater, I love the face that I have lots of choices.
author: Jessica G.

description: This is really just your neighborhood pho/viet sandwich place.  Something quick and fast so you can go back home and enjoy the quiet evening.  We live close to here, so we drop by here about once a week or so when we're too lazy to drive far or cook.  Sandwich is not bad.  Pho is really ok.  What I like about this place is their suprisingly good garlic noodle.  You cannot compare it w/ Crustacean or PPQ, but for their price, if you want a quick fix w/out hurting your wallet, this is the place to be.  Service is really that not that great, but if you come here often enough, and the staff recognizes you, the service is a bit better.
author: AhLin C.

description: The chicken pho had more skin and fat than meat - and the bowl for which I requested "extra" chicken, and was charged an extra $1, had the same dismal amount of meat as the regularly-priced bowl. The sandwiches had more air and bread than filling - they didn't even have a decent amount of vegetables. Two small bowls of pho , 2 Tsing Tao's, and 2 sandwiches: $30. Learning that in the future I should go to any one of the many other ph restaurants in San Francisco: priceless.
author: Sonny D.

description: the Bun Bo Wei is good here one of my top picks for bun bo wei in san fran the noodles that comes with it so soft
author: Boh Boh W.

description: tasty soup and helpful staff, me and my husband go to this place at least twice a week, that's how much we love it!!!
author: Puteri H.

description: I'd like to give Pho Ha Tien a higher rating, but I can't get passed the lack of cleanliness of the place. The bathrooms are old and smell of old urine. The dining room looks a little untidy, and has a dirty smell to it as well. I used to frequent Pho Ha Tien, but haven't been there in a couple of months now. I miss their soup, but must keep looking for a place that is just as good, or better, with a cleaner vibe to it. Their food is pretty damn good though... The place could use a face lift. Face Lift = More Business... Maybe they don't need more business...
author: AL B.

description: The pho is good but not great. The staff members sometimes don't understand my orders. It's a good place for casual Vietnamese eating. The place could be cleaner but overall it's good. I do like their 3-color bean drink.
author: Palina P.

description:
i went there a few days ago b/c i was hungry for pho.  i found this place on yelp and decided to drive there.  from outside, it's really a hole in the wall place.  i was little hesitant to go in there but i braved myself and went in there and sat down.  

the place isn't anything to write home about...little bit dirty but a typical vietnames place. the menu is extensive...lots to order for a small place. i ordered large pho.  the size of large bowl is medium size in most vietnames places.  the soup was tasty but the meat wasn't plentiful like other places that i've been to.  would i go back there again? yes, b/c i want to try their vermicelli dishes and some rice plates.  

the service is just so so..as expected in vietnamese restaurant, it's non-existant.
author: donald c.

description: Serves average pho (the broth is pretty damn good though), but good service and its location right beside the 24 Fitness on Ocean makes this a money spot to grub after working out and balling. Always ask for the beef on the side for the pho BTW.
author: Ramon T.

description: This place rocks - the best soup ever - highly recommend the rare beef soup and the chicken kabobs - I go all the time, our waiter remembers my favorite things - it isn't a palace as far as the interior, but they're way too busy feeding the entire neighborhood to care - it is usually very busy for lunch...enjoy!
author: Ara A.

description: My go-to for to go!  3 main criteria for to go: the cuisine- scrumptious, the portions- huge, and the price- cheap.  There are so many things to chose from... both the beef and veggie pho's are fab, vermicelli bowls are yummy with many different meat choices and a finger-licking sauce, hefty shrimp rolls (the peanut sauce is good but needs a little spice or something), the hot & sour shrimp is pretty decent (more like a sweet & sour), the lemongrass chicken is good with an interesting flavor.  I still have 94 more choices to make it through but I'll get there someday!  I'm beginning to fiend Vietnamese because of this place!
author: Tara G.

description: For the only Pho option in this part of the city, Pho Ha Tien serves a decent to average bowl of pho. The sandwiches are good, but still this wouldn't be my first choice for Vietnamese cuisine. But since Pho 99 off of Skyline and Pho Hoa Hiep in Westlake are so far away, Pho Ha Tien isn't such a bad deal.
author: Be N.

description: i love this place. if you like pho and you are in the area should definitely try this place. the only problem is you may end up driving around to find parking for a little while.
author: Nicole R.

description: I used to come here for their Vietnamese sandwiches about four years ago. I just recently came back for some soup. I liked their broth. They gave lots of noodles, but definitely not enough meat. Waiter was dope though. We asked for hella stuff, and though I thought he'd be irked and annoyed, he made jokes out of everything. It's nice to see that he tries to enjoy his job even after long hours of work.
author: Cheryl P.

description:
After a 3 mile run on the treadmill at 24 hr fitness, I found this place RIGHT NEXT door as I walked out.  Man, I'm hungry!  Their Savory broth smell just made it IRRESISTABLE (Probably just HUNGRY). I guess I'll put back on the weight I lost in the gym...IMMEDIATELY!

I normally order the normal beef noodle soup.  As mentioned by previous Yelpers...a lot of noodles and not much meat.  Broth was good though, but a little on the salty side.  They're pretty expensive too.  $5.70 (Small) and $6.70 (Large).  I guess every place in the City is raising their prices and passing everything along to the customer!

I still prefer my $4.50 pho from Pho Nam in Sunnyvale....but hey, I'm in SF!...need to pay my share!
author: Gary Y.

description:
i ordered the vietnamese style tiger prawn. i was expecting at least 6 pieces of shrimp but only got 3! damn, hella shady! but let me tell you, these 3 pieces of shrimp looked like they were on fucking steroids! they were pretty huge! i actually liked the food. it was very tasty. but for $10, i just wish they would have given me more shrimp. =T 

my boyfriend ordered pho. i took a sip of the broth and it was actually pretty good! i think i'll order pho next time...

i'll give it 3 stars only cause the food was really good and its close by my house. service here is almost non-existent. the waiter only took our order, served our food, and gave us the check. other than that, i dont know where the hell he went. good thing we had our own tea kettle ...
author: B B.

description: There is so much wonderful, delicious Vietnamese food in San Francisco that it seems like a tragic waste to eat here. The pho is mediocre at best. That being said, given the dearth of options in the nearby neighborhood I end up eating here every once in awhile.
author: Ana S.

description: oh hells yes for the Vietnamese sandwiches! You can't go wrong w/either bbq chicken or the pork and it will cost les than $4! I miss going to this place! I'd get out of the gym and head directly into this place and put the calories back into me that i just sweated off on the treadmill or I'd bring my sandwich in and wait for my turn to get my pedicure at Linda's Nails next door. Nothing like shiny toes and a happy stomach to end your day!
author: Alexis D.

description: I used to go here all the time. 5 of 5 stars always... However.... PRICES RAISED! the #1 is 75 cents more! Their sandwiches are 25 cents more! More expensive for same food = lower stars... Too bad, I loved this place to death.
author: Chris L.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE! The pho is like.. hella good. The staff is real nice, but it's not very clean.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I was a bit bummed that they didn't have the gau (fat brisket) and shouldave gotten more than just tai (rare beef, got it on the side) and meat balls.. the tai was a bit thick and they only gave me three pieces.. I wasn't thrilled with the meat balls which coulda had more tendons (better consistency)

The small bowl is actually small, so that's your advance warning. Overall, still one of the best pho in SF, good broth an noodles (for the record, I go there for dinner as someone said it might be better than at lunch)

The Vietnamese coffee is a little stronger than I like (I do throw out the melted water in my glass), still ok though

They also serve rice, bun and a lot of stuff. The pho ga (chicken) could be good as well and I've seen a plate of fried chicken that looked amazing (skin and bone!)

Closed Tuesdays
author: xo x.

description: My favorite Vietnamese place in the city, and I've had quite a few. Pho is just ok?? Where else can you get a menu with 8 different types of Vietnamese soup. My absolute favorite- and of course the favorite of initiates everywhere - is the pho with tripe, beef slices and meatballs. That's the real deal, that's what you would expect in Asia. The Imperial rolls are always fresh and hot and a tasty side. Finally, they serve a fascinating Asian-American microbrew out of Anderson Valley, CA. See here: http://www.ratebeer.com/beer/ch%C3%A1u-ti%C3%AAn-pale-ale/65138/ . How cool is that? Oh no, did I forget dynamite sandwiches. Please someone, if there is a better Pho place in this price range, just let me know, I'm here for the food, not to hear negative criticism with no positive suggestions.
author: Alan S.

description: Pretty decent pho & Vietnamese coffee . Their beef balls are pretty chewy . They serve crab too .. which I don't really see in many other pho places . I'll be sure to check it out next time . Btw , you HAVE TO try their sandwiches !! They're the shit ! They're humongous and cheap . They're also very delicious and full of flavor too . The thai tea was not bad either :)
author: Eileen L.

description:
the pho is good, but there is better (and worse) to be had in other parts of the city.  if you're on ocean ave, this is the place.  if you're willing to venture elsewhere, pho garden in the richmond is the BEST pho, plus it's   a nice clean place with wonderful service.

the place is a dirtier than average pho joint, and the service is bad (meaning neither friendly nor efficient).  but the pho is cheap, so i can't complain too much.

the spring rolls and vietnamese sandwhiches are awful, stick with pho.
author: N C.

description:
Perhaps not the best place ever, but it's usually quick, affordable and the food tastes good enough usually. Although it is by name a Vietnamese restaurant, either the proprietors are Chinese Vietnamese or they're just Chinese. I used to get the wonton noodles here because I heard them speaking Cantonese, and it was decent, but I've noticed there has been a bit of decline in quality in terms of that. On the other hand, their beef stew has been consistently decent, whether it be with rice of pho.

Service is okay, but probably better if you go here enough. I've always happened to come here with people who are familiar faces here, so we always tend to get friendlier service, and it probably doesn't hurt to have some Cantonese speakers. The guy with the glasses is quite the a character, although in his own unique sort of way.
author: Derek L.

description:
Given that my fiance and I work crazy hours, this place is 1 block away and is our second home... 

I think we've tried almost everything on the menu. No joke. Some of our favorite dishes are:

-#46 fried spring rolls - crispy and meaty (I like to wrap it with the lettuce)
-#47 shrimp and pork rolls - oh man i can eat this for every meal for the rest of my life! nice big rolls - they don't skimp on the meat either!
-all the kabobs! it's really fun wrapping them at our tables
- bahn mi!! we can NEVER complain about a sandwich for $3.25. meaty and tasty vegetables on a toasted roll. beats paying $7-$8 for typical american sandwich. (the pate and pork patty is my fave, and the fiance loves the bbq pork)
-garlic noodles. it's perfect b/c it's not soaked in butter nor is it wet and slurpy, but it is definitely garlic-y and tasty.
-pho - best hangover meal ever! we get the meat on the side, and it's always fresh (at least it looks fresh). if you like spicy, try bun bo hue pho (it's a bit too spicy for my taste, but i heard it's really popular here). the broth is also really tasty and not MSG-ish at all, and the noodles are never soggy or plastic-y like other places.
-when we feel like splurging, we get the crab. tamarind and curry are my faves... the fiance loves the garlic butter. all of them are PERFECT with the garlic noodles.
-the raw meat appetizer - great to look at, even better to eat. the mixture of ingredients just goes so well with each other. i've had raw meat dishes from nicer restaurants (carpaccio) and they just do not compare with this one. (and it's a LOT cheaper here)
-we've also tried the more traditional dishes like the catfish and crepes... they were all very interesting and tasty, but we tend to stick to our favorites.
-can't forget all the yummy desserts... 3 bean drink and fried banana ice cream are our faves.
-also, best post-workout meal are the vermicelli noodles. light and healthy, and hits the spot.

some reviews said that the service is not that great... but everyone has been friendly to us since day 1. they even give us free food and drinks once in a while! (yes, that's how often we eat there).
author: Ruth T.

description: Pho Ha Tien always hits the spot when I'm craving a beefy, soupy, noodly meal for CHEAP! Pretty standard savory beefy Pho that only gets better with some spicy Sriracha sauce added. That followed by some of the most deeeelicious flan I've had in the Bay Area will make my night and has a few times since I got the flu thats going around. Makes me hungry just thinking about it......
author: Veronica J.

description: I agree with the other reviews: good neighborhood pho. But the "owner is good natured and plays with his customers. and yes, if you want to watch the NBA game of the night while eating they are happy to accomodate.
author: Stephen S.

description: A good local joint-- nothing special really. Prices are good, pho is pretty good, sandwiches are good. Service can be pretty rude sometimes... but hey, I could care less. There food is good and the price is right-- I'm not looking for anything else when I come here.
author: Solomon C.

description: We go to this place about 2 times a month.  We usually get the pho beef, chicken, or seafood.  We've been to a lot of pho places, and we really like this one.  The pho is great and the price is cheap!  It is a very basic eatery with no frills.  Clean and basic service.  I recommend when you are craving Vietnamese food but don't need anything fancy.
author: Tigger T.

description:
Close by. Nearby restaurants worse. A few dishes are actually OK by my Vietnamese Restaurant "hole in the wall" standards. 

First, I've worked with a few Vietnamese guys that have taken me around (San Jose area) to have a basic idea of what decent Pho and Bun should taste like. Second, a seemingly simple dish like Pho is apparently very complicated to get "right" as few places manage to pull it off. Third, some places have friendly, attentive service and good food, a mix of the two, or some variation of the two. 

Pho Ha Tien is a bit below average on service and overall food quality. Usually places that have "Pho" in their name are emphasizing that dish as their specialty - this place has little to brag about. Most soups I've tried there are on the bland side, something is really missing in the flavor - the broth could be plain water and I'd barely notice. One notable exception is the "curry" Pho - a dish I have only noticed at this place but it's actually very good - if you like things a little on the hot side. Also, the sandwiches aren't bad.

Overall not a place I frequently visit, as I have a car and bus fare and have come to believe that Taco Bell/KFC is about the pinnacle of what this stretch of Ocean has to offer in the way of a consistently edible meal. There's another Vietnamese restaurant down at Miramar called the "Mayflower" (yeah, funny name), and although you end up leaving there smelling like food the service is usually brighter and the food's a *little* better (can't vouch for the pho there yet). 

Pho Ha Tien will do in a pinch, but don't leave your house or neighborhood for it as a destination - you may be let down a bit. Street parking is available, but you'll have to compete with the 24 hours fitness crowd clogging up the local streets for blocks and running stopsigns.
author: Zen T.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place as it's very close to the gym I work out at and it always looks at least semi-full of people, which is usually a good sign. However, as soon as the waiter started talking to my husband and I, I got the vibe that he was none too friendly. 

We did arrive about 15 minutes before closing time so I thought that maybe, he had a long day and just wanted to go home, which is understandable. However, before the restaurant officially closed, another gruff co-worker of his started to put all of the chairs up on the empty tables without any regard for the people who were sitting next to them.

The final straw of the "completely rude service" theme of the night was when that same guy putting the chairs up got into my personal space so that he could turn off the TV that was above my head. Mind you, we had just paid so it would only be a few minutes before we would've left.

Being someone who likes to provide constructive feedback, I went up to the counter to talk to the manager to let him know what had happened. What occured next was a total joke...I would've expected at least an apology for the rudeness but the 2 servers instead started to raise their voices and get confrontational with me saying that they were doing it to make it "easier" for them to close.

Now, this place is kind of a hole in the wall and being Asian myself and knowing the general service level of most Asian restaurants, I was not expecting even 3 star service. But what they "served" up was pretty much the worse crap in terms of service, the attitude was completely atrocious.

One time in this rude place is enough for me thank you very much! I will never spend another penny in this place which is a shame as I think their food was actually ok. Just don't even go there!!!
author: Judy M.

description:
MSG Pho Yummy!!!   Not !!!

This is the only PHO resturant on Ocean Ave, been here twice, and I will never come back.  If you want to be in MSG heaven, then this is the place and top off with RUDE service from the waiters and waitress equals take your business else where.

I rather drive a little farther to the Sunset to get my PHO where the BOWL is bigger and cheaper w/o the heavy dose of MSG this place uses.
author: John S.

description: typical pho store, ate here right after 24 hour fitness... the noodle and soup is ok... didn't really blew me away or anything...
author: JessePanda C.

description: The Vietnamese sandwiches here are pretty off the chain.  The pho is decent too.  I think the reason why I really like this place is because they have Orangina.  I love that fucking drink.
author: Tommy O.

description: i like this place because is next to the 24 hour fitness. yes i know but i get hungry. i like their pho with meat specially the XL size. yes i can eat a lot when i like something. i also like their bbq chicken with rice and their bbq chicken sandwich is also damn good. the place is nice and clean and the service is good. not expensive which is nice for everyone.
author: Christian P.

description: We ventured out to the Sunset to go to Iriving to get a Viet sandwich, a new recent obsession of mine. While driving down Ocean we spotted this place and said...hey...why not? We were seated quickly. The ambiance...not much to speak of. But I had a feeling that this was not what the place was about. Looking around...it looked to be all about the pho. So we scrapped the Viet sandwich idea and went with that. We both ordered the #2 - pho with the whole cow in it - tripe, tendon, flank and beef balls (no...not Rocky Mountain oysters). A large bowl cost $6 - good deal but also the standard price in SF. The pho was pretty good - not great - adequate - satisfying. Nothing we couldn't have gotten anywhere else and not spectacular.  You get the idea. My "beef" with this place though was the service, which was pretty much non-existent. After we were obviously done nobody came by and asked us if were wanted the check. Even after flagging the lady down and indicating that fact, we still sat for 5 mins without getting the check. We ultimately ended up having to go up to the counter and ask for it ourselves. I saw that somebody else made this comment as well. Come here if you're in the neighborhood. It is like I said, adequate. But with all the great Viet places in the city, I wouldn't go out of your way to come here.
author: Steve H.

description: this is a horrible dining experience! first of all the imperial roll is horrible. it's freaky sour. Now I been to a lot of pho restaurants and tried different imperial rolls and never had they been sour! so we complained and the waitress was nice enough to ask if we would like to switch to a spring roll but i guess it was too expensive... this guy waiter said it was fine and that he had tried it. in the end he made us a new one but it was still sour.  how can u go wrong with imperial rolls. i would never come here again because they are rude and did not believe us.... (they said it always taste like that) i guess you havent had REAL good IMPERIAL ROLLS yet.... get of the damn restaurant and try some real good imperial rolls!!
author: Ann L.

description: although the food was surprisingly filling, the service was a complete mess. had to ask three different people, a total of four times, for a glass of water. not to mention the lack of emotion in each employee (at first we thought it was a simple language barrier, but eventually boiled it down to our waitress's toneless demeanor). would not recommend. there are several other pho spots near the vicinity that I would choose anyday over ha tien.
author: Taylor F.

description: been going here for 3 weeks straight after our bball game.  it's alright for a quickie....  i would recommend trying #10  sate pho...large with extra noodles.  it has a coconut base soup and a touch of spice that'll hit u after u slurp the soup for awhile.  if u like coconut soup.... u gotta give the #10 a try. :D
author: jay c.

description: i've only ordered one noodle soup dish at this place and its their bun rieu. its one of the better ones in the city. can't comment too much on their pho, i feel everyplace is about the same, had a couple bites from my bf's bowl, eh, average.  i only give 2 stars because they f*cked me over when i order their spicy crab. the crab meat was dry and i swear it was frozen or something. it wouldn't have pissed me off so bad if they didn't charge me $25 for it. a**holes.
author: Ames K.

description: i've only seen the rare beef appetizer (think of it like you would a ceviche) at one other vietnamese restaurant and it was a little hole in the wall place. i haven't tried theirs but if it's anything like the one i'd tasted before then the excellence award goes to pho ha tien! and their sandwiches are pretty good too. plus cheap and fast eats are great for right after working out at the 24 hour fitness right next door.
author: Regina C.

description: my favorite seafood pho in town.
author: Dawn P.

description: you have the employees and the owner-employees.  the employees are nice, quite friendly.  The owner-employees sometimes don't even acknowledge your presence and when they take ur order they dont say anything, not even a thank you.
author: Beck S.

description: #1 place for vietnamese sandwhiches. on a scale of 1-10, 10 being the best, I'd give this place a 8.5 for pho. service here is ok, not very cordial but who cares, their food is good.
author: Josie W.

description: I'm freakin addicted to number 17!!!!!! I eat here atleast once a week, at most three, and order the same damn thing. The people here already seem to know my life story! Prices are fabulous and I've never had problems with seating. Yeah, the place isn't the nicest looking, but who cares about aesthetics when dinner for two is less than $20?!
author: Ro F.

description: 3 stars cause this place is a hit or miss.  sometimes it can be hella good, or just okay.  oh ya, about the hair thing, my friend did find a hair in her soup.  now that i think about it, i probably ate some hair w/o noticing it, okay, im lowering it to 2 stars
author: A L.

description: Nothing out of the ordinary.  Thumbs up for having sandwiches and garlic noodles.  Not the best garlic noodles but I can't complain since they're not known for their noodles like PPQ Dungeness or Thanh Long.  Customer service here could use some help but I don't really care about that.
author: deeks ..

description: i've came here once with my friends for lunch. the food here is okay, but too much msg. i was drinking my tea, one cup after another cup! this place is pretty dirty and the restroom too. they're located right next to 24 hour and it's kinna hard to find parking. i think this is the only pho restaurant on ocean ave?
author: Valerie N.

description: Good pho and the sandwiches are delicious (I prefer the BBQ Pork).  Very reasonable prices too!
author: Scott D.

description:
In my personal opinion this is the best Vietnamese place in the city. The Pho is very good, and the lemongrass chicken and beef are great too, actually you can't go wrong with their menu; and tell me where can you have a good meal for $7 bucks, you can't even go to Burger King for that money anymore, a small con, they do use MSG but not excessively, I wish they wouldn't, but hey, you can't win them all.  It is a family friendly place too, I have been coming to this place for 7 years.  Now.....if what you are looking for is luxury,  cloth napkins, fancy tablecloths, etc., you are in the wrong place, this is a family run restaurant, clean, friendly and fairly priced, the food is super fresh and their the Vietnamese iced coffee a must have!, although my wife likes the iced tea and my kids love the frozen drinks with tapioca pearls . My absolute favorite is the beef satay pho.  For a luch on the go they also have really good sandwiches for less than three bucks, Come on people!!! you can not complaint about them putting just enough meet on their sandwiches,  they are $2.75, you can not compare them to the $5.99 monsters from Safeway or the $7.90 from Subs Inc. I repeat they are ONLY $2.75 and it is a very generous sandwich for the money, very tasty too.  Enough said, I'll keep coming back, in fact I was there last night :-)
Enjoy
author: Pablo T.

description: i don't know it gets bad reviews. the times i went the pho is great. i mean just the right amount of taste and the service isn't as bad as some other places. overall its a good place to go, its crowded on weekends though!
author: Preston L.
